title: AITA for refusing to give my parents my scholarship money?
body: I (F21) am currently a senior in college. My parents have covered my full tuition and part of room and board (through a set allowance where I pay part of my room and board and they pay part of it) throughout college, which I am very grateful for because they have three children and they don’t want us to start out our lives with student debt. They did have the stipulation that I had to completely pay for a semester of college, including tuition, room, and board, which I completely understood because I knew it would teach me more about the value of education and money and I wanted to chip in to help cover my tuition.I have worked extremely hard to earn scholarships based on my leadership and academic achievements. I am an engineer involved in several leadership roles in several extracurricular organizations. This semester, which is my last semester, I am only taking 6 hours, so I am not a full-time student. Tuition costs thousands less for part-time students than it does for full-time students, and as a result, $700 worth of my scholarships got rebated to my bank account. My parents and I were previously not aware I would get this money back, and that tuition would be less as a part-time student, and so my parents already had thousands set aside for my tuition that they now get to spend elsewhere.My dad has access to my bank account and noticed I had a large amount added to it this morning. However, my parents have since demanded that I give them this money to “go back into the pot” to help pay for my siblings’ educations. I feel as though I have worked hard to earn this money, as scholarships aren’t free— you have to put in the work to get them, and I have put forward a lot of work in rounding myself out and applying for these scholarships. I am about to start out my next chapter of life and my parents are cutting me off as soon as I graduate in May. Having this extra money can help pay for phone bills, insurance, and other costs I will incur when I start becoming completely financially independent. I am also living with my parents post-grad for 6 months and they are charging me for utilities and groceries. I offered to put the rebated money towards that, but that was shut down.They then brought up my upcoming wedding in January 2025, and threatened to cut back how much money they have agreed to give my fiancé and I for that wedding by at least $5k if I do not give them this $700 because I need to make sacrifices, as they are doing right now to save money.In the midst of this, I have been told I am selfish and do not think outside of myself for wanting this money and that I am clearly not mature enough for this next phase of my life. I do not think it is right for my parents to make it seem as if I owe them this money, even though they have helped me greatly throughout my life. I’m conflicted, however, because they are making me out to be so selfish for having these thoughts. AITA?

title: AITAH? Skiing and Yelling at Line Cutter
body: I went skiing on Saturday, along with a million of my closest friends. By mid day the mountain was crowded and there were lines at some of the lifts.There was a rope drop that day on a whole new bowl that day. The way it works at this resort/this bowl, it’s the back side. You can ski down, but you have to take the lift back up. There is no other option. Single lift, single line to get out.A friend and I take the run, get down to the bottom, and there is a good 20+ minute lift line extending up onto the run. Booooooo. But what are you gonna do? It’s a “the line is so long, may as well take off my snowboard completely” kind of line. The line was so long that people were throwing snowballs at every chair that wasn’t full.This lift ALSO has Hike Back terrain, that is CLEARLY not open, under the lift You can basically ski past the lift, and then hike back to the lift, but there are no lifts lower, it’s all hike back. And it is more then obvious that none of that terrain is open (it’s some of the last terrain they get open, it won’t be open for a while).I watch a guy and his 2 kids ski down past the line, to where the rope is up for the hike back terrain. Which is down towards the front of the line. Then I watch him proceed to side step up to the line and try to slide in. I told my friends “excuse me, I’ll be right back”.I walked over and asked him, relatively nicely, if he had noticed the giant line that we were all standing in. He completely ignores me like he can’t hear me talking directly in front of him. This is where I may have been the asshole: I then yelled at him “Hey asshole, you see the big fucking line we’ve been all standing in for the last 20 minutes, get back to the end of the fucking line”. There is some back and forth that ends with him telling me “just be cool man, Ive got my kids with me” at which time I told him “Then set a better fucking example for your kids and walk your stupid fucking ass back to the top of the fucking line NOW you fucking asshole”.The kids appear to be like 10/12 ish. They heard everything we said for sure, the rest of the line really did not (I asked if they had heard me when I got back in line).Dude picked up his shit and went to the back of the line, because I physically stood in front of him and prevented any forward progress/blocked him from integrating into the line.

title: AITA for ignoring my sister while she had been having a mental breakdown?
body: I, Female 17, and my sister, female 14, never got along too often. My sister has hated my mother since the age of 11, and always brings up how my mother is an alcoholic and is a smoker during arguments. This all started when my mom and my sister just got done bickering about how my mom was horrible at parenting us (which she really wasn’t, I had a wonderful childhood.) and she always chose alcohol over us. (Also not true) my mom began crying, which any mother would after being called a horrible parent, and my sister called her names, such as a lazy pig. Soon after this dinner was ready and I came to my sisters room and knocked on her door when I then said “sisters name, dinner is ready!” And she then replied with “I’m not hungry, leave me the f*** alone.” I went back into the kitchen and told my mother that she wasn’t hungry. She replied with “it’s not a debate, she is going to eat dinner. I’m not letting her starve.” I then knocked on the door again to which my sister opened her door, screamed in my face, and looked at me with the eyes of a deer in front of headlights. She collapsed to the floor and began to say over and over again “I can’t do it, I can’t do it, I can’t do it” it was obvious she was faking it. As someone who has had multiple panic attacks I knew she was faking it because she has faked other things before such as Tourette’s, Autism, and more serious illnesses. She was there, laying down on the floor of our hallway like a damn toddler. I was so done with the constant fighting that I straight up walked into my room, put on my headphones, and watched YouTube. Yes, you’re probably thinking I’m sick for leaving my sister in the hallway alone while she’s having a “panic attack” but by the way, she has had this behavior since the 1st grade. I’m so sick and tired of my sisters behavior, and she’s moving out in 2 years and I’m beginning to think this isn’t a phase. So, AITA?

title: AITA For what happened during dinner?
body: Hello. I am a 34 year old male. My girlfriend of 4 years is 29. So  yesterday I had a birthday dinner with friends that my Gf planned as a surprise. We all went to longhorn steakhouse. Everyone is enjoying themselves when my Gf said that she bought me a new smartphone and a new laptop. The thing is, I had already saved up enough to buy both of those things . I told her during the table that she should return them and get her money back because 1. I already saved the money for the ones I wanted to pick out and 2. She got the wrong ones. Well she was suddenly saddened and excused herself from the table to go to the restroom. While she was away my friends scolded me and said I should just be happy because they were gifts. We go back and forth when they just left money for the waiter left the restaurant. When my girlfriend got back to the table I noticed that her voice was stressed and she seemed teary. I suggested that we should just pay the bill and leave. So we go back to our apartment and we haven't really talk since yesterday when this all occurred. During the night my friends texted me and said that I should apologize to my girlfriend for being a tool. We are both at work right now. Reddit, Am I the asshole that I seemingly cause an uproar during dinner?

title: AITA for telling my director how I feel about the program I'm in?
body: (20NB)I'm in this program and it has been going poorly. There's about 30 of us, and we all pay over $3000 for tuition. We have been spending our whole days just sitting and doing nothing for three-six hours a day, and last week a teacher didn't show up for class.I emailed my directors (M&F in their 40s?) in private commenting on how uncool it was to not have a teacher, just generally saying I'm disappointed in the program, and I know others are too.In response, they berated me in front of the whole program saying that I'm asking too much, and they can't fix the whole industry in a day. They don't really address any of what I said, and when I tried to say my grievances out loud they would cut me off.I don't know what to do, and now everyone hates me.

title: AITAH for defending myself after I was told I made people uncomfortable
body: I’m (female 16) and my friend Jenny( female 17) are in a fight rn because I made her friend’s uncomfortable. My friend Jenny had her birthday party a few days after Christmas we were supposed to do secret Santa before but communication was messed up and we ended up doing it after her party. There was our friend group and then some of Jenny‘s friends me and my best friend summer Were really nervous to meet Jenny‘s friends because we didn’t really know them. We decided to act natural and try and get along with them. Me and Summer are very close and we flirt a lot with each other but we would never get anybody else involved unless they join themselves. I am very close with one of Jenny‘s friends, and I accidentally tackled her, I apologized and made sure she was OK. I also texted her to make sure she was OK later that night we watched a movie and went to bed the next day. I get a text from Jenny saying that I made multiple people uncomfortable and that I basically ran the whole party. I stuck up for myself and asked why she couldn’t have told me this yesterday because now I can’t change the past. me and Jenny got into a whole fight and I ended the convo. We were not in school at the time so I didn’t have to worry, but since coming back to school, my mental health has drained and I feel unwanted around my friends. I texted her awhile ago and I thought we were chill but I texted her again and she said we were never good. I said “wow that’s crazy” and she has sent me a whole paragraph of some things I did do and most things I didn’t. She said I was gossiping and givin dirty looks. She says I’m always playing the victim, but I’m just trying to stand up for myself. It is not uncommon for either of us to have a short temper but Jenny said she didn’t tell me I was making people uncomfortable was because she “KNEW” I would get mad. I thought she knew me better but am I the a-hole?

title: AITA- Cleaner in shared house
body: Hi!I have just found this group and can’t wait for responses as honestly, I cannot tell if I am in the wrong and know I am seeing it through my own lens.So, I am completely out of money right now. After rent, I have budgeted money for transport to job interviews and transport for if I get a job (praying it will be any day) and then I have £2 per day for food and no family for support at all and no money at all for anything other than food, like seriously, nada. I live with three other people and one of them has just gone away, but we have an agreement where if we leave, we still pay for the cleaner (I actually also don’t agree with this rule, but adding for extra context).We have all been away a lot so haven’t had the cleaner since before Christmas and now they mentioned starting it back up at the beginning of February and I asked if we could skip this one clean until mid February and do a cleaning rota and split the shared spaces (literally takes 15 mins each) and they have said no and that they want the cleaner. I then said how about I clean the house entirely (for free of course) instead of getting the cleaner, then two of the flatmates together suggested that they cover my section of the cleaning money for February but then I pay them back in March, but pay for the entire payment for the house, so I am essentially paying interest. So, it is £36 per clean, and they (the two flatmates) have said they will consecutively cover my £18 contribution for February, but then I pay £36 in March. So by the time I would pay my portion for that clean and repay the £18, then I would pay an extra £9.Honestly, I think it is ridiculous that I should have to pay interest for something when I actually have never wanted the cleaner anyway and have always paid to not make things awkward or difficult. I would get it if I said that I wasn’t going to deep clean the house, but I don’t understand why they won’t let me do that and instead are making me pay more for a luxury that I don’t want and physically cannot pay for. I will have got a job and been paid by then, but I am honestly so ridiculously deprived of like other ‘luxuries’ like not-reduced vegetables, or a haircut, dentist, new clothes to replace all my faded and unfit for interview/work clothes that I don’t think I’ll be able to afford to pay the ‘interest’ even in March as I have such a huge financial deficit right now :( £9 seems like so little but it is actually a lot to me right now.At a loss, as I have said no to the ‘interest’ but now feel like a dick. I have always been a pushover and recently have started to create boundaries but I think I honestly have trauma from so much previous and very genuine exploitation that it makes it impossible for me to get perspective in these situations as I think I have like a trauma response and think I’m under attack when I’m not lol. Sorry for making that emotional, but would really love some honest feedback.

title: AITA for not wanting to share my business’ info?
body: I had a conversation with an old college associate of mine who is also an entrepreneur. For some background information - we were on a student group together in college, and he was running an event that I helped him with. I saw firsthand how he is an idea person, but that he struggles with his implementation. For example, he would text me almost every time he had to make a major decision.I was his “boss” in the student organization, so I worked with him to get him to execute his ideas  effectively. All in all, he never publicly thanked me for my contributions to helping him (he took the credit for the entire event), although I was a very critical part of the implementation. Anyway, I just brushed it off given that it was my job to help him at the time and that the success of the initiative made the entire group look good.Fast forward a couple of years, and I’m now an entrepreneur with three businesses. He sees my posts on LinkedIn, and frequents my profile as well (I see who has viewed my profile). He sends a message saying he’s a “fan” of my LinkedIn posts and wants to catch up. Before he reached out, I sent out a post about recruitment and openings for my ventures, which had a great response. I am a bit wary of people reaching out now that I have seen a bit of success, but I obliged.We finally sit on Zoom (we don’t live near each other), and he’s going off about his revenue (sharing the exact dollar amounts he made), success, and how he struggled to balance building two businesses. He does stop to ask me about what I am working on, but no direct compliments - just the vague “I see you doing your thing.” Then he starts asking me very direct questions about what revenue streams I have for each business, how I have been able to raise funds for my business (tries to inquire about the amount of funds) and he even asks me what value my business provides to my customers and says he wants to “challenge me” to state my value proposition for him on the spot.The whole conversation seemed a bit intrusive, especially since we haven’t spoken in almost 3 years. I gave him vague answers and refused to go into specifics, which he was taken aback by.Furthermore, he assumed that I didn’t know how to coordinate a community building mechanism digitally. When I told him I did and that we use Mighty Networks, he told me that the one he uses is “better” and then sends me a link to the community mechanism he uses. Then he said that there are “synergies” between our work, but didn’t mention any explicit type of intended collaboration. Additionally, he doesn’t support any of my ventures so I’m wondering why he wants to locate synergies all of a sudden.I am a female founder and I am wondering if this line of conversation is normal for someone who hasn’t spoken to you in about three years. Am I overthinking this or is he a bit competitive? I’m wondering if I should continue to keep in touch with him. Am I the asshole for not wanting to share those details about my business with him?

title: AITA for not selling my work at the price this guy asked for it at?
body: I recently quit this band I was in because of a few reasons. One of the main reasons was one of the two co owners is a person I really dislike on a personal level and that he always devalued my input and work by ignoring me whenever I said anything in band practice or he'd start counting in while I was opening a chart or the like. He did a lot of things that were rubbish including not paying me to bring my car to an island and then taking a nap in his air conditioned car for 4 hours while I scorched in the afternoon sun before the gig.Another reason I quit was because I was physically injured by the band on the 3rd to last gig of the season and it was a huge struggle to play the last 2. I couldn't justify the good pay for being harmed by them.Anyway, after about 3 months of me leaving I get a message from this dude asking me to sell the sounds I made on my synths so that their new keyboard player would have an easier time. I checked and there are 220 unique sounds I made for their giant songbook that they'd call on the fly rather than writing a setlist.It probably took me something like 90 hours I. Total to make all of them because sometimes there are up to 8 different parts I was playing at different times in the tune or the sound itself needed a really specific envelope filter that took me over half an hour to get perfect.This guy offered me 200 dollars for all of the sounds including all the samples I made and I'm just left sitting there thinking "fuck you." To myself. Devaluing my work again at the rate of 80 cents per track even though I could get 30 bucks each on a lot of them. 200 dollars is like one night out for me and it's insulting. I thought of not answering at all which is what I've done so far but I also want to do a bunch of other things like tell him what they are actually worth, cut a deal at around 1200 and then also puty whole keyboard with sounds up for sale on Facebook Marketplace because the industry my band played in is very competitive and I know someone in one of the other bands would love to have the sounds as an advantage over my old band.Am I the asshole or is he?

title: AITA for being rude at my mom voor threatening to kick me out of her house?
body: i ( 15F ) don't have a very clean room. i have some clothes on the floor and some things on my bed but it's not as bad as you'd might thing it'd be. the reason is mainly because i have alot of school and i work aswell. my mom decided to clean my room and then she threatened me that if i don't keep it clean that i can't live with her anymore and i can only visit her. and i get being grounded and such but i thought that that was very mean to say, especially because i've been trying to keep it looking okay. so i told her that if she thinks i want to visit her after she kicked me out due to a dirty room that she thought wrong because i wouldn't want to see her after that, in reply she said that i'm trying to manipulate her. i get that it's my responsibillity to keep my room clean and the fact that i haven't isn't good but i don't think that it's appropriate to threaten with that. but at the same time i get that a 15 y/o might not be the most mature so i wanted to ask for more opinions.

title: AITA for asking my mother in law to speak to my sister about the loss of a pregnancy?
body: My sister has had several miscarriages in the last few years. It’s really taking a toll on her and the only person I know that’s had a similar experience is my mother in law, whose last baby passed at a week old. Yesterday my in laws were over and I asked if I could ask a sensitive question. They laughed and said yes. I asked my mother in law if she would talk to my sister about the grief and how she survived it.My father in law immediately glared at me and my MIL got quiet and said she would think about it. This morning I woke up to a huge text from my FIL to my husband and I saying he doesn’t know how I know about the baby but I’m a bitch for bringing it up and it isn’t the same thing. I’ve heard my in laws talk about it before, several times. Until this morning I would have told you that we’re very close and that I consider them to be friends.Aita for just asking? I just wanted to see if there was someone that had been there and could help.

title: AITA for arguing with my mother to help my sister?
body: Me 17 female argued my mother down after putting screen time and OurPact jr on my 13 year old sisters phone. Growing up I didn’t have any of that I was always aloud to go out whenever I wanted to wherever I wanted. What I mean by that is to a boys house, camping trips ect… but when my sister asks my mother always says no and makes some lame excuse that has nothing to do with her and everywhere she goes my mother or cousin has to go with her. My mother is 36 and my cousin is 35… my sister gets good grades always getting A’s,B’s and like 2 C’s each and every report card. Growing up I did not get good grades like at all. But my sister asked for one thing for her 12th birthday which she did not get. She asked my mother for a phone. My mother said she would think about it. She never got it. So I got her a iphone 14 for her 13th birthday. She was really happy but the next day my sister wakes up to not find her phone so she asks if I had it and I said no. It turns out my mother had it and her and my cousin set up OurPact jr and screen time on it. I argued with my mother because I told her that I paid for that with MY hard earned money and that she can’t just take and set it up how she wants if she didn’t buy it. She was screaming saying younger me would have never talked to her like that and that I was selfish. Just Because she let me do whatever growing up. And I stated that it was unfair because my sister deserved the same treatment that I had and that I can’t be her little girl forever and that she had another child she just had to accept it because she treats her like she’s a child that she’s babysitting. She broke down and cried and my cousin told me I was dead wrong and that I needed to get out. And got mad when I told her I would just move in with my dad. So aita?…Okay so I’m just gonna say it now my mother does not provide for us. When she wants to she does but every day she doesn’t me and my sister talked and when I turn 18 she will move in with my bc my mother doesn’t buy us stuff. I buy clothes and food for the house I’m always there for my sister. My mother is not. I’m not saying people can’t have their own opinions but I just wanted to make that clear.

title: AITA for getting mad because he can't commit to what he says
body: Tldr: 1 month long planned family gathering at 9Am. Asked him if we can join since he work from 10pm to 7am and he said yes and we'll just leave at 7:30AM. The day of the event had to ask him several times if he can really come so I can ask my parents to pick us up (my kids and I) since they will leave at 7AM. He said he can do it and will still leave at 7:30. Then 7AM came and suddenly told me he can't come and just ride with my parents, they already left and II got angry.My husband works from home at night from 10pm to 7am, Wednesday to Sunday. We have a planned month long family gathering (my side) at 9AM today (Sunday) which we both agreed to attend to given his work sched. FYI, I even asked him twice if he can really join since I know he won't have enough sleep and he also needs to drive but he said he can do it and we'll just leave at 7:30AM.Fast forward to today, when I woke up at 6AM I found him sleeping which is fine especially if his done with work. Woke him up to tell him if he can really join us since he looks sleepy, I said we can just ride with my parents but he said he can do it he just need to have a quick nap again. Around 6:30, Im done taking a bath and woke him up to tell him to shower already since we have 2 kids (2 years old and 10 mos.) we need to prep. After a few minutes of putting make up and fixing hair I found him in the couch sleeping again, so I asked again if he can really come with us. FYI, I keep on asking because I need to give a heads up to my dad since they will leave at 7AM. So he said yes and just let him take a nap again until 7AM, so when I woke him up for the last time he suddenly asked if we (my kids and I) can ride with my parents since he's sleepy.So I got mad, I kept asking since the day we gave our commitment up to today and suddenly he'll just say that we should ride with my parents knowing that they will leave at 7AM.  I mean why say now, when they already left. When he saw me angry he said he can come again, which made me ask him again if he's really sure now because I'm planning to call my parents back if they can come by again. In the end he took a bath and we left at 7:40AMMy anger just piled up today because I literally had to carry his weight today but it's a different story.

title: AITA for getting mad at my friend who made fun of my fav band?
body: I had this friend, she used to make fun of a band I loved. I now look at the band as being a little cringey yet still enjoy their music.I love music a lot, I don't go a day without mentioning a song or band I love. I used to be obsessed with a rock band. Many people made fun of this due to the lead singer being “cringey”. However, this band used to be my passion. I used to talk about it a lot but found not a lot of my friends really listened. I feel I may have been a little annoying but my passion is music and I love how their songs are put together. My friend at the time used to make fun of me for this, along with other things they used to make fun of. Every time I would mention this band, or any band, they would immediately be horrible even if they enjoyed the music before I expressed that I liked them. As if everything I said they always had to disagree to create conflict. It made me angry when I would try to talk about my passion and get immediately interrupted by mean comments.In the end, I got fed up of this, i couldn't even talk about something I love to my friend so I caved. I posted something my instagram story with the bands music in the back, my friend then replied making fun of me then continued to screenshot their comment and posted it to their story. she would add a mean comment about the band and continue to post the argument on her story slagging off my music taste. The fact that she knew how much I loved the band and continued to mess with me about it. As the argument got more heated she continued to post it on her story so I joined in too, we ended up arguing through posting on our stories. This made her mutuals get involved as they begin to make fun of my music taste too, going as far as messaging me and making fun of my appearance. This was all happening on our stories. I got so pissed at this point, my friend thought it was all banter until I posted a bad photo of my friend on my story with the text 'I love [band] so much!’ She then got mad as all my mutuals can view the bad photo with the text.She decided to copy my idea and post a bad photo of me captioned 'I hate [band], their music is so shit and I'm a bitch'. In my opinion the picture was 10 times worse as it was edited by her to make me look bad. I did once tell her to delete that picture of me and she said she did, but clearly lied as that picture was now shared to over 1k people I don't know. At least my account was private.To make it worse, I was even tagged in her post meaning I had now loads of people making fun of and my music taste. I was forced by her mutuals to take down my story, I did, yet my friends story is still saved on her page for everyone to see. AITA?

title: AITA for not letting my brother get the best possible phone?
body: I(16F) have a little brother(13M) which is very spoiled. While my father tries not to show any favoritism and has given us everything we’ve wanted and a roof over our heads my brother has grown very entitled. I feel very fortunate and try to cut my spending, have my own job and try to get most of the money I spend from work, however my dad has told me I don’t need to work and if I ever need money for something I can ask him.In the past year my brother has gotten an $800 electric scooter,a $400 oculus and a $2400 PC which is the most recent purchase. With every purchase my dad asks me if I want anything, I tell him “no you’ve already given me enough by being my dad and I don’t need those things to be happy”. My brother often gets expensive clothes from stores like Nike and Calvin Klein while I usually thrift or buy from stores that offer cheaper.He likes to brag about this infront of my friends.The one thing I have over him is the fact that I go to a better school than him which is his fault. I got into a private high school because I was a top student. They also have a middle school program however my brother didn’t get in due to his low grades and bad recommendations. He created a fuss and I almost lost my spot in the school because my dad said we should be loyal(basically what he said was if they don’t want all of us they don’t want any of us)he got into a similar school but his doesn’t offer IB.Moving on to what happened a few days ago, I asked my dad for a new phone because mine was getting slow, but my dad told me to wait a bit so he could afford to buy me the best one, I was fine with that. I was taking a nap and my brother kept turning on the lights in my room, I asked him nicely to please stop but he didn’t stop so we got into an argument. One thing led to another and he flung my phone across the room, causing it to break. That’s when my dad got angry so he gave me enough money to buy any phone I wanted and that he wanted to wait to buy 2 phones but after this he said that he didn’t need to anymore. I bought the iphone 15 plus because I did research and found that it was the best for me.Here’s where I might be the asshole, after a day my brother started sucking up to my dad and afterwards he told me “Your brother is my kid too so I’ll buy him whatever phone he wants as well” I reminded him of what my brother did to my previous phone and about the constant torment, after some back and forth I told him I would be fine if he buys my brother the same phone as me but he said my brother wants the Pro Max and that he also gave me the option to buy it, but I chose the Plus model instead. I said that my brother doesn’t even deserve the regular model and my father said that’s not my call to make as it’s not my money. I stormed off into my room and we haven’t talked since but my brother came into my room about an hour ago because now my dad is considering not buying him the Pro Max and I’m starting to think I might be the asshole so AITA?

title: AITA for stealing mums makeup to look like gerard way?
body: I (17M) took my mums (52F) makeup to try to do a Gerard way inspired makeup look.My mother is a very religious woman who comes from a home where men are not allowed to wear any form of beauty product. I have always honoured and respected my mother as a woman and obeyed her rules.I am not someone who cares much for makeup anyway so it did not come off as a big issue to me, as of recently, I had seen some posts online of people trying out makeup to resemble celebrities they like and I thought I would try to do a look similar to that of Gerard way from the band MCR.In my head this was not a huge deal as I was only at home and was careful with her makeup products, it was overall harmless and I used minimal amounts to avoid a struggle with removing it.Unfortunately for me I had been caught in the act and my mother was fuming with rage, I was grounded for 4 months and was shamed relentlessly for behaving in such an unholy way.As if this was not enough she proceeded to tell my father I was worshipping the DEVIL and straying from God by mimicking Satan loving men after I had shown her the MCR band members (she forced me to tell her what made me do this otherwise punishment would be worse).As of now I am constantly being monitored by my parents and I am writing this on a friend's device.Am I in the wrong?

title: AITA for possibly ruining my friend's chances
body: I (15m) have a semiformal dance coming up in February where we can 'invite' other people to it. I have a friend who we can call Venus (14nb) who is my absolute best friend. We've been through some drama together and known each other for two years now, and practically all the said drama has been about romantic relationships.Anyways, a new girl came to our school this year who we can call Emma (14f) and she instantly became close with Venus, and I also enjoy talking to her as a pretty close friend. They text every night and I get small glimpses of just how long their conversations are, so I could tell that they were pretty good friends.Yesterday, I'd just finished asking two other close friends to the dance and they said yes. Just as those two were walking away, Venus came up to me and whispered that they wanted to ask Emma to the dance.Here's the part I think I'm the AH. Emma was walking by right at that second, so I simply went up to her and asked if she was coming to the dance. Venus joined us fast. Emma said yes and I was satisfied, so I left them to go to our lunch period. A minute or so later, Venus joined me quietly and whispered that they got friendzoned.I’ve never had a romantic relationship. I don’t know if I’ve ever actually felt romantic love yet, if at all. Remember when I talked about the drama we went through with romantic relationships? They were all because of yet another friendzone with Venus and a different girl, who left school last year.After school, Venus attempted to reconcile with Emma, who would storm off whenever Venus approached. They really did try to get my advice, but as I said, I’m pretty useless when it comes to romance compared to other friends, but Venus is my best friend and I want to help them.Here’s another concerning thing.Venus texted me last night, they sent Emma an 826-word text apologising and saying that they didn’t want drama, and still wanted to be friends (the exact word count). I feel so bad. It was totally me that ruined that chance, by just going up to Emma and asking so nonchalantly.This morning, Venus instantly covered up the 800-word text with their hand when they opened it and requested us not to read it, but told us that Emma hadn’t read it yet either. I stayed silent during a conversation that Venus and the other two had discussing it, where the apology text was deleted.Emma's been whispering with other girls and they've been shooting Venus looks, I’m really worried because the previous time that romance drama came into my life, my last friend group fell apart. I'm typing this from home after school on Friday.I know I'm the AH, I’m also looking for advice. I want to make my best friend happy and stay friends with Emma. Venus isn’t even looking for anything other than platonic friends, now.tl;dr: I accidentally asked a girl to a dance without realising my best friend had a crush on her. she’s been avoiding the two of us and I need advice on what to do, or say to my friend.

title: WIBTA if i told my parents that my relationship is my business?
body: i’m 18F, very close to turning 19. i’ve been getting close with a 21M. we’ve met a few times and it’s been great! he makes me super happy, is very understanding towards me. the time i’ve spent with him has been wonderful. we’ve agreed between us to start slowly, as neither of us have any experience with anything relationship related.this is where my parents come in. we are going on an official date on monday, and he wants to see where this goes. we both come from strict families. i’m of course very excited, but also nervous. i really like him but i dread having to tell my parents.when i do tell them, i want to tell them to stay the hell out of my business. i want to tell them that i don’t want to hear their opinions, i don’t want them to question it. i don’t want to hear a single thing from them about it, aside from support for us both. because i feel it’s none of their business - i’m an adult. i wasn’t born yesterday, i want to be allowed to figure this out myself.i’m aware this is a very aggressive approach, but i just want to be allowed to be happy without being told i’m doing everything wrong or that i should leave him. this is something i worked so hard to build.my parents got together when my mother was 18 and dad was 25, so i don’t see the problem they’d have with almost 19/21.WIBTA if i told them to stay out of it?

title: AITA for not inviting my friend's boyfriend to my graduation?
body: I (18F) graduated last year. I invited my friends and my boyfriend. My friends were Anastasia (18F), Kate (19F), Molly (19NB), Thaiel (17M) and my boyfriend Todd (22M).However, my friend Kate wanted her boyfriend to come, which I disagreed as I only wanted to invite close friends, which I think it's completely understandable.Some background: I had an argument with Thaiel and Molly (They are a couple. We met Molly first, but Thaiel really got into the group and I consider him as a close friend. He doesn't feel like "my friend's boyfriend. It was just different, he's an alright dude) at one point, and me and my other friends decided to give them some space.  As we gave them space, we decided to go on outings by ourselves, where Kate's boyfriend was invited.I was starting to talk to my boyfriend at that point, and I was so excited to tell my friends about it! But Kate and his boyfriend Richard (24M), were kind of rude about it, and Richard started making comments like "be careful, because men suck. and maybe he only wants you for you know what" and I felt really bad because I never asked for advice, I just want to share how excited I was about Todd. He also said stuf like "the love only lasts 4 months, don't get too comfortable", which I replied with "so you and Kate don't feel love anymore" and explained it was diffrent.In another gathering, Kate started making comments about how much money her bf made, which made me feel uncomfortable (she said this because I told her that my bf bought a game on Steam, which i only thought it was kind of silly and fun, and she said "how is he gonna spend money on that? blablablabla. my bf makes more money and doesn't spend it on dumb stuff").Eventually we all had problems with Richard, and caused the group to fall apart because we told her that we were uncomfortable. We haven't seen him since we told her this.Now, some days before my graduation I invited my friends, including Kate. But she was ofended my boyfriend was coming and started saying like "if you can bring your boyfriend why can't I?", and I explained to her how I just wanted close friends to come, which she took as an offense, and she decided to not come.I want to keep in mind that I have known Kate for YEARS. We were friends long before she met this guy.Kate is also losing her whole personality because this guy literally told her that he is embarassed of the way she acted. She was always the kind of crazy friend who never gave a shit about what people thought of her, but she stopped acting like this when she started dating this dude. And even said to me that the reason why she couldn't come is "she has a responsability because they share a bed and a relationship".She left a groupchat we had to talk about this, without Molly and Thaiel, because she's pissed at us that "we don't accept her boyfriend". We are super sad to see her go, and I don't know if it's my fault.

title: AITA for getting annoyed at my mum for going in my room
body: For context I'm autistic and because of that i don't like people going into my space and touching/moving my belonging.So I came home today to find that my mother's been into my room and neatened it for me by making my bed and 'organising' my bookshelf which she knows has a specific system that I hate for people to change and she didn't put them into the correct order.When she got back I asked her to not go into my room and move my things because I don't like other people moving my things or going into my room when I'm not there. I'll admit I could've asked in a slightly more polite way but I was annoyed as she already knows these things.She then got annoyed at me for being ungrateful and not appreciating what she does for me. So was I the asshole?

title: AITA for keeping my step-sister's secret from our parents
body: My(15M) step-sister(17F) Sasha was put on a diet by our parents, which is technically my mom and her dad, but, I never knew my real dad and my step-dad's awesome so, I dropped the " step" and I see him as my dad.The diet itself I think is a joke because they really just told her to go on a diet and left it at that, nobody is actually helping her eat better or exercise. title: AITA for been the cause of firing someone
body: I 24(F) work in a field that men are so dominant in , and I am the only female worker at my company who is not related to them (they all come from the same region and they basically know each other ), I got hired there based on my experience and qualifications so I beat up a lot of men and the director  is such a nice person and he is so understanding, I basically work directly with 6 other men plus my boss , my colleagues are all young men and all married and not my type at all , we don’t chat or stuff like that we keep it professional because they see me as a very open minded person because I am a female older then their wives that actually work and stuff (not all Of them actually , I get along so well either the older let’s call him K he taught basically every trick I need to know )… so few days ago my colleague Lets call him A brought his childhood friend to work with us he basically pushed him and took other people’s place to make him work with us (IDC) it wasn’t a problem till they started implying that I should quit and that this is a man’s job and that I don’t fit , I overheard them so many times so I talk with K and he said they are jealous because the supervisors trust me with some critical info and not them he just said if Ignore them . K told me today to watch out because they are so angry with me and that he already notified the boss because that believe I did it on purpose. Am I the a**hole for telling about them?

title: WIBTA if I buy a house for myself only and leave family in their foreclosed house?
body: The family consists of mom, female relatives "Patricia (47)", "Felicia (30)", and "Arianna (30)". Dad left us 16 years ago, and Patricia was the second adult providing for the family.When I was born I was suffocated or something, and was labeled as developmentally disabled. No one in the family ever looked past that label. Felicia and Arianna always treated me like a joke and excluded me from everything.Whenever I was alone with either Felicia or Arianna, she'd basically bully me. Past 2009, whenever I told Mom what those two did to me, she would do the same thing to me.Mom only saw me as disabled and incapable of anything, and wouldn't even bother to raise me. I never had a chance to grow.My school closed down and Mom put me in an ABA institution afterwards. The staff there made me completely regress, but Mom assumed the disorder was why. I suffered a mental health crisis when I was 10, which got me in a hospital. Mom only blames the disorder, so the staff who abused me were allowed to continue. Mom also grounded me for making her miss a day of work because of my "little attitude".The big rule at the institution was to  Just Follow Directions™. If no one told me to do a thing, I should never do it until I'm told. If someone makes me uncomfortable, I still needed to just follow their directions. At home, I stopped asking Mom for basic necessities like soap and underwear. I quit showering and doing laundry as that was being a good kid, being out of the way. I eventually smelled horrible, which was blamed on the disorder. Also, when I finally had the courage to ask for new necessities again, Felicia and Arianna would find it so funny that some R Word scum would want something so mature that even they would use. Mom and Patricia found it funny as well, asking why I suddenly want to be so "fancy". I finally got back on track with hygiene when I was allowed to shop alone, as I was able to buy anything without judgment, and hide it after I bought it.From late 2018 to mid 2020, Mom treated me much worse than the usual. Much much worse. To this day it's really hard to talk about.In 2021, Mom crossed yet another line, one that I also refuse to write about. I was so offended by how the family treated me that I impulsively changed my whole name without publishing, but a slip-up revealed my name to Felicia and Arianna. They of course found it funny and were belittling towards me. They've treated me this way about my name basically forever.Now, Patricia has terminal cancer and is dying. If a new house is bought, it will be in Felicia's name. Felicia is extremely petty and will force me to comply with her as she owns the house. That's just how she is. I've been working harder since Patricia's cancer diagnosis to avoid this (and it paid off!).Is it justified to leave them with nothing or should I forgive them?

title: AITA for maybe losing a friendship after refusing to pay for my gym pal’s pole dancing class once I “outed” myself?
body: My wife(31) and I(33) have been part of an all women gym for a few years now, it features classes like Circuit, Aerobics, Yoga Pilates, Zumba, Spin Cycle and yes Pole Dancing. There’s child care provided at certain hours but some classes are after the care center closes.My (32f) gym buddy “Kat” wanted to take a pole dancing class but was too bashful to take it alone. She asked me to take a beginners class with her starting after the new year even though I’ve had some experience in the past. It is 6 weeks of 12 classes for $130 meeting at specific times. Our first two weeks of classes(2 classes a week) were mostly fine but Kat is really competitive and doesn’t like being the one that needs extra help at the gym however she was tolerating the investment.Classes are paid for on top of gym fees up front with no refunds even after missing a class.The incident happened in our fifth class. I had to bring my baby (7 months). Over the years I’ve seen women bring babies after hours at times so it wasn’t entirely abnormal, mine was in his carrier asleep along the wall for the beginning of class but he woke up toward the end and earned himself a lot of attention.One of the younger gals(Early 20s) was “uncomfortable being so dressed down in front of a boy” wearing cheeky spanks and a sports bra. I told her she could wear more if she wanted. She argued back “or you could take him home so he’s not over here oogling us” I laughed as I told her with sarcasm “you’re more likely to get ogled by me than my baby.”That shut her up.Later Kat said she was embarrassed by the scene and wished I hadn’t come with my son in the first place sliding in a jab “it’s not like you need the class anyway.” This hurt me because when I was 18 my dad cut me off financially ‘for being gay’ and I put my gymnast/dance background to use dancing exotically. She knows it.So it actually hurt me and fairly deeply.I asked why she would say that and she said she was “so embarrassed” she no longer wants to go to class with me. I asked her again, why she was so embarrassed and she stated I ‘came out’. I didn’t. Yes she already knew I was married to a woman and no she never had a problem with it.I told her I’m not going to stop going when it’s already been paid for. She then said I could pay her for the other half of classes she “can no longer take” and I refused.

title: WIBTA if i dropped this play that i’m in?

title: AITA for refusing to pay my friend back and embarrassing her?
body: I'm a 19F uni student, and I'm sort of friends with "Rebecca", a girl who's the same age as me who also goes to my uni. Us and a group of friends went out this weekend to stroll around the city and explore, and stopped at a coffee place to get something to drink while we walked. I ordered a small coffee, but when I went to tap my debit card, it wasn't working (dumb problem with my bank, have resolved it since). I asked if anyone could spot me this one time and Rebecca paid for my coffee. I thanked her, it was like 2 dollars. We just walked around and did some window shopping and all seemed to be fine.As we were wrapping up and walking back to campus, Rebecca said "Oh yeah, OP, you owe me for that coffee earlier." I laughed because I genuinely thought she was joking and a few other girls laughed too. Rebecca immediately got defensive and it became clear she was serious. I said, "Oh, sorry, I thought you were kidding because it was like $2.50..." Rebecca went on this weird rant about how I don't know her status and how I was making her feel bad about her income and how I was being really classist and weird about something that wasn't that big of a deal. This made me see red because Rebecca is RICH. Like generational wealth rich. She didn't even need to go to college, but she went because her parents thought it would be good for her and she wanted to have the "college experience". Yes, this girl is basically at university for fun. She also makes a lot of ignorant comments about other people's money and income.I pointed this out to her and said that while two dollars isn't that big of a deal at all, it was ridiculous for her to ask for it paid back when she has millions of dollars in a trust fund since she was born. She got really upset at this and stormed off, then sent me a series of pissed texts and hasn't replied to me. The other girls agreed that she was being stupid but they also said I was being petty because two dollars isn't a big deal for either of us, so I should just pay it back to her. While it's true that two dollars isn't much, it's more the principal of the thing for me now. How can she accuse me of classism when she is not only rich, but greedily scraping back every penny she spends on others? I do think I may have gone too far by humiliating her and bringing up her family in front of so many people, some of which weren't aware of her situation and now think she's an idiot. AITA?EDIT: I didn't mention I have bought Rebecca things many times before, totalling up to a lot more than $2.50. Including a meal (at a fast food place) because she forgot her money, and never once did I ask for her to pay me back. I don't understand how she can be so petty to ask me for such a small amount when I have had her back so many times before for so many more things.

title: WIBTA if I talked to my BIL about not being invited to a family trip?
body: I need to know if I IWBTA in this situation. Or if I need to calm down and ignore it. Or if I'm justified.Background: I'm a young widow. My husband died in Oct 21. He dies suddenly without warning. My FIL died in January of 22 from broken heart syndrome. I've always been close to my husband's family. They love me. The death of my husband didn't change anything between us, it united us. My MIL and I speak every day. We are close.Info: After losing 2 family members in such a short time, after the funerals, solving the estates, etc, we talked about taking a family trip. A week in a cabin in the woods by the lake, or going to Disney, or somewhere in Europe. Do something for us, to feel better.The plan was always to go me, my two BILs, SIL, and MIL.Last year BIL and SIL went to London for their honeymoon. They had been together for 25 years and after having kids that are now adults, decided to go on that trip. When they returned, they mentioned wanting to go to Italy in 2024. BIL (P) mentioned wanting to go, and I too said I wanted to go. MIL too. We decided that this would be our family trip after dealing with two deaths.I mentioned how important that trip was, as I've been dealing with grief and really needed it. Every time the occasion came and we talked about Italy the conversation was the same. We can't wait! It'll be fun! We need it! It'll bring us closer as a family!Not once did I hear, or felt like I wasn't part of that conversation. Not once. Always included, and no one ever mentioned that I wouldn't be welcomed.Tonight MIL messaged me and we talked about her day. Then, she mentioned that BIL, SIL, and BIL2 are going to Rome in May. She said she couldn't afford it so she's not going and is sad. This was news to me. I replied that I was hurt and heartbroken that I wasn't asked. Especially after talking about a trip and Italy for so long. I was honest with my feelings and told her it would change things for me and the family and how much part of it I feel.She mentioned how for Christmas they bought me my car carpets, and they were expensive and how I shouldn't feel sad or less part of the family or less loved by them. They assumed I wouldn't be able to afford it (I can). They thought I wouldn't like it because I prefer to plan ahead while they don't (It doesn't matter to me).I told her that the carpet and the trip were two different conversation for me. That it didn't change anything, they didn't ask. Or even consider me once. All the trip was discussed, planned, and paid without asking me once. I apologized for making her feel like I sounded like I wasn't thankful, but as a widow who is lonely, I was really looking for that trip.I want to call BIL tomorrow and ask what happened. If I did something to make them feel like I couldn't be part of the trip. I genuinely wanna know.WIBTA?

title: AITA for not taking my moms dog for a pee walk?
body: I’ve never made a Reddit post so if I don’t do it right I’m sorry.So I(27f) have two kids ones 6 and the other is 4 months old. I live about 20 minutes from my moms(66) house and have let her dog out many times last minute unplanned. She asked me what I was doing today and I explained that I would be having friends over for dinner this evening, she asked if she stayed out “too late” for lunch if I would let her dog out. I assumed because she was leaving at 11:30 for lunch at 12:30 that her version of late was 3:30-4. At 5 o’clock she texted me and asked if I would go over and walk her dog to pee. I explained that my guests were already here and that I had assumed she was already home. At this point my exclusive BF baby was also hungry but I didn’t say that. She blew up on me saying that I was supposed to be responsible for her dog and that she was depending on me. I explained to her that I couldn’t just leave my guests and that I figured she was already home when she didn’t text me earlier. She hung up on me then texted me a few minutes later saying “ You know, I always thought that you would have my back if I needed you because nobody else does so” and I said “I’m sorry that you feel that way, I’ve come to let her out quite a few times when it was last minute. Like I said when you didn’t text me by 3:30-4 I figured you were home.” she responded with “ Do you ever take responsibility ? I depended on you to take care of my dog. And yes, I may have asked you to come over and walk her a couple of times it takes 30 minutes to do that so I’m sorry that I’ve taken up that much of your time. Don’t worry it will not happen again I promise you that.” I haven’t responded and I really don’t know how because I don’t feel like what I did was wrong. She knew I was having people over and waited until 5 to text me after she had been gone for almost 6 hours. Now she is blaming me for not dropping everything to make a 50 minute trip not 30, because she didn’t feel like coming home. AITA?

title: AITA for threatening to pull my kid out of a basketball tournament?
body: Edit: I appreciate the constructive criticism from the comments. That is what I was looking for when I posted in the first place. I felt like the situation should have been handled differently but wasn't sure what we were doing wrong. Moving forward my husband and I (who have no experience in school sports) will try to have better and more realistic expectations and make proper changes to our interactions with her coach.Just a little background info: my husband and I have a 6th grade daughter (12yo). This is her first year at a small Christian school and she wanted to be involved in sports with her friends. She made their volleyball team and grew a lot during that experience. She also tried out for basketball and made the team. She's never played contact sports and it was a bit of a learning curve for her (and still is) but she tries. Her team has played a few games and she played minimally which she said she was fine with because it was still so new to her.Recently the school got together with a number of other Christian schools to have a tournament on the weekend. My husband was excited to see our daughter play because his work schedule has caused him to miss most of her games so far. Our daughter's school required the players to be at the school where it was taking place (in another town) at 8:30AM for a game at 8:50AM. She played very little. No big deal. She's no Michael Jordan or LeBron James. We understand that she won't be playing a lot because she's still a beginner. Her second game was at 1PM. Yes, several hours later. We watched the whole game. This team was tough, but our daughter's team pulled ahead by 15 points. There was 2 minutes left in the game and our daughter was finally put in. For less than 30 seconds of playing time. I know 30 seconds is a lot in basketball, but the other team hadn't even scored in that time.My husband was pissed and wanted to go home. Half of his day off was gone and he had seen his daughter play less than 2 minutes total for both games. We approached the coach and told her we wanted to know why our daughter wasn't getting much playing time and said we were going to leave with our daughter if she wasn't going to get a chance to play even when her team is ahead and there is less than 5 minutes left in play. The coach told us she had had a conversation with the team before the start of the first game saying some of the players would be doing a lot of cheering and encouraging and not much playing because it was a tournament and they really wanted to bring home the trophy for the girls. She also essentially said our daughter wouldn't be doing really any playing in the next game either, and made another comment about how she shouldn't be discussing this at this time and she needed to go. The next game wasn't for another hour and a half. Our daughter wanted to stay and cheer on her friends so we let her,  but it left a bad taste in our mouths.Yes, our daughter was no star player and we didnt expect her to play a lot, but the kids are in 6th grade. There were a couple other girls who had little playing time and only in the second half of the game. I think they should be allowed to be more than benchwarmers and to do more than cheer for their teammates for an entire game. Am I completely out of touch? Were we just being overprotective, helicopter parents?

title: AITA for telling/ not telling my cousin’s bf the baby might not be his?
body: My cousin and I moved in together recently since she broke things off with her boyfriend and was officially ready to move on. She had a tinder and was talking to multiple people, which is fine, however she found out she was pregnant not long after. There are 3 or 4 guys I know she was hooking up with during the time she should have gotten pregnant (I calculated this based on her official due date). She told her ex boyfriend and claims it is his and I don’t think he has any idea she has been hooking up with other people. I asked her if she’s sure it is his and she said yes, but she can’t possibly know that. I don’t think he was even around during that week of conception, but could be wrong. Even if they did, there’s still a chance it’s not his. They also were together for years without getting pregnant and did nothing at all to prevent pregnancy so she said in the past she thought she was infertile. Now I’m wondering if maybe he is the one that can’t have kids. It has been weighing on me as I am the only person that knows this information. I don’t want to go behind her back and tell him and leave her in a bad situation as she currently has no car or job and relies on him to get where she needs to go but it’s still pretty fucked up to me that she wasn’t honest and didn’t think to do a DNA first. Maybe she is scared or clueless I don’t know. I asked my mom what she thinks I should do and she said to mind my own business and hopefully if it’s not his the truth will come to light. I have severe anxiety and confrontation does not come easy to me. I was thinking of sending an anonymous message to him but don’t know what to say or how to do that. His family is also already super invested and she spends most of her time with them. If the baby is not his, it would crush them. Would I be the ahole to say something? Or am I the ahole for keeping quiet?

title: AITA for refusing to forgive my SIL?
body: I( 28 F) been with my husband(28 M) for 9 years and married for 2. Over the years I’ve had countless disagreements with my SIL(32 F). She is on drugs and had bpd that she refuses to undergo treatment for.Over the years there has been a repeating pattern of her being super nice to husband and I for a few months and then switching and being extremely hostile and nasty.The last 2 years she has really had it out for me. I work in the adult entertainment industry. My husband and I both discussed this career choice and he is comfortable with the work I do( for reference it’s stripping and online content). I don’t actually have sexual relations with anyone. Well SIL is not happy about this and has called me a slut and whore and had said I bring shame to the family numerous times. I don’t really care about that and still always made an effort to at least be civil. The real kicker is that on Christmas Day we announced we are expecting our first child after 6 years of infertility I got pregnant naturally. Obviously we are so happy and excited but when my husband told her the news she said I’m so sorry! He was like what no congratulations? and she was like I can’t say that all I can say is I’m sorry.She then proceeded to attack me saying I am the reason she doesn’t get to see her brother and that I stop him from talking to the family and that I’m the reason he struggles with his mental health( he recently had a severe mental health crisis but is doing better now) . Which isn’t true at all, if anything I encourage him to see his family more because he is pretty anti social and a house hermit that prefers to stay home. Then husband tells me that she told him he should get a paternity test since I’m such a slut and it’s mighty convenient that I finally got pregnant. He has called her out numerous times on her behaviour but it doesn’t stop her.Husband still tries to be friendly with her as that it’s what his dad wanted and his dad passed away 2 years ago so for the sake of respecting his dads wishes he still tries to have a good relationship with her. I however am done at this point and refuse to speak to her or even acknowledge her presence when we visit his mum. Now his mum is saying I should be more forgiving and let it go that she has said so much nasty things about me because lately( the last month) she has been really good and stable and it’s not her fault she treats people like this because she has a mental illness. I disagree because like I said she can be really nice for a period of time but it never lasts and in the next couple of weeks or months I know she will be back to her usual antics and I honestly just hate her at this point.Husband respects my views and understands why I feel the way I do but I get the impression he also thinks I should just let it go and forgive her. AITA for holding a grudge and for not being empathetic to her mental health struggles?

title: AITA if I cut off the power to my roommates room?
body: I have never posted one of these but idk if it’s taking it too far or not. This person has been living with me for almost a year now and we were friends only 6 months or so before that. We split bills 50/50. They told me when I came back from vacation over new years on the 8th (over text) that they didn’t get hired on full time and no longer had a job and doesn’t have rent for January.. I ended up paying my part of rent and begging my landlord to give them more time. They gave an additional 2 weeks to get rent together. I asked my roommate just a few days ago if they almost had rent and they said no, that they will not be paying and supposedly will be moving out next week. They have completely ignored and avoided me all month, so much so that they won’t even have an in person talk with me. I just got the electric bill in and asked them if they are going to pay their part and they have not responded yet. I have already switched the WiFi pw so they can’t use it because it’s not free so I feel it’s only necessary for the power to go next. I have the breaker box in my room behind a locked door. So will I be the asshole of if I cut the power to their room when they inevitably say they will not be paying their part of electric?Ps. It wouldn’t be a big deal but I have a 3 year old and I am already barely making ends meet, electric is 260 this month due to needing the heater and with her not paying rent this puts me in a bind this next month trying to catch up on what she didn’t pay.Edit for clarity: this person has been working door dash since I came back (so they have money) and agreed to pay rent within the additional 2 weeks given. It’s coming down to the wire and now is saying they won’t. I opened my door to them in the beginning and they didn’t pay rent, buy food or any other living necessities for several months, all out of my pocket. At this point I just feel used and all the help I gave is just in the wind because now they are doing me dirty by just bailing. Maybe if they would have said something a month and a half ago and maybe asked for help I wouldn’t be in this position.

title: AITA for telling my Grandma with Alzheimers that my daughter changed her name in her honour?
body: My (46F) daughter (22F) changed her name last year in honour of my grandma - her great grandma - and their bond from her childhood. She spent a lot of time with her great grandma as a child and they grew apart for a while but became close again when my daughter reached adulthood, its a beautiful relationship.My daughter hasn't been able to visit for a while because shes away for school, so last week while I visited my grandma I mentioned to her that my daughter changed her name. When she realised it was about her name she just lit up and seemed so happy! It was a great moment, especially as there have been points where she cant even remember my daughters existence - not to mention shes always been a very serious and less-emotional person, so these moments feel extra precious. I know my daughter spent a long while planning how she would incorporate grandma's name into her own and so I was really happy to see that my grandma liked it and felt honoured by it. I thought my daughter would be thrilled to find that out. Recently she has been declining a lot and we're all worried about her and trying to arrange a visit, including my daughter, but I just wanted to make sure someone told grandma about the name change before things got bad and she forgot.Later, I told my daughter about this but she got quiet and upset without telling me why. I only told my grandma about the name change because my daughter has been out of state for a few months and didn't have enough money to come back and visit but my daughter seems really upset over this. AITA?EDIT to clarify: In a text she told me I 'crossed a line' but wont say anything more when I ask. She was excited to see her grandma again until I said this so I do think she wanted to do it herself. grandma is still somewhat lucid maybe half the time but she might forget about the name too.

title: AITA for saying my girlfriend made me fat?
body: My (M23) girlfriend (F23) and I have been dating for two years now. I was a swimmer in college, but since graduating, I've gained a little bit of weight. Nothing crazy, but I'm 5'11, and 170 lbs, up from ~145 in college. I used to have abs, but I haven't really cared as much about working out anymore, since I just feel comfortable in our relationship, and I know she doesn't care what my body looks like.We recently went out on a double date with some friends that I haven't seen in a while, Jack and Erica (fake names). We're all having a good time at dinner, joking around. Jack and I have known each other for a long time, and always tease each other, so he makes fun of me and says that it looks like I've gotten a bit chubby since we last saw each other. I laugh it off since that's how we've always been, and since it's not really true, I just have a slight gut now. His girlfriend Erica joins in and says that Jack has been working on his beer belly too, which Jack definitely has put on a few pounds recently like me. Jack says that we've both put on some happy relationship weight gain and grown guts. I say that I got the Boyfriend 20, joking that I've gained 20 pounds while dating my girlfriend. The conversation changed from there, but we were all laughing about it.Once we get home, my girlfriend says that I embarrassed her in front of my friends by saying that I said she made me fat. I get upset because she just inadvertently called me fat when I never said that at all, just that I had gained weight. I told her that I was just joking and that she shouldn't have taken it so seriously, especially because Erica was making the same type of jokes about Jack. I was also frustrated because she was making me feel bad about my weight gain, which I had never really cared about before. I told her that I know I'm responsible for myself getting a little chubby, but I didn't really care because I felt less pressure to look perfect while dating her. I guess this was the wrong thing to say because she got more upset.Am I the asshole?Edit: I weighed myself after making this post, and I'm actually 178 lbs right now, so a little heavier than I originally thought. I also have made jokes in the past about getting chunkier, but I've never used the word "fat" to describe myself, since I don't think it's true.A few of you were asking in the comments about my girlfriend's weight, and she's very healthy and has always been. Her weight has never seemed to be a concern to her, nor has it been something we've discussed.

title: AITA for not using cutlery at my sister’s birthday dinner
body: I (27M) have dyspraxia, I really struggle using cutlery when eating. At home I use kids cutlery because it’s way easier and more comfortable to use. It’s annoying that I can’t just use normal ones but i’ve been like this my whole life so i’m used to it.My sister (32F) invited me and a lot of our family to her birthday dinner at a restaurant. I was using a normal knife and fork but I was really struggling and it was obvious that I was. I was trying really hard but it was just so hard man. My sister and a few other family members were teasing me for eating like a kid and struggling so much. I didn’t really care at first but it started to really piss me off after a while because my sister literally grew up with me and watched me struggle with this shit and yet she’s still laughing at me.I got annoyed and gave up and used my hands to eat instead because there’s no point trying to be polite and use cutlery for people just to laugh at me. It’s been like this my whole life it’s fucking tiring. My sister got really annoyed at me and she shouted at me when we were alone for embarrassing her. She called me an embarrassment and told me to just act normal. My dad came outside (we were outside arguing because my sister smokes and brought me out with her) and my sister explained everything to him. My dad is on my sisters side and they’ve both been angry at me since.I don’t know maybe I am the asshole I could’ve just kept using the knife and fork i guess it was kinda childish using my fingers. I just don’t understand how my sister can be such a dick to me

title: AITA for how I handled this situation with my girlfriend's depression?
body: Typically, I'm quite busy as a grad student, so I only get about an hour to myself at the end of the day sometimes before I have to prep for the next day and go to bed. During said hour, I often play video games. I'm very introverted, so my alone time is very valuable to me. Sometimes, I call my girlfriend (let's call her Jane) while I'm playing and talk with her while I play. She doesn't live with me, so it's how we catch up at the end of the day. Additionally, we are both aware that we sometimes will multitask while we are on the phone together and we are both ok with this.Last night around midnight, after Jane initially called me and we talked, she wanted to call again. She was depressed yesterday as well. Admittedly, I wanted to go ahead and go to sleep. I have to get up fairly early, my sleep is very important to me, and my social battery was pretty drained by the time she first called me last night. Further, her mood improved by that point and we had already talked about her depression in the earlier call.  It was our nine-month anniversary yesterday as well, but with both our busy schedules, we didn't get much chance to celebrate. This also influenced my decision. I felt bad telling her no, so I told her she could call me again.Twenty minutes later, she FaceTimed me back. I'll be honest: the twenty-minute time period frustrated me, but I tried not to let it show.  At one point on the call, I asked if she was ok. She said she was sleepy, so I told her she should go to sleep. She said no, because she wanted to talk to me. I told her I was going to go sleep soon anyways, which she seemed to be a bit upset about. I realized this, so I told her I'd stay on the call for ten more minutes. I figured "ok, ten minutes gives her the extra time she wants, and gives me enough time to wind down to sleep at a decent hour".Two minutes later, she suddenly wanted to hang up. I was already feeling guilty, because I felt like I wasn't being as patient as I could have, but I was also tired. I basically asked her if she wanted to hang up because of me. Long story short, through that exchange, she got confused and thought I said that I wanted her to hang up. She asked me if I wanted her to hang up, in a tone of voice that sounded hurt. Admittedly, I did not react the best to this. I got frustrated, and thoughtlessly rolled my eyes and sighed (I had forgotten she could see me) . In a tight, but not raised, tone of voice, I said "no sweetie, I don't want to hang up, I want to know if you want to hang up".This made her sad and this is the offense I'm asking about. My frustration in that moment was stemming from desperation and my own guilt. I felt bad because I was tired and wanted to sleep. I felt trapped because it seemed like no matter what I did, short of staying on the phone with her all night, I wasn't going to win. I wanted to know what she wanted. So, Reddit, AITA?

title: AITA for kind of snapping at a kid in my class?
body: So when I was in choir (I quit cause the teacher was a horrible woman) there was this boy who we’ll call ‘Brad’ Brad was an asshole.
