She told me I was not thinking about her and the kids when I purchased the tickets. I said I understood and i can and im willing to cancel the flights. She insisted I still go.  I was unable to consider the rescheduling the flights. I couldn't justify the cost. We could not take on more debt.  I talked to my in-laws and asked them whether I should go or cancel my flights.  They acknowledged the burden but encouraged me to go. They said they would help my wife as much as they could. 48 hours before my flight I asked my wife, are you sure I should go.  She insisted I go but also said I was still not thinking about her.At one point I considered it a no win situation and went on the flight.  Now that I'm here, i receive multiple phone calls a day with my wife which entails her venting about how hard it is and asking why I had to be gone for 4 nights. She is questioning our marriage and asking whether I still love her. AITA?

title: AITA for wanting my brother to move out
body: Me(18F) & my older brother(26M) argue constantly over small disagreements, it usually stems from him trying to “parent me” in some sense. We both live under my fathers roof & it was agreed that once we finish school we pay rent or move out. I haven’t finished school yet & I'm planning to go to college as well. My brother has been finished school for a while now &  he is jobless at the moment. He has his own family & my father told him and his gf(24) that he could live with us until he got his feet planted on the ground which is pretty understandable cuz he became a father at 21. The issue is that he has had his feet on the ground for a very long time & he had a position that payed very well & he made it clear to me the other day that he “has enough money to start a business” so it made question why he has the money for that but not the money to afford a mortgage. It’s no shocker he has money saved up because he doesn’t pay my father rent & neither does his gf. They live in the basement, 1 of the bedrooms was turned into a gaming room, my brother's bedroom was turned into their kids room & the guest bedroom is being used by my brother's girlfriend's sister(who also doesn’t pay rent) & then they turned the living room into their bedroom. So there’s not even enough rooms for all of them living down there. They leave messes in the kitchen & expect me to clean up after it. If I leave a plate or 2 in the sink he yells at me to clean it up but that means I have to clean their dishes so I've refused to clean them up a couple times. My father works week on week off & the house usually gets a big clean up before he’s home but they expect me to clean up all of upstairs even though i’m pretty much confined to my room everyday, i eat my meals in my room, i clean my messes up in the kitchen & so on. You might as well call me Cinderella at this point because all I do is clean up after everybody else. I love my brother & his family don’t get me wrong but it's unfair on me, i can’t have the kitchen between 5-7pm every night, if i want to clean my dishes i have to put all of theirs away so there’s room for mine, i have to be quiet in the evenings because their room has no walls and they can hear me. Me & my father had conversations about him moving out & my brother overheard me & my dad’s conversation, he later told me I was “stabbing him in the back” because I agreed with my dad kicking them out. I feel like an asshole agreeing with my dad but at the same time i think he’s old enough to move out & considering he said he has enough money to start a business i’m sure he won’t be homeless, there’s also 3 adults so i’m sure they could put their money together & buy a place. I honestly really wouldn’t have a problem with them if my brother didn’t try to parent me and speak to me like i’m less than him but it’s beginning to get to me, and even in situations where he’s wrong he and his gf will “gang up” on me.

title: AITA For asking my housemates why they put their pets in my room without asking me while I was visiting family and friends for Christmas
body: Brief background on the housemates (using fake names), Jack (24m) and Carrie (22f) are a couple who I live with in this house. I (21f) met them through a friend (26f) who I lived with last year and this year until she moved back home permanently.Some background on their behaviour towards me, they have been very cold towards me, avoiding me, excluding me, and making fun of my behaviour behind my back to others (this behaviour was mainly just me self-isolating due to my struggle with my mental health and going through therapy again which was bringing up a lot of traumas I hadn't delt with enough). They have been comfortable "borrowing" my things and had been polite so I thought I was overthinking until someone made me aware of this. I brought up a conversation with all of them asking if I had done anything wrong, but they had no issues to bring up and made up excuses/ lies for their behaviour, which I didn't call out to avoid conflict.Without going into more detail about their behaviour towards me I'll just get to the beginning of what happened, While I was back home Carrie messaged me to ask when I was thinking of returning home to which I told her "around the 2nd". I ended up travelling back up on the 1st and when I had arrived back they saw me and panicked, Jack going up into my room to take their pet guinea pigs out of my room, leaving a lot of hay over my floor.I cleaned up the hay they had left on the floor and opened the window for the smell (the smell lingered for a week or two). I didn't immediately ask why they did that as I had a 4 hour drive up on little sleep and slightly hungover so I really just wanted to relax before going to bed.The next day there was a leak in the extension of the living room roof which I cleaned up and then went upstairs to take pictures of the roof from my room to send to the landlord. Jack and Carrie found the leak and immediately started blaming me to which I went downstairs to inform them I found that leak 2 minutes ago and that if they just looked in the pitcher they surely could tell how little water was in it.Now this is where maybe I'm an A-hole because it was poorly timed, I said "I've been meaning to ask you, why you didn't ask to put the guinea pigs in my room?" to which Carrie immediately said that now was not the time but I ignored her and continued on saying that if she had just asked I would've been fine with it. To which Jack responded with something like they took "liberties" which I snapped back at how disrespectful they have been towards me and that I've tried to communicate with them but they lack the ability to do the same. This angered both Carrie who made a dig at me for poor communication on the 2 minutes of me not telling them of the leak I cleaned up, and Jack as he was visibly frustrated and started yelling at me, "I don't know you, I don't like you" and referring to this question and the conversation I previously mentioned as me having "another episode".

title: AITA for telling my neighbor I don’t need parenting advice from someone that doesn’t parent her own kids
body: My across the street neighbor, Danielle, has 4 kids, 2 boys (12 and 10) and 2 girls (3 and 7). Their dad pops in and out of their lives, he shows up for a few months to a year then leaves for a year or two.Danielle’s kids are cute and well behaved but she doesn’t take care of her own kids. Our other neighbors, Barbara and John (mid-late 70’s) watch the kids so much that the kids think they’re their grandparents.I had a son a few months ago and Danielle has been offering unsolicited parenting advice since before he was born. I’ve tried telling her I don’t need any help and she said something about all new moms needing some help even if we don’t realize it. I finally told her I don’t need any advice from someone that doesn’t parent her own kids and if I need advice I’ll go to the neighbors since they seem to have the kids most of the time anyways. Now she’s got my mom (I live with her) and the neighbors saying I was rude, I don’t understand her situation, and she was just trying to help.Am I the asshole for telling her I don’t need parenting advice from someone that doesn’t parent her own kids?

title: AITA for expecting my parents to pay tuition for me when they paid for my brother?
body: My parents are wealthy but frugal. They spend money on experiences and charity but not material things, which I respect. My dad says things like “we will never be able to spend all our money” which is true no matter how they live.We live a comfortable but not decadent lifestyle with two incomes. We’ve chosen to send our four kids to a private school for $12k a year. For us, we are careful about where we spend…this is not pocket change for us but it fits the budget.Three years after my first went, my brother and SIL decided to send their (four) kids to a different (free) school. Assuming they could not afford it because they have one income (my SIL chooses to work very very part time in a lucrative healthcare position to stay home with their little kids) my parents offered to pay.My parents told me about this after my SIL flipped that they were throwing their wealth weight around to get what they wanted. My parents were very offended and at the time said , “of course, we would have given this to you as well” but the issue was moot.A few months later my brother and SIL recanted and have been receiving full tuition for three years with many more to come. When I kindly asked my parents about paying for our tuition they declined.AITA for later arguing with them that it is an unfair financial situation especially given their “unlimited” wealth when they should be able to give or not give charity to whoever they want?

title: WIBTA to tell kids to stop playing in my driveway?
body: I (27F) live on a corner house near a school, every M-F a mom and her two children come by after school on their way home (they live a few houses down my street). The kids are about 6 & under, and like to ride their bike in my driveway. For some reason it really bothers me when the mom lets her kids ride their bikes up and down my driveway (which sometimes sets my dogs into a barking frenzy). Would I be the a$$h0le if I asked them not to play on my property anymore?UPDATE: I decided to park my car in-front of the garage but that did not stop them from riding onto my property. Instead they rode further into the property (driveway leads into my backyard). So far however they are not hanging around as long just doing two “loops” and head home. For now I am going to avoid confrontation since they are just children who aren’t being told otherwise by the parent, might even move my car back to its original spot to avoid taking damage. May revisit the idea about putting up “No Trespassing” signs though.

title: AITA for not hiring my friend after he helped me get a job?
body: This happened a long time ago but still bothers me. About 10 years ago I was looking for a new job, and my best fried offered to introduce me to his Director at the company he worked at, as they were hiring. I interviewed, got the job and ended up working there for 3 years. During those 3 years, I worked really hard and was promoted a couple of times and eventually left for a manager position at new company.Shortly after that, my best friend got fired from his job for submitting some personal expenses for reimbursement, and he asked if I could hire him on my team as I had openings that matched his skill set and experience. However, my friend, who is very intelligent is also somewhat eccentric. He often would say and do things that are inappropriate at work. His work was generally fine, not outstanding, just ok, but he was enjoyed being the contrarian and the center of attention, often times in a cringy way. Also, given that we were best friend since childhood we tended to joke around a lot and he would generally bring out an immature side of me that I did not like, especially at work.So when he asked if I could hire him, I was very anxious about the idea of him reporting to me and weather he would take me seriously as a manager or continue acting unprofessionally and being provocative for the sake of attention. But initially, I went along with it and asked him to send me his resume, which he did. However it was a very half assed resume, filled with spelling errors, poor grammar and it was obvious he did not put a lot of effort into it.  I marked up all the errors and sent it back to him to correct, and I think he was kind of annoyed by this, and sent it back to me with only half the corrections done.At this point, I called him and told him that I could not hire him, because I did not think it would be good for me to be his direct manager given our friendship and the fact that had been fired from his previous role and that he refused to acknowledge that he made a mistake on the expense reimbursement (he unsuccessfully tried to sue his past employer for wrongful termination and refused to acknowledge that he violated a pretty black and white policy). This is what I told him, but in reality I was worried that his eccentricity would make me look bad, and if he did not take me seriously as a manager, it would set the wrong example for the rest of my team. Also I was annoyed that he would not put in the effort to make a good and professional resume.Needless to say, he was very hurt by this, and basically our friendship ended as a result of this. I ran into him on a couple of occasions over the years, and have reached out multiple times, but even 10 years later he is still angry about it, because he helped me get a job and I did not do the same for him.I miss my friend very much and think about him often. I had hoped we would stay friends for life, and that our kids could grow up together, but we just were never able to reconcile. Was I wrong?

title: AITA for not accepting my sister's apology?
body: I'm 17, and my sister is 16 now. She has a fashion and aesthetic account on tiktok, and she recently hit 10k followers. Every thousand followers, she makes a video intro that has her drawing a custom sticker saying thanks to the followers and slaps it onto increasingly funny surfaces. First was a baby's stomach (gently, and on top of its onesie)Next was her bald friend's head. It got funnier and funnier. For 10k, she chose my ass. I thought she had just did it for no reason, and shrugged it off. Turned out the comedic twist was that I go to school with the sticker on my ass. I didn't notice it until my mom stopped me and pulled it off. She  sat my sister down with my and demanded she apologize. She started crying and kept repeating that she was sorry, and I said "Apology not accepted. You did nothing wrong. Congrats on the 10k" and walked off.My mom got frustrated and lectured me about setting expectations due to her special needs. I said I was fine with it, she was fine with it, no harm done. My mom raised her voice slightly and said that's not the point. AITA?

title: AITA for going off on my uncle (57m) for a comment he made to my boyfriend/fiancé?
body: I (24f) just got engaged to my fiancé (34m) he bought us tickets to my hometown on the other side of the country so he could propose.Anyways, I haven’t spoken to my aunt and uncle in 3 years because of drama that happened in 2020. My aunt was trying to make excuses for her brother (my dad) for not being in my life. I got upset with her and blocked her.So fast forward a few days ago, she found out that I was home after 6 years of being away and she said she wanted to see me. I felt like it would be a good chance to repair our broken bond and start forgiveness.When I saw her and her husband, her husband said to my fiancé “you could’ve gotten better looking than her.” Immediately my fiancé said he didn’t appreciate that , and how I was beautiful etc. My aunt and grandma also agreed, and then my uncle said “I’m being sarcastic, you are beautiful/gorgeous!”I was really hurt by this comment especially since that was the first thing he said. I have thoughts that he did this on purpose to get a dig at me for hurting my aunt.I mentioned it to my aunt , how I felt hurt & she said that’s just his personality. He didn’t actually mean it, and if he knew he hurt me he would felt really bad. But I can’t stop thinking about it.I sent him a message saying how bad he hurt me, and how I’m an idiot for giving them a second chance , and that I never want to talk to them again.AITA for going off on him/telling him off? I didn’t want him to get away with hurting me. Was I being too sensitive? Do other families make jokes like this? Needing other perspectives .

title: AITA for not giving my sister alcohol for free?
body: I (22F) was gifted a fairly large bottle of rosé vodka a while back, and because I'm not much of a drinker, I decided to get rid of it. My mother offered to buy it off of me, but didn't specify a price.My sister, who I've always had issues with due to her self-centeredness, came over and I told her I was getting rid of a few things, including the vodka. She asked if she could have it for free, and I said no. She asked if I had paid for those items. No, most of them were gifts. Then she shouldn't have to pay for them, she said. I told her mum had offered to buy the vodka from me. She then said "How about this (1L vodka) and this (unused scented candle) for $5?" I said I'd have to see what mum would offer, and the matter was left at that.I know this isn't a huge drama piece like what's usually on this sub, but I'd like to know what y'all think.Edit: Updated for specifics

title: AITA for not inviting my mom to my graduation?
body: I grew up living with my birth mother and only visiting my dad every other weekend. I've always felt that this arrangement was unfair and I should be able to see my parents an equal amount of time, I just never had the courage to confront my mom about this until I was 16. I left a note for her while I was home alone and was about to leave for my dad's house pretty much letting her know I'd like to see him more.After this, she changed up completely and started calling me names and saying stuff like "this has always been your plan, just to hurt me!" She also told me that she's going to take my car away, turn my phone off, not get me anything for Christmas, etc. After a while of putting up with this from her, I ultimately decided it would be best for me live with my dad and visit my mom on the weekends. Hers and my step-dads attitudes towards me kept getting worse and worse with each visit. My step dad would continually tell me things like "you're not a part of this family anymore" and insults like "you're the fat kid".My breaking point was when they took all my stuff and packed it up into boxes while I was away at my dad's house, and changed my bedroom into a storage room/office space for them, and told me I had to either sleep on the floor or the couch. They also told me that once they do clean that room out, it would be for a foster kid. One weekend they cleared off the bed in that room and told me I could sleep in there, but the next morning my step dad goes in the room while I'm trying to sleep and turns all the lights on and calls his friends while playing video games. When I asked him to leave he told me that if I don't like it I can get out. My mom was away from the house at the time and I messaged her telling her what happened, hoping she would stick up for me, but she told me that I needed to stop being ungrateful. So I called my dad to come pick me up and I left, and I haven't been back since.I'm now 18 and I'm going to be graduating high school in a couple of months. My mom still tries to contact me and apologize for everything that had happen, but I dont reply. My step-mom told me that I should try to fix my relationship with my mother, so I don't regret it when she's not there for my graduation, but I have no desire to talk to her.So AITA for not inviting my mom to my graduation and not trying to fix our broken relationship?

title: AITA for asking for my money back from our thanksgiving dinner and not going
body: My wife(29F) and I(29M) decided to go to my side of the family for Thanksgiving. We asked what they wanted us to bring and they told us no that the food was going to be ordered in instead. They asked for $100 from each family and it seemed a little high to us but we said whatever and gave it.A couple days before Thanksgiving I texted them and asked what they would order and it was something my wife I didn't eat and they reused to change it so I had to play the pregnant card in order for them to changed the food hey did but reluctantly. A day before Thanksgiving I asked what time the food was getting picked up and what time we should be there. They told us to be there at 6:30 because they were picking up the food at 6. So when they day of Thanksgiving came we decided to take our son to the park for a bit and do some chores.Around 4:30 I get a call from my mom telling to to go now because they picked up the food early and everyone is there already. None of us was ready we all needed to shower and shower our 4 year old. So between them not wanting to accommodate for the food to the point of having to pull the pregnancy card but then they picked up the food early.So I decided to text them and tell them to give me my money back because we didn't want to go eat cold or reheated food for thanksgiving while everyone else already ate. So AITA for asking for my money back and spending it with just my wife and son?

title: AITA for not letting my mom live with me?
body: My mom’s house sold at auction at the end of April ‘23. On Jan 2nd ‘24 she was removed from the house. She texted me yesterday asking if she could stay with me. I had to tell her no, again. Despite all she has put me through, I still love her. My dad passed in June 2019. It’s been very hard on our family. Since his death the relationship with my mom has become strained. My brother hasn’t had a thing to do with her since Jan 2021. My mom would pit us against one another. It was a habitual cycle of distrust and manipulation by her that we have since worked through. My brother, SIL, and I have a great relationship since my mom is no longer in the picture. She blames us for her not paying her mortgage that we never knew she wasn’t paying. After the auction, she then had 10 days to vacate. Within those 10 days, she talked to the new owner and gave him her sad story. He felt bad for her and made a deal for her stay there 3 months and get her the surplus money from the sale of the house. She was supposed to use that time to find a place, pack, and move. She didn’t do that. After she got the almost 40k from him and the 3 months were up she told him to talk to her lawyer. It then went to court- she lost. She had until the end of Nov to leave. In total she had 8 months to find a place and move as well as almost 40k but still did nothing. During this time she has withheld belongings that was supposed to go to my brother and I after my dad’s passing. She refused to give us anything and would constantly make comments like “You don’t know what it’s like. You only lost a father, I lost a husband. My lose is greater than yours”. Those hurt. Jan 2nd she called me to come get whatever I wanted because they were kicking her out. She went next door and talked to my brother through the doorcam and told him the same thing. So him and I both left work to finally get our families stuff. I was then told by her that anything I took was still hers and I was just holding it for her. I told her no. Her and I argued and I walked out of the house in tears because I was so hurt and mad. She tried to have us arrested for getting stuff even though she is the one who told us to. After my SIL told her that we had her recorded on the doorcam telling us to come get what we wanted, she relented. Even after all that, I still helped her move some stuff to a storage. She ended up at a shelter that would help her find a place to stay and work with her. She has known since April that she’s not allowed at my house because my husband won’t allow her there after everything she has put me through. He has held me while I’ve bawled one too many times and can’t stand the manipulation and emotional turmoil she has put me through. She choose to bury her head in the sand and now wants to stay with me because she can’t find a place for her and 2 dobermans She is now threatening to come get the dogs even though she has nowhere to go yet, simply because she’s mad at me.

title: AITA for not wanting to hear about my housemates situationship anymore
body: Me (26, f) and my housemate Hannah (24, f)  have lived together for almost a year now. We were friends of friends but did not know each other before we lived together. In general we get along pretty well, we have very different backgrounds and I sometimes find her a little out of touch but I tend to hold my tongue about these things. Likewise I'm sure she walks carefully on some issues around me.A few months ago she met this guy, Anthony, who had a girlfriend who lived in the states. They instantly connected and have been very flirty with each other. Anthony has not cheated on his girlfriend with Hannah but I do think there has been an emotional affair. He did tell Hannah he was going to break up with his girlfriend a couple of months back. This did not happen.Hannah has recently started saying she is going to make a move because she owes the girlfriend nothing and its not like it even counts as a relationship because it's long distance. I've skirted around the issue as it literally has nothing to do with me but does make me a little uncomfortable when she talks about his girlfriend. I don't like cheating. When Hannah has asked me directly what she should do I've always said I think you should look after yourself and take a step away because you are quite likely to get hurt.A few days ago when she was ranting about Anthony/ the girlfriend I said eventually "can we stop talking about this. You know my thoughts, I don't want to help you plan on how this guy is going to cheat on his girlfriend".She got very annoyed by the whole thing and told me I was being a bad friend and she should be able to discuss her feeling in her home.We've never had an argument before so I just kind of acknowledged what she said and left the room. It's now very awkward and my other flatmates say that agree with what I said but it was never going to go down well.I now think I should have just nodded a long like I had done the last few times it came up. Was I the asshole? I worry I was maybe a bit blunt but she's an incredibly blunt person and very direct so I thought she wouldn't have an issue with my blunt response.

title: AITA for being snarky and locking my mom out of my room?
body: I’m 16F living mostly with my dad, but I spend some time at my 53F mom’s house occasionally. I honestly hate her, my dad and sister do too, she is extremely critical of me and my sister and VERY particular about keeping things clean and neat, so I am biased but will tell this neutrally.I woke up with a small stain on 2 layers on my bed from my period :/ I cleaned it up with a sponge, soap, and water with no problems, I was scared because my mom gets extremely upset over spills and messes. Very unfortunately, my mom noticed the sponge was missing during that time and got angry that I had spilled something. She went looking for what I had spilled, found the wet spot in my bedroom covers, and started getting extremely upset & frantic because it’s “going to mildew” and “you didn’t get all the soap out” and put every blanket and sheet in the washing machine bc of that. I told her I could just wash it out with more water and use a hairdryer to dry it, and asked her what she thought the washing machine does (rude ik) but she told me I didn’t get it. BTW we were both saying this very not calmly. So for the next hour she kept entering the rooms I was in to yell at me about it, saying I never learn from spills and act like I’m two years old, etc, and I just ignored her even though I was upset.A few hours later, I was sleeping and my mom woke me up wanting me to go to the other bedroom because she didn’t want me to leak on that bed and started yelling at me about that some more. So I went to the other bedroom and locked the door. 10 secs later she started banging on the door because she had laundry to dry and I decided not to open it because I was tired of her. I fully knew she would get very upset and that I was being petty. After realizing I’m not going to open it she yelled outside the door, saying things like “I’m not like YOU I have work tomorrow” I guess insulting me for not having a job? “i’m going to call the police,” something something about how she’s writing me out of her will, “you’re on your own when you turn 18 girl” “I hope you don’t have kids, or if they are they’re as bad you” and following that, “how crazy that I don’t even want grandkids!” and a bunch of other stuff, for probably half an hour but those are the quotes I remember 100%. She started literally squealing like a pig out of frustration at one point. I was just lying in bed and not saying anything. Anyways AITA for being snarky and intentionally provoking my mom by locking her out?

title: AITA for calling my mom a crappy cat owner?
body: My(15m) mom visits once every month. Last visit, she was telling me how her cats were beginning to not use their litter box. She has four cats. The Scottish Folds Lily, Mike and their kitten Angie, with their other kittens living with my aunt. And Ivy, the Russian Blue.I said 'If you're scooping the boxes daily then see the vet. Ask her what else could be causing issues." She went silent. That was when I asked "You don't scoop everyday, do you?" Mom shook her head and said she only does it once a week, since her ex-bf used to help her with it but then he left. She then quietly mumbled that they only have one box between them, before saying that that couldn't be the issue and asking if I can help her work out what to do about it.At which point I said she was 'doing a real crappy job.' It was out of complete incredulity. She then snapped at me, saying I have no idea how difficult it is to manage her time with four cats and that the litter is expensive and she can't replace it all the time. That money doesn't grow on trees and I don't understand how the world work et cetera.

title: AITA for expecting my husband to be more understanding?
body: My husband (32M) and I (31F) were speaking to his family on a video call and one of his aunts mentioned that she thinks I look like I've put on weight. It's not the first time one of his family members said it. A similar comment was made a couple of years ago and I told my husband it made me uncomfortable. I felt the same way again this time around. I was hoping he'd say "Ya don't worry about the comment. She shouldn't have said it". Instead he said "She mentioned it because she thought you looked chubbier. What's the big deal? Just brush it off and move on" Now I know this is a minor thing but I feel like my feelings of discomfort were neither acknowledged nor supported despite him knowing how I felt about it previously. He made me feel like I was stupid to feel the way I am. I said "You're making me feel like my feelings are invalid. I need you to be more understanding because I can't help how I feel". He lost it and said "I don't know why you need to act like a child about everything. You need to be grow up." AITA for overthinking the comment. Should I have kept it to myself?Edit: He did come back an hour later to apologise for being insensitive. I did appreciate that. I hear both sides. I should be able to stand up for myself in such situations. There's a cultural difference as many of you have rightly gathered. Thank you for all your inputs. We've both grown a little today and this community I thank for being honest! :)

title: AITA for telling my husband I don’t like his mom coming over to gossip about my family members
body: My MIL moved closer to us since me and husband had our first child currently pregnant with our second my mom got her a job now my mom and MIL work together my sister works with them as well . Lately my sister is struggling going thru a divorce and has been working less hours due to her circumstances atm my MIL keeps making comments about how lazy my sister is by not coming into work as much my mom has become upset because of this now everytime my MIL comes over she proceeds to gossip about my sister at first it wasn’t a big deal to me but now it’s become so annoying and I’m starting to dislike her coming over n talking bad about my sister now when my parents do get togethers they do not offer to invite my MIL and my husband always says it’s rude of them not to invite her as well I told him she shouldn’t be invited bc she is becoming annoying to my mom and me as well AITA?

title: AITA for my friend leaving his rubik's cube in a public space and it getting broken
body: So here's the backstory, Me and my bestfriend/roomate, we were going to pick up my gf from the airport. It was a long ride and a long wait so he was bringing along a 4X4 rubik's cube which he was solving over the week and it was solved around 75%.I jokingly on the way to cab said 'so you wanna show off huh?'. After saying this he was about go leave the cube in public lobby room of the apartment. I was like 'no no, don't leave it there' and also tried to physically stop him and be like it's just a joke.So he goes over me trying to stop him verbally twice and physically once. And leaves the cube on couch of the public lobby.He forgets to pick the cube up that day and goes to get it back 2 days later and finds it all broken and pieces everywhere.Now, few weeks later we were funnily aruguing. And he insists that the loss of cube is on me. He says I left the cube because of what you said and you said the same thing twice in the past.But I believe him losing the cube is on his poor judgement and his negligence.I am willing to admit that I made a poor joke and I am willing to take responsibility for possibly hurting him.Ignore the "AITA",  here is the final question: Am I responsible for him losing the cube? Is the cube getting lost on me?TLDR;  My friend left his cube in the lobby which was later found broken. He claims that I am responsible as my comments caused him to leave it behind.

title: AITA for changing my mind after I promised someone?
body: AITA for changing my mind in hiring someone?I was recently hired in a job where I can appoint people to certain posts (positions of trust and confidence). Basically, since I am the one in-charge, I can bring/hire people I trust.  One girl (let's call her LENY), helped me during the application process for another job (not the one I got). When LENY learned that I got hired for a different job, she asked me if I can hire her for the vacancies in my new job. Since LENY helped me in my previous application to that other job I didn't get, I promised her that I will hire her for one of the posts in my new job. Take note that she is very qualified. In fact, she is already working at a higher rank position but she is willing to be demoted after she accepts the new job from me because she will be  nearer to her hometown.Since I was new, I'm still learning the ropes so I have not hired anyone yet. I likewise want to wait until I am settled before I accept applicants. I heard from one of my friends that LENY applied to another post near her hometown. I am happy to hear that and honestly wish that she gets the job. I thought she is no longer interested in the job I promised so I did not send her any message anymore.LENY didn't get the post near her hometown so LENY sent me a message just recently and asked me when I will be accepting applicants for the new post. I told LENY that I want to settle to the job first before I open the job vacancies (i don't even have my first salary yet). After I told LENY about that, LENY suddenly sent me long messages about her wanting to be near her aging parents and her health concerns. Her exact words in the end was "If you don't  want to hire me, I can't do anything anymore MA'AM (MY NAME)". I felt slighted by the tone of her message and the capslock that she used in her messages. I felt that she is angry so I stopped replying. Then she went on and on about how she is a good worker and how she had perfect attendance record (all of it, she sent in WhatsApp). I did not reply because I felt offended. I felt that she is pressuring me to open the vacancy when I am not yet ready to do it yet. I realized that even if she is not angry and I merely misunderstood her, I felt offended by her voluminous messages so I don't want to hire her anymore.The position she was aiming is a position of trust and confidence. I will be needing someone who will loyally assist me and will not betray the accounts we hold. The person that I need to hire have to be with me most of the time. By what LENY just did, I currently feel that she is not the proper person for the job. I felt turned off and I don't want to hire her anymore. It will be very awkward for me to hire her after that and I don't think I will have any peace of mind working with her.  AITA for changing my mind?TLDR, I promised someone who helped me before that I will hire her for a position of trust and confidence. She sent some messages which felt offensive to me and I felt that I cannot give that trust to her anymore so I now change my mind. AITA?EDITED the post to change the name to LENY (not her real name).

title: AITA for guiding my brother to a better path?
body: My brother (20M) has had a lifelong passion for singing and performing. He has grown up on school stages and sings at family gatherings. The problem is- he's really bad it. He's screechy and off-key. I (18M) can tell that everyone in the room is uncomfortable when he sings, but they still shower him with praise and give him false hope that inflates his ego and makes him think that he's the most musically gifted person in the world when he's far from it and is only going to get hurt once he actually tries to make it in showbiz. I've always been quietly afraid he'd fly too close to the sun.Well, my fears came true today. He stormed into the living room wearing- get this- a clown costume. Blue hair, red nose, jumpsuit, the whole nine yards. He looks ridiculous, to say the least. I ask him about it, and he tells me he was trying to be "memorable" at the singing competition audition he just came back from. He was storming around the place all angry because the judges told him he was too pitchy and sounded like he was bleating like a goat, just like I had been thinking for all these years. Still, he refused to believe the judges' feedback, insisting that he "nailed it" and that some people "just aren't ready for me".I take a few deep breaths to keep my cool, and point out that these judges actually work with singers, so shouldn't they know what they were talking about? My brother starts yelling at me about how I'm "taking their side" and "unsympathetic" (when I'm just trying to understand why he doesn't believe the judges), and about how accusing someone of singing like a goat is "morally wrong".So I break the news to him so that he doesn't keep chasing this pipe dream for the rest of his life: he's a bad singer. I brace myself for him to start crying or something, but instead he accuses me of being jealous of his dream (when I have never shown an interest in the performing arts), calls my dream of becoming a computer programmer stupid (when I, unlike him, have shown skill in that area) and accuses me of betraying him.So I let him perform his song in front of me to see for myself how he did. And it's... bad. It's very bad. It sounds like the last sounds of a dying animal in heat- and I tell him this, very honestly, with the best intentions, as gently as I can while in the throes of some major secondhand embarrassment.And he takes it. He backs down somehow, as if my advice has flipped a switch in his brain. He starts ranting about how his inner voice was right all along and how he needs to find a new dream. I know I should be relieved. I even help him decide on a new career path (a computer programmer, which he called stupid just two minutes before). I should be happy, but I only feel guilty seeing how dejected I made my brother. I know I only told him the truth and ultimately set him on a better life path, but I still feel bad. AITA?

title: AITA for getting upset when my partner continues to use my pre-workout supplement?
body: TL;DR: Getting into arguments with my partner over her use of pre-workout without asking. AITA?CONTEXT/BACKSTORY: My partner(30f) and I(31m) have been getting into arguments over the usage of pre-workout for exercise. She practices yoga/ballet 5 days a week while I do typical weight lifting 3 days a week. I started to use pre-workout supplements to give myself an extra boost for my workouts. She tried it for energy with her exercise. I did not want her to use it frequently due to the high amounts of caffeine pre-workout can contain.Eventually, she began drinking the pre-workout I'd buy before her ballet lessons without letting me know, which annoyed me since she would use it without asking. While it would eventually be replaced, it was frustrating preparing for my routine, only to find that the container had significantly less powder than when I last used it, sometimes being near empty. Additionally, I had been working on our shared finances and was trying to maintain our budget and each container costs ~$20-$30, so I didn't want to have to frequently buy it.With the last container I purchased, I told her it was exclusively for me because I didn't think it was right for her to be drinking multiple energy drinks + take pre-workout. She has asked a few times to use it and I said yes whe she did ask, but recently she has been using it without asking. She never denies it when I ask, but I specifically bought this one just for me, and finding that she's using it without asking is upsetting because she would previously use the majority of it. This issue is popping back up because while the both of us had taken breaks from our exercise, we are both getting back into our routines (Her with ballet/yoga, me with weight lifting).We agreed to take it to the Internet counsel to settle the matter for us both.Her exact stance is"It's a communal food item that I replace every time it's empty. You are never without it when you want to use it. It is not fair that I'm not allowed to use something we BOTH consume simply because you want to save your portion for a special time. If it's being replaced, and you do not have to go without, how much and how often I consume it is irrelevant."I don't see it as a communal food item since I've been purchasing it to specifically assist with my workouts. She compares it to buying food that sits in the fridge that someone else ends up eating after a while, meaning to her it should have been eaten sooner/earlier. I compare it to me using her makeup without asking(I don't actually) and using all of a certain product without her knowledge, only to find out its gone when she's trying to get dressed up. AITA for calling it out and getting upset when she uses it without asking or is she in the right?Edit: so people know this isn’t a serious or major fight between the two of us. Just something we keep butting heads over. Feel free to ask for additional info. We’re both going to go over it tonight when she’s off workEdit 2: Showed my partner the responses. She acknowledged that she doesn’t always replace it despite claiming so but agreed with me it doesn’t matter in the end. I’m just going to continue to purchase preworkout and treat it communally.She also was surprised everyone considered me controlling when she told me that she stopped because she found out she was drinking unsafe/lethal doses of caffeine. Her words and her research. I had already stopped complaining about it by the point she looked it up.I’m still the asshole according to public opinion though so there ya go. There’s no such thing as a right to ownership of items in a relationship

title: AITA for using a cosplayers handle in my videos aswell as responding to another content creator when talking about it
body: Context: I am a cosplayer I make videos and post them to Tiktok In August 2022 I had bought tickets to a convention in London taking place in October. I had decided to make a cosplay of a cosplayer that was pretty well known of as I had enjoyed their cosplays for months before, Whilst I was creating this cosplay I found out the cosplayer was actually a moderator to a discord server talking about a meetup to the same convention I was going to, on top of that they had put a public invite out in one of their videos so anyone could join, and in a heartbeat I joined and had told them in a general chat they I was cosplaying their character from one of their series. It took until basically the last few days I had left to complete the cosplay but I finished it and was actually able to meet up with the cosplayer that I was cosplaying. they had asked me for a photo and even dm'd me asking for my Instagram handle so they could tag me in a photo. I was 15 and they were in their 20s at this point.Anyway a couple months pass and I had forgotten about the cosplay until February (I was 16 now as my birthday was in January) so I thought why not use the cosplay in videos so I made a bunch of videos that were basically referencing the cosplay and where it was from and a bunch of that stuff. Now whilst making these videos I had been using a hashtag that was their Tiktok handle. I didn't even realise I was doing it until it was pointed out to me so I clicked on the hashtag and realised that I was the only person using it, and had technically taken it over, so I posted a video joking about it and moved on. Well a couple weeks later and another content creator who was a friend of the cosplayer had seen my video and made a response to it, it wasn't anything serious but to sum it up, it was basically a call out post saying that they were going to try and take the hashtag over, they also said that they were asked to do this by the cosplayer. They didn't mention me by name but because I had like 20 posts on the hashtag is was pretty blatant that they were referring to me.Now I made a jokey response to the video basically saying that this would be a war that I would definitely lose in seeing as I had like 100 followers and they had multiple thousands, a few hours later I deleted the video as it felt kinda rushed and I didn't like it (it was rushed). I also commented on their video because I wanted them to know I had seen it. The following weekend they deleted my comment, and had blocked me on both of their accounts. I was a little upset because I had watched their content aswell in late 2020 but I got over it as the weekend passed. Then during the next week the cosplayer had also blocked me now this hit me hard and I won't lie I skipped school and kinda just cried it off for the whole day.So AITA

title: WIBTA if I abandon my new coworkers?
body: I've been going over this in my head for a bit and I would appreciate some opinions.I (36F) have spent my career so far working totally meaningless office jobs that also slowly treat you worse and worse. I decided to get out while I could and try to find a different career. I decided to try to get into tech and was able to find a job that pays well for my area and doesn't care that I don't have much in the way of education, certs, or experience in exchange for doing low level work (I'm pretty much pulling cables + some customer service).I'm now a little more than a month in and I'm finding I actually enjoy the work more than I thought (electrical circuits are neat!) and I'm considering staying at this level and really working on these skills. Also, my new co-workers are all actually pretty great. The manager actually cares about the team and does as much as she can to support us. Just about everyone is friendly and willing to help me out as much as they can.The bad news is that the job is with a big company and the owners are far more interested in trying to squeeze as much money out of this corporation as they can. It's mostly typical American corporate standard BS, way understaffed, very little training or resources, sales doing all kinds of shady shit, outsourcing, high turnover, etc. There's no way I can stay here without getting totally burnt out in a year.I'm seriously considering seeing if I can get in with our local union, if I do I'd have to quit my current job. They are already understaffed and there's a hiring freeze, if I go they could get stuck in an even worse position. I'd feel like a bit of a dick leaving them like this. Especially since I'm not like who they usually hire and the manager kind of took a chance on me.TLDR: started a job in a totally new field, realized I actually like it and the co-workers are great but the employer sucks balls, so I'm considering quiting.Will I be the asshole if I leave? Would it be worth staying? Is there another option I'm not seeing?

title: AITA Gift or a loan..You decide.
body: So back story. I lost my BF when I 17 to cancer. Saw her through hospital visits, her dad lent on me at her funeral for music, eulogy, invites  etc. He moved to oz soon after but we always kept in contact.  Her death impacted me profoundly.Fast forward 13 years I got a job offer in oz, upon my arrival he really helped out. One of those things he helped out was was finding me a car. He insisted, and I was willing to take it as if never been in the country before. He took me to car dealerships and when I decided on a car I went to the finance person to organise buying and the payments were too high. I said no it’s not viable  and he off his own back said he would pay a deposit. I was taken a back but this was a few days after landing, jet lag and worrying about having to get a car to get to my new job so I let him. I said after let’s set up a payment plan he said not to worry about it now . It was left as that.Fast forward since then I had been round his numerous times, upgraded my car took it over to show him, he got remarried I was invited etc.When covid hit it changed everything and he never called me or vice versa. When covid finished he went off travelling as did I and well our paths never crossed as his new partners son had a grandchild and I got into a relationship.Our relationship pretty much ceased to exist but I did of course invite him and his partner to my wedding where we are only having 30 people.He responded saying he couldn’t make it.It’s 8 years since I’ve been here and 3 weeks before my wedding and he has my number.Yet he chose to message me on Facebook including my mum stating the “agreed loan amount for the car”, saying he thought of himself as a surrogate parent (I have 2 alive parents) at the time but the relationship wasn’t maintained. Then stating he would “ wipe” the debt as a parting wedding present!Safe to say I was shocked and upset by it all. I’ve never taken money for a loan from anyone besides my parents and well I believed he wanted me to have it as gift to begin with as he never stated at any point he wanted it back. Also why not mention it for 8 years!Anyhow I was so annoyed I told him as such, to  include my mum in such a message written with such umbrage and Why would I want to start a marriage with money not given with the best intent, I asked his account details and paid him back the money immediately.He responded with “unnecessary but Thankyou”.I wanted to respond but refrained and I have nothing good to say.By the way he has plenty of money, so his fine on that front.I’m just so hurt by his actions. I really appreciated everything he did outside of the money when I first came over and now it’s all tainted. I’m out of pocket just before my wedding and just feel like my integrity got bought into question.Did I do wrong?

title: WIBTA if I gave my grandma a gift pretending it’s from my grandpa
body: My grandpa (70s M) has lymphoma and has been declining rapidly. My grandma (70s F) expressed to me about six months ago that she wanted my grandpa (her husband) to gift her a necklace, as his body was deteriorating due to the cancer and she wanted something special to remember him by. She didn’t want to ask him directly so I told her I’d drop the hint. This was something that I could see was very important to her but I selfishly didn’t make it a priority. It wasn’t until a couple months later that I remembered her request for the necklace and I brought it up to my grandpa. Unfortunately he isn’t cognizant enough to pick out a necklace for her and I’m not sure if he will gain that clarity again? WIBTA if I bought a necklace and gave it to my grandma Under the pretense it was from him?

title: AITA for not letting my best friend come to a concert with me?
body: i know just the title by itself is horrible but let me explain. this year i started high school but i switched schools around three months ago, and went where my best friend goes, just in a different class. i was and still am going through a rough patch, but that first month was really horrible; however, i managed to develop a really good friendship between me and two girls from my class, and ever since we first met we talked about this one singer and how much we wanted to go to one of his concerts, so luckily we managed to find a date around june. these new friendships mean a lot to me because im very shy and introverted, and since i was at my lowest when i first got to meet them, i was even more grateful. so basically my best friend, who of course knows these girls and met them a few times, used to say she hated this singer, but this night she texted me asking me when we were going and if she could come. mind you we are extremely close, we do basically everything together and she’s basically the only consistent thing in my life, so i of course didnt want to lie to her and just told her (in the nicest way possible) that that concert was kind of a thing between us three and that we could go somewhere else together. she didnt get like actually mad but she started texting pretty dry so i could tell she was upset: i said sorry multiple times and wrote all sorts of things to make her forgive me, and i think she did but i still cant bring myself to not feel like an absolute piece of shit for not letting her come. its just that im with her all the time, shes super extroverted and full of friends she tries to introduce to me all the time so i felt even more bad thinking she does her best to make me meet new people, while i just snobbed her like that. i havent talked about it to my ither friends yet, and i dont thibk i will because they’d probably think im a selfish piece of shit, but idk. AITA?

title: AITA for not giving our cousin a wedding gift?
body: My  cousin is getting married in a few months and we just received their wedding invitation. It's on a Friday and the ceremony is in the morning at their local church. The reception is almost a 2-hour drive away after the ceremony and no one lives in the area where the reception is being held. It doesn't even start until 6pm. This means taking an entire Friday off work to attend.Apart from that, they put a QR code on the back of their wedding invitation for their gift registry. The invite had a section on it for gifts and said that they will be having a wishing well/card box but if we'd like to give a physical gift, please use the QR code. I checked the registry and they're asking for all expensive things. A thousand-dollar vacuum cleaner. An eight-hundred dollar espresso machine. A two-hundred dollar toaster.They also had an engagement party about six months ago and posted this same registry on the e-vite for the engagement party. The party was brunch in a park with over a hundred people. A few weeks ago, we heard the bride complaining that not enough people had contributed at the engagement party to get her her coffee maker so she doesn't know which counter to put it on in their new home that her parents paid the down payment on.To say she's spoiled and ungrateful is an understatement. I don't want to waste my vacation time  or spend gas money to go to this wedding. I especially don't want to have to pay for a hotel since it's in a place no one lives near.Clearly she won't care if a cousin is here. She has lots of people coming to this wedding and I'm sick of seeing her hold her hand out, especially in this tough economy.WIBTA for not even sending her a wedding gift if I don't go to the wedding?

title: AITA for wishing my roommate break off their engagement?
body: To start off, I apologize if I ramble too much or if there's too much detail. I (20NB), had lived with my roommate (19F) for the past school semester of college. We are no longer roommates as they couldn't afford to go to college. I had been the one to move in with them bc we had become friends during our first semester. The first half of us living together was great, we hung out and got along well. The following semester is when problems arose. Between the time of our freshman year ending and our sophomore year starting, they got into a long distance relationship and got engaged. Keep in mind our break is only about five months, personally I think that's a little fast but it's none of my business. They began to essentially completely ignore my existence. They would be on call with their fiance (18F) 24/7, even being on call during classes and going to sleep. I could never tell if they would talk to me or their fiance half the time. We no longer went out, no longer had our usual movie nights. The only time we did things together was cooking dinner, but of course, they were on call with their fiance. As the months went on, I just gave up on trying to spend time or go out with them because no matter what, I would be the third wheel. To me, they seem overly dependent on each other to the point where it's becoming unhealthy. I never tried to bring it up because I didn't know how to say "Hey, break up with your fiance because I want attention." I have nothing against the fiance, I was able to meet them in person when they visited in person. One thing that really irked me is that I had asked them to watch a show with me, she said no, which I said fine and went about my life. Then, some time later, I come back to the room to them watching the same show (With you guessed it, the fiance!). It sort of felt like a slap in the face, since this was also one of my favorite shows. A similar thing happened when I asked to play a video game with them, except this time they said yes, then proceeded to not play with me and started playing with them instead. I started growing more and more resentment for my roommate and the relationship.They had almost broken up, I felt guilty for wishing that it actually happened. At the end of the year, I moved out of the dorms for a break and they text me out of the blue asking me if anything was wrong. Not wanting to lie, I explained (mostly) everything about how I felt ignored and that I felt like I was only in the dorm to sleep and not actually "live" there. I didn't bring up my feelings about the relationship itself. They respond back, apologizing, but saying that I had been "pushing away" from them and that they had been actually trying to hang out with me this whole time! I hold my tongue so that the conversation can just get over with, but now I'm feeling like I should have brought it up in the conversation. AITA for feeling this way about this relationship?

title: AITA for no longer wanting to go?
body: My sister (35) and I (30) have been going working out together since Oct 2023 and have been every other day since then. title: AITA for wanting to kick my drummer out of the band?
body: So, I'm the singer in a rock cover band on my college campus. We've faced drummer challenges since our inception last semester. The initial drummer quit before practices began, the second ghosted us, and after a period of playing shows with fill-ins, we found a promising replacement. Initially, things went well despite his busy schedule. However, he now struggles to attend practices and alters the tempos of songs during shows, which leads to us sounding very sloppy.Usually, we learn about two songs for a new show, as we like to keep things fresh, and phase out songs the crowd doesn't vibe with. We agreed to learn six new songs during Christmas break for a show. Despite a month's preparation, our drummer faced difficulties, often glancing at the songs during practice and leaving early. He joined another band, encountering the same issues, which turned what was supposed to be their awesome debut performance and our "we're back" show into a shitshow. He can't keep the same bpm throughout a song, he doesn't play the songs correctly, etc.We're frustrated with the drummer's inconsistency, so my band quietly started searching for a replacement. I tried explaining maybe staying in the other band (which is more his genre than what we play) would be best, but that didn't go well. Currently, efforts to persuade him to focus solely on the other band have been challenging. Two of us are leading discussions, keeping the other members out to avoid unnecessary conflicts. However, they agree with us on the matter.Despite our drummer being a great guy, we prioritize finding someone who can maintain timing, play songs accurately, and commit time.Sidenote, we used his designed logo for merch. Although we told him we would toss out items featuring his design, he felt used. We value him but require a drummer aligned with our musical goals. We also started writing original music, but he hasn't contributed anything yet.So tell me... AITA?(I'll clarify anything in the comments, as it's early and I'm super tired, so I probably didn't explain the situation properly).

title: AITA for spending time with other friends?!
body: TL;DR my friend is 6 months into a breakup and not moving on, I made plans with other friends and she’s not happy with meMy friend is 6 months into a break up with someone she dated for a year… relationship was full of red flags. AITA here and not being supportive?

title: AITA for never cleaning up after my roommate?
body: I (19F) moved out for the first time with one of my friends awhile ago. We met through a mutual friend. We never had a lease, because she wanted to be able to kick me out in case I was a bad roommate, and I was fine with that, because I also wanted the ability to leave whenever I wanted. Well recently she kicked me out unceremoniously when I came home after spending the day at my parents. Her reasoning was that I never did anything. I never cleaned, I never did the dishes or vacuumed, she said I wasn't "ready to be a roommate" and I wasn't doing anything to help her mental health.I felt really bad because that sounds like I really was terrible to live with, but then I thought about it. I really didn't do anything, including contribute to the mess. None of the mess was mine. Our apartment looked like a disaster constantly, there were always clothes everywhere, there were always dishes piled up in the sink, and none of it was ever mine. I was never really home, because I'd always be working or hanging out with friends, it was very rare that I spent a day in the apartment, but when I did, I'd do my laundry and I'd always put it away. When I cooked, I never left my dishes out. I would always wash them in the crowded sink, and when the dishwasher was full (every time) I would wash my dishes by hand. The apartment looked horrible, and I contributed to none of it. I wasn't even really allowed in the main spaces anyway. When I tried to put my own stuff out, she'd say I needed to put it away or her cats would vomit on it, which I get isn't her fault, but it kind of further marked her territory to say "this is not your space." And when I did finally get some furniture that was mine, she would tell me I need to put it in my room or get rid of it because there was no space among the disaster we were living in. All I had was my bedroom, yet she wanted me to clean up her mess in the space I wasn't allowed in.I asked why she never brought up to me that she wanted me to clean more, and she replied she "shouldn't have to mother me," which I understand, but I also don't get how I could have known? Like I've never moved out before, but I didn't realize it was an expectation of me to pick up after her. I never asked her to do my dishes, or pick up my laundry (because it was always in my room) so I don't get if I should have just known? I can't vacuum the floor if it's covered in her yarn, I can't wipe down the counters when there's dried pasta noodles stuck to the surface, and cereal boxes stacked up, but maybe that's just a thing everybody knows? Like is part of being a roommate picking up after the person you're living with? Because I was under the impression it was like a "carry your own weight, and help if they ever ask you to" (she would occasionally ask me to tackle her mountain of dishes in the sink, and I always would, but if I'm not asked to, then I'm gonna assume you'll do it, because they're all your dishes)AITA? Should I have done more to help?

title: AITA for wanting to go to a new restaurant?
body: I live with two college buddies (all three of us 25-26M). For sake of this post, we’ll call us the roomies. We are very close with an engaged couple (25M, 26F) who are also friends of ours from college. The five of us spend a lot of time together.In general, I would say I am by far the most interested in trying new things, such as new and interesting activities, or new places to go out to eat. The other four generally like to do the same types of things. This is especially true for the engaged couple. As far as hangouts go, they almost always would like to have us at their place, have drinks, and play a board game called betrayal at the house on the hill. For going out to eat, the engaged couple are especially passionate about two restaurants in our town and always want to go there. One, called Hip-stir, is generally pretty good. The other one, called goldfinch, is generally not a very good restaurant. The roomies agree.Tonight, the guys plan to go out to eat. All three of the roomies say in the chat that we want to go to a specific restaurant, nice sports bar type place to watch an nfl playoff game. The engaged guy says he wants to go goldfinch because they have a special this weekend that he wanted. Both of the roomies cave and say we can go there as long as we can see a tv. I call them because we were all on the same page about not wanting to go there. They say they don’t want to be the bad guy, but if I say something they’ll back me. I respond to the chat saying that I would still vote for the other place as I don’t think goldfinch has very good food, and asked if the engaged guy would consider a new place and maybe get the special tomorrow. A little while later, he responds and says that he is really not feeling bar food and would rather join us after if we decide to eat there.Knowing I’d lost the roomies, I finally just said I’d go to goldfinch. However, I think it’s very dumb. I know it seems tacky, but it’s sort of the tip of the iceberg for what I feel a lot of the time.WIBTA if I made a stand today and said I didn’t want to spend $20+ at a place that 3 out of the 4 of us would rather not go to, and 1 (me) is very opposed to? And that maybe we could try literally ANY other place?

title: AITA for not wanting to join a group holiday after my last experience
body: AITA … my partner and I want to go to Bali but I don’t want to go on guided tour with a group of strangers… context - we did this when we went to Galapagos and I didn’t have a good experience - we spent from 6am-6/7pm with the people on our tour who were lovely but I wanted quality time with my partner in the evenings and I near enough had to insist on such and then we would argue when we were alone as he wanted to be with the other travellers, I was unsocial, selfish blah blah (we had three evenings out of 6 with each other). Lots more things happened but I won’t bore the post further. One other couple in our group had their evenings just them, the rest were individual travellers who grouped together. I still talk to the people from our holiday now so I got along great with them.  I have tried compromising with Bali and said a split trip - few days with a group with boundaries but I’m called unsocial, jealous, etc. I really don’t want to go with a tour group again and I’m getting uncomfortable with the pressure. - he’s reason for this are  - tours are guided and you see everything you could see and he’s a “social being” .

title: AITA, or rather WIBTA, for ratting my dad out?
body: I’ve (12m) kept some of my dad’s secrets for a while now. I love my father to the moon and back but he does some messed up stuff behind my mom’s back. He had my sister and my brother with two other women than my mom, but after they were born, he and the other 2 women kinda fell apart. He married my mom in 2020. This kept up until my mom spoke up about him going over to her house almost every weekend.  I’ve never ratted on him because like I said I love my dad to death and he’s been a huge part of my life. That being said I’m currently sitting in the bathroom taking an explosively charged dump. My dad is downstairs railing some random woman, and he thinks I’m sleep right now. My birthday is in less than a week so I’m definitely not going to say now, but WIBTA for telling on my dad? title: AITA (22F) for confronting my (23M) bf when he’s going thru withdraw?
body: My (23M) and I (22F) have been fighting a lot this past week.it seems like a lot has been setting him off cuz he’s quitting smoking. I do understand what he is going thru, I myself quit smoking a year ago and went thru similar things. I do feel like I handled my anger better in that time and have been better about how I react since then. I picked up extra hours at work this week since he’s in between jobs. I also have a lot going on like a death in the family I found out today and having to talk to detectives about trauma I went thru as a child; that I had the courage to finally talk about and name my abuser. Not to mention doing school and working a full time job. Today we went to my sisters house to visit and saw my nephew. When I was playing with my nephew my bf told me that my sisters husband kept staring at my butt. He told me this when we left their house. He has had issues with this in the past and wants me to change what I wear. He thinks that I show off my body all the time and it’s disrespectful to him and disrespectful how other men look at me. He said that if I loved him like I say I do that I’d be willing to wear baggy clothes and longer shirts that cover my figure. For those wondering I was wearing a grey sweatshirt and leggings. I had enough from everything going on this week and told him how I feel like it’s so difficult to communicate even before him quitting weed. When I try to communicate how I feel it becomes to a bigger fight when I want to talk it out. Like how he gets mad for what I wear and how other men look at me (trust me I don’t enjoy it) I told him multiple times in the past that my pants just don’t fit me rn and I’d like to go to the gym but he doesn’t want me going since other men look at me and I’d like to get new pants but I can’t really afford alot. I also communicated that it sucks how I have been going thru alot this week and am being there for him and he can’t be there for me and has been making me feel like poop for the whole week when I already am depressed. I also mentioned other things I’ve been feeling and holding in. Am I the A-hole? Should I have been more empathetic when he’s going thru withdraw?

title: AITA for taking a job my friend told me to apply for?
body: Context: my friend (25 n/b) sent me (22 F) a job app for the same company they work at (1 mo ago.)I was hesitant to apply but my friend kept telling me to (saying “im going to keep bugging you until you apply,”) so I did.I originally declined the position, but the company came back with another offer. So I accepted. (This was on Tuesday)Since they insisted multiple times that I apply, I figured they’d be happy when I told them. I was incorrect.They’re giving mixed messages since I called them and told them I got the job. At first they were happy for me but their tone was off. They kept seeming more weird so I asked if they were okay. they said that they’ve been having reservations on whether they should have told me about the job or not (reminder: they sent this over a month ago). they are worried us working together might be a bad idea and that our friendship will blow up and then it will be awkward at work. (My friend has a history of tumultuous relationships. I like them a lot but have bad luck with friendships).I tried to assure them tht it would b ok. We don’t have a history of drama (though we’ve only been friends around 6 m, and I do NOT do drama. it causes me so much distress. I have never had a friendship “blow up.”I thought everything was ok but then when we were texting the next day (Wed) they brought up more of their reservations.For context, my friend has mentioned multiple times that they’d like to kiss me (they casually make out with some of their friends). There’s not anything wrong with that, but I’m just not a “make out with my friends” sort of person so I’ve said no every time. I’m not very big on physical contact for various reasons. But, I do cuddle with them because I know that physical touch is their love language and I do like it because I’m comfortable with them.Anyway, when texting they said “i have a rule that I don’t kiss coworkers, so if you ever want to take me up on the kiss thing it’ll have to be before you start working here.” And that they’d have to think on cuddling. I told them I thought that was understandable and to lmk what they’re comfy with.While on the topic of work/friendship, I said I think we should try to keep work talk at a min outside of work.They then said they didn’t have enough energy for this and that they were going to bed and abruptly ended the convo.They had a 12 hr day so it I makes sense that they’re tired. I thought they’d reach out the next day when they were rested. They did not.Its been 2 days. Idk what to do.AITA? I think I fucked up somehow but idk what I did. We had plans to hang out tomorrow but I don’t know what’s goin on.Should I reach out to them to see what’s up?I don’t want to lose them but also wtf? Why would they wait until AFTER I’ve accepted the job to tell me they didn’t think it was a good idea? Should I take the job at all?

title: AITA for talking to my ex to get a new car
body: Im a (25) woman that was dating a guy (28) he wrecked my car on Jan. 2023. In the month of february he went to jail and has gotten out in November all in the year of 2023. He is definitely on his feet and can at least make any effort in repaying me or getting me a car in general. Even if it's monthly payments or all at once. I do keep him around in case he finally comes around and give me the money deserve. Whenever I speak about getting me the money or even getting me a rental it's always some excuse. He post on social media all the time of money/products or when we are on facetime he's in the mall buying $300-$400 worth of cologne, apple products, nike techs jump suits anything you can think of or at home telling whoever he's with at the time he'll buy the groceries. It's very upsetting because i've been on my own since 18 I worked really hard to get and maintain that car and to just see it get taken away from the hands of someone else really hurt me. After losing my car I was in a serious car accident in a lyft that stop me from working. Now that I am able to work but i'm very traumatized from being in a ride share I can't bring myself to get in another one. So I sit in the house most days trying to figure out life and physically getting my body back healthy and mentally trying to stay sane. He's moving on with his life and i'm just here. I make known to him how uncomfortable, mad, and disappointed I am. Which leads to days of not speaking. Once again I keep him around to see what he's going to do no way shape or form am I attracted to him but I want him around to see if things will be made right. I know that may be stupid we are in different state right now so facetime is all we have until next month when I go home. Things will probably not change but I am ready to get my life back please any advice will be helpful on my next couple of steps.

title: AITA for ignoring my boyfriend?
body: So, me ( f 23) and my bf ( 22 ) are living together with my mom. We all live together as we moved from our country to another country and rent is high so it is better for us to live together. He moved here about year and half ago and we have THREE dogs. I work full time, study part time, my bf works full time and after his work he does some deliveries as a side income. My mom is currently not working due to health issues. I am not some clean freak, but I like my house to be clean and tidy. Having 3 dogs means house needs to be maintained. When we are at work my mom does a little bit around the house. When I come home I cook, clean around the kitchen, feed dogs etc. My bf is the type of person who needs to be told what to do ( even he says he isnt), but I feel like he does not see things that need to be done. EVERY weekend I am cooking, cleaning, doing laundry, cleaning our bedroom etc.. We walk our dogs together on weekend. Now the issue is that every time when he comes home from work he opens a beer and smokes a happy cigarette (ya know what I mean) and after that he plays fortnite or watches yt. He says he needs some time for himself and that happens on the weekend too. He sleeps till 2-3 pm, wakes up, smokes, eats, watches yt and if scheduled for that day ( which is not every day nor every weekend ) he goes and does delieveries. I get that he works a lot and that he is tired, but I also work and I study. I dont have "me time" on the weekends or during a week. This has been going on for a year and half now, and three weeks ago he said that he is scheduled for only two days to do deliveries and that he will do more around the house and take care of dogs... he did nothing.. so on Sunday I made lunch and he woke up at 2 pm and ate.. I asked if he will take dogs for a walk and he said that he just ate and that he will relax and go to work. I got pissed off and stopped talking to him ( its Friday now) for five days now. In the past I did try to communicate this with him and things would be okay for like few days and that is it. I told few of my friends about this and one of the friends told me that I am behaving like a child and that I am the A hole for not talking to him and ignoring him. I am being petty towards him, but I do not think I am the A hole. I am just fed up!So, am I the A hole?

title: AITA, for locking my friends out of my house after they locked me out of my room
body: Before you jump to conclusions yes it does seem like I am without context but I genuinely think I wasn’t in the wrong and don’t think they were either… I (M15) invited 2 friends over the house both M15. It was a half day at school and I had the house to myself.
