title: AITA for going to WingStop?
body: A little back story, I (21F) have a roommate (21F), we’ll call her bubbles. My roommate has 4 siblings, one of them being a 18M-Mark. Mark has a girlfriend Alyssa (18F). I have only met Mark and Alyssa a few times in a group settings but we haven’t talked much in the group. Two nights ago they come over to our house along with Bubble’s other sister. We are all talking and Mark mentions his new job at WingStop and we all jokingly ask if we can get free food. He mentions that with other restaurants they will sometimes trade food. I work at a well known steakhouse down the street. Last night I get off work around 11. At that point there is only about 3 places open and I decide to stop by WingStop to grab food for me and my roommate. The fact that her brother worked there was an afterthought. When I walk in I see him in the back cooking so I nod to him and say hey, he nods back then goes to the back of the restaurant where I can’t see him. I order my food, wait, and then leave. This morning I wake up to a text from his girlfriend Alyssa. She says that me showing up to his place of work unannounced made him uncomfortable and was disrespectful. She says that she wants to set a boundary since they don’t have opposite sex friends in their relationship. I share this with my roommate and she tells me that Alyssa asked for my number the night before under the pretense that she wanted to send me something real quick and that it was good to have in case something were to happen and they needed to get ahold of us. I respond to Alyssa saying that I apologize for making him uncomfortable. I explain that there is not much open at that hour and in my mind if I didn’t say hi that would be disrespectful. She then responds repeating how it was weird that I showed up and that it would’ve been ok if I came with bubbles since we are friends and that is his sister. I said it was good to have boundaries but that I won’t be announcing when I plan to go somewhere to someone I barely know. She had brought up the free food thing so I explain that we had been joking and that I never asked for anything from him, that I simply said hi so that hopefully we could all be on a good standing bc I assume they would be coming over more in the future-which is now not happening. I stated that next time I wouldn’t say hi and that I will go there again at some point and this is my only warning. She says it’s ok to go to WingStop and that she just wanted to set a boundary, I ask her what her boundary is exactly since nothing else happened. She says that I shouldn’t expect free food and that was her only point. Meanwhile my roommate texts her saying she doesn’t appreciate being lied to in order to get my number. She responds saying she meant no hate but that we wouldn’t understand since they are in a “traditional relationship” and that we have different views. To multiple of our messages Alyssa responds with a laughing emoji or lol. My issue is if it was about the free food then why did she mention their traditional relationship and how they can’t have opposite friendships. This isn’t the first problem my roommate and her family have had with her. So my question is- AITA for going to WingStop?

title: AITA for staying over at my dad's for the weekend?
body: I (F16) was adopted at birth by my dad (M59) mum (F57). It was a closed adoption, they didn't even want to tell me the names of my parents until I probed them for answers.I love my adoptive parents, but there are generational divides, it's strange to compare my upbringing to my friends with younger parents. My parents never allow me to dress in anything they consider immodest, make up has to be kept minimal, they insist on taking me to school and then picking me up - I practically have no freedom.They have different views on adoption, they said that since my bio parents didn't raise me, that they shouldn't matter to me and that I shouldn't try to seek them out since that chapter of my life is closed.Not too long ago, my uncle reached out to me, he managed to find me on instagram. I did make sure to find out if he was actually the brother of my dad. I started texting my dad, Llyam (M, 34), and we became close. I had asked my parents if it'd be alright to meet with him in person, which they agreed to if they could come as well. It was awkward with them there, but it was lovely to meet him. He answered every question I had and he tried to put my parents at ease, saying that he wasn't trying to take over, but he'd want a relationship with me.They still don't like him and are uncomfortable with me being close with him.Last Friday, I got into a bad argument with my parents and it resulted with me leaving home. I got the train over to his apartment. It's lush, he lives in a huge, high rise apartment near the center of the city. He and his gf (F30) have even decorated it so it looks like something of maximalism pinterest. He let me in because he couldn't just turn me away, and asked about what was going on.When I told him, he was understanding and let me stay, but he made me call my parents first. They were still mad as ever, and blew up when I told them I was gonna stay with Llyam until things calm down a bit at home. I almost automatically got the train over to his apartment. It's lush, he lives in a huge, high rise apartment near the center of the city. He and his gf (F30) have even decorated it so it looks like something straight out of maximalism pinterest. He let me in and asked about what was going on.When I told him, he was understanding, but made me call my parents first. They were still mad, blew up when I told them I was staying with Llyam until things calm down a bit at home.I spent the whole weekend there and it was lovely, Llyam, Sian and I did have a great time together, they even took me to Afflecks and bought me hair dye and band tshirts lol.When Llyam dropped me off home on Monday, ready to apologize and talk to them, my parents were still angry. They said that he had no right letting me stay over without permission and that what I did was extremely disrespectful. They said that they forbid me ''coming and going'' and grounded me. Ifeel bad for angering them, my friend said that I was wrong to ditch them like that.

title: WIBTA for standing up for ourselves against my uncle?
body: The problem is with my (32) aunt’s husband (65). He has a strong personality, he is the only one who can be right about everything, everyone else is stu*id.Since he loves to cook and throw parties, all bigger family events are at their house. He drinks while cooking, which he continues afterwards, he pours alcohol to everyone and he hardly takes no for an answer. He usually gets drunk (but not like totally drunk) by the time we get to the food. And that's where it all goes wrong.He is constantly criticizing everyone, mumbling, invalidating other people's feelings or preferences, but even on the most insignificant things, like someone liking chicken, because he thinks it's not a proper meat. I always get very upset when he starts this behavior, but I never say anything. Neither do anyone else, we just put up with it. You just can’t argue with him, we all know that.Last time, however, it got to the point where he wanted to shut down a topic he didn't like (he doesn't think there is or should be solidarity, everyone s*its on each other anyway. He is a doctor so it’s even more incomprehensible.), and my mum said he was wrong and society should look after people in need.After a few minutes he stood up and pointed at my mum and told her to stop right now. End of conversation, he didn’t want to hear about this nonsense.No one said anything and I got so angry. No one dare point fingers at my mom or anyone else. I almost stood up too and said something nasty, but I didn't. On what basis does he shut another person down (especially family) and point fingers?  He is like a petulant and stubborn child.I don’t think that I could hold my frustration back anymore. We have this scene almost every time we go over. Next time like this, I will explode, I’m sure. I already have a whole monologue in my head to snap back at him, but I’m afraid that it would ruin our family. Or he would send me home/never invite us anymore or worse. I also feel sorry for my aunt whom I really love and my very old grandma lives next door too.Other times, when he is not drunk, he is quite normal, helpful and funny and usually doesn’t remember these conversations.I'm fed up with this situation and that nobody is doing anything, but maybe they are more experienced and know that it is not worth it. My dad told me to let it go and not argue, but my sense of justice and anger are so strong.So, WBTAH if I open my mouth next time?

title: AITA for “hating” on my BF family?
body: Hello guys, first of all I’m sorry for my english (not my first language). So I (21F) mooved with my BF (23) like a half year ago, we are together for 3 years. title: AITA for not wanting to celebrate my grandparents 60th on my birthday?
body: Im not to sure on this one, and this is my first and probably only post.  But a little backstory, im turning 14 this year, and i know its not an amazing number to celebrate. But even though im young i was diagnosed with depression when i was 12 from severe bullying from ages 6-12ish, it stopped when i went to highscool. I know i sound selfish, and my mum has said i am being selfish. But my best friend says im reasonable.  But for the last few years my birthday has just reminded me of shitty stuff i wont go into, and i havent had the energy to ever be excited for it (along with Christmas and other holiday's). But this year is different. Since going to highschool i have found my group, healthy relationship, but the only problem is my mums boundaries. Which im working with a therapist for. Now im sorry if the lay out is confusing, my apologies. But onto the story.So me, and family, and my mums side (cousins, aunts and uncles) all go on a big trip just for newyears. And this year my Aunty came to, me and my family were leaving the next day and i was saying goodbye, when she asked me, "Am i going to see you for Grandma and grandpa's 60th?" I asked when it was, and she continued with "(Weekend of my birthday)" i was a little shocked bc my parents hadnt told me, and its been in the plan for months it seems. But i smiled and said "Yeah i will be." I was a little sad and brough it up to my mum and dad that night, which i was told "Dont talk about it." And "It doesnt matter." So i left it. I brought it back up a few days later and i was shut down by my mum with the words, "We are going and theres no discussion." I just agreed and asked questions, like: "what day are we celebrating." Which i was told my birthday, they are celebrating it on my birthday, which i was annoyed about. But i let it go. Today i followed up with mum asking "Can i go stay at a friends for that weekend?" Again told a no, and words along the lines of: "No, you are not missing your grandparents moment, this is really big for them." I asked "More important then my day, i would atleast like the day about me, just one day of the year." Which she continued with, "We can celebrate (My birthday) the next day," i forgot a lot but i heard the words selfish. I dropped it again. But i dont know if im being an ass, i mean, i love my grandparents, but they make me uncomfortable to not want to be around. And that goes for my whole family. My cousins and all. I dont get along with any of them, being the youngest while the rest of my cousins and my brother are adults, the only one that isnt an adult acts like shes 25.I feel selfish and i dont know what to do anymore, and i feel like shit. I just want one day about me. Sorry if this is long, i just needed an outside opinion. Again, i know 14 isnt a big number, but i really think this is for myself. Thank if you read this rant, sorry again if i come off as selfish.

title: AITA for leading him on?
body: I (19F) have this friend (19M) let’s call him Sam. Sam and I have always kinda known each other because his best mate dated one of my friends. At this one party, Sam’s friend approached me and told me that Sam had a thing for me so I should only hang out with him if I like him. I kind of suspected Sam liked me as more than friends but thought this comment was weird. So the rest of the party I didn’t know how to act around Sam and it was awkward. He messaged me the next day saying sorry for how he acted, I replied“all good, don’t worry about it. I’m happy we’re friends”. Fast forward to New Year’s, I asked him to trade drinks with me but he ended up just buying me a box. I got really drunk and was hanging out with him at the club the following night. He was buying me drinks the whole time and while we were chatting I was sitting on his lap. He walked me home, gave me his hoodie, said goodnight and went back to his place. Then the last couple weekends, he’s been trying to convince me to go out, but I offered to be sober d instead. He paid me $50 one night even though I told him not to. Then last night, I was sober d for my girl friends and he was messaging me saying he’d like to shout me dinner and drinks, he’d find us a ride home or pay for the taxi or whatever. I said thanks, but wasn’t going out. I saw him at the bar (planning to stay for a bit after dropping people off) and when he was buying a round I asked if I could still get a ride home with him. he said yeah, decided what the hell I would have a few drinks. We were having a good time and a few drinks turned into shots, then going to the club. He bought me some more drinks, then we went home together and he had his arms around me the whole way which I didn’t mind but in retrospect was maybe giving him mixed signals. He’s a really sweet guy, also picking me up the next morning to go get my car and he had bought me a coffee which was really thoughtful.So AITA for leading him on even though I told him we were just friends?

title: AITA? I kicked a girl out of my place.
body: She kinda just like insisted she wanted to stay over for the weekend which I agreed to. She kept pushing my boundaries and over staying her welcome. I have a really difficult time standing up for myself and I also have trouble reconciling my feelings with objectivity sometimes. She did buy food while she was here but kept insisting she wanted a relationship with me despite barely knowing one another. She would also talk about how pretty I am nonstop and it bothered me when I started picking up vibes that she just wanted another pretty face in her life after she left her abusive ex. I told her up front I am poly amorous but she kept trying to convince me I should reconsider and be with her. Then she would say "Yeah I want to move things slowly." She also didn't have a history of doing a whole lot of things other than smoking weed. I didn't get angry at her, I just kinda freaked out a little bit because I didn't feel respected in the moment. I guess I could've communicated more effectively. I wasn't really that physically attracted to her in the first place, but we still ended up sleeping together one time while she was here. I asked her to leave and that I needed space and she took it kinda hard and cried, I think she was kinda under the impression that she was going to move in with me for some reason. AITA?

title: AITA for not apologizing
body: My mother strongly favors one sibling out of many siblings, the oldest (‘that sister') who my mother frets over because she is insecure and uses bullying behavior as a life strategy. The rest of us are used to the preferential treatment and warped sense of reality, and hearing on a regular basis how about all the’ incredible deeds’ of this ‘wonderful’ sibling. My mother belittles and makes fun of a different sister, and she is currently not talking to me because I do not participate with her comments.Years ago I took on a public role within my community - a remote small town. This experience was very meaningful to me because of who I am.. ‘That sister’ - out of nowhere - decided to take on the same role, then choosing to have her endeavor involve a person from my town. Even though we had not spoken in 5 years at that point, ‘that sister’ chose to link herself with my town at least 600 miles from her own. Because of the endeavor,  ‘that sister’ became intertwined with Luke. Luke and I were not friends per se but shared social circles. I had known and cared for Luke (way more than I had known, cared for or interacted with ‘that sister’ for over 10 years). ‘That sister’ did this without my knowledge; my mother informed me about ‘that sister’s connection to Luke.Fast forward a couple years… ‘that sister’ and Luke had a terrible falling out. ‘That sister’ trashed Luke in her own small community where Luke has family and friends. ‘His relationships with his own family and friends were strained because of ‘that sisters’ talking about him in her town. ‘That sister’ often lies and will lie when she is mad or to win an argument. A few years ago, I ran into Luke after not seeing him for a while. He expressed pain and exasperation about the situation with my sister. In empathy for him, I shared with him that I had not talked to or seen ‘that sister’ in over a decade, and that my sister was ruthless in how she fought with everyone. Luke relayed that info to ‘that sister’, which was understandable.Because my mother is mad at me about Lily, my mother is now declaring that I am not a loyal person and that I owe ‘that sister’ an apology. My mother has excluded me from her life based on this past incident which ‘that sister’ may have again mentioned to her again.I feel like my mother and ‘that sister’ are 100% really dysfunctional, and that given that this is the landscape of my relationships with my mother and ‘that sister’, that I really don’t want to be resolving anything, that instead, firm boundaries are in need because there is no way to have truthful conversation. My mother is old though, and I may not have that much time with her. AITA for not just giving in and saying whatever apology to ‘that sister’ so that I am able to see my mother. Even if I am NTA… do you do whatever to maintain a relationship with an older mother which means I apologize to ‘that sister’ which could be dangerous because it could open up communication with an extremely toxic person?

title: AITA for talking bad about my "friend" on purpose?
body: Me and my friend (Bee) were talking about how bad of a friend (Star) was. For context, Star treated us terrible, she insulted us and played it off as a joke (she mostly said real hurtful/personal stuff), and whenever we tried to tell her to stop saying such personal things, she'd complain we were too sensitive. BUT when we make a harmless joke (call her dumb or something) she would get mad and then start complaining.(example, she complained how all of her friends called her dumb and she believed it. Star thought she was dumb and ugly and whenever we tried comforting her, she would always be like "No, i'm really dumb actually" and continue to list things. We try to tell her it's all in good fun and we don't mean it, she continues to throw a pity party)Besides that, she has often talked about my friends or other people either in front of them or behind their backs. Everyone talks bad about other people, it's common. But it's stupid if you talk bad about someone and then complain that someone else did the same thing to you. (She made a tiktok saying 'imagine talking bad about me infront of me'. Irony.Bee continued to say how she could see how bad of a friend she was to, specifically, me. Whenever something happened (be it caused by me or her or both of us), I always had to own up to it, even if it was partially her fault. She constantly broke off our friendship (temp) when she wanted to and I was always hurt, never her. She never apologized too,Besides being a bad friend to me and my other friends, she did so many more things, (shaming people for their body, victim blaming, hypocrisy, etc)Since Star overheard me talking bad about her (I did it on purpose so she can finally realize i'm not her friend anymore at all) she started talking bad about me too. I talked about how bad of a friend she was, but she talked about things that were irrelevant (my appearance, personal things, etc). (not that it rlly bothers me, just thought I had to include that)She's gotten her friends to come after me (she doesn't wanna confront up first) and think she hasn't done anything wrong to me, and even when i straight up said that she was toxic to her friends, they dismissed saying she wasn't toxic at all.

title: AITA for not replying to messages straight away?
body: I hate texting; I always have. I'm on social media but only have 50 friends on each platform; it's literally the same platform. Many people have my number; I have nearly 70 contacts on my phone. When I receive a text, I read it straight away but wait to respond. Most of the time, I don't respond straight away because I'm at work. However, I tend to respond about five hours later; sometimes, I don't respond at all. If I don't respond quickly, my family and friends will message me on all my social media platforms. My sister messages me saying she's had enough of me either not responding straight away or within an hour or two, not responding at all, or taking ages to respond. My sister said it's rude and aholeish.She was so mad that she'd put up a rant on Facebook and tagged me to see the post. All my friends were commenting on the post, saying they thought I was rude for not responding within two hours. Many have said they texted me in an emergency, and I didn't respond till later. I looked back at these messages and all of them aren't actual emergencies. If someone was dying or hurt I'd respond straight away. One of my friends commented the other day saying he texted me in an emergency, which was if I want a takeaway when I'm at his and if so, what? To him, that's an emergency, but to me, it wasn't.Am I the asshole for not responding to any messages straight away?

title: AITA for rehoming my existing tortoise?
body: My partner and I are separating. We have a tortoise we acquired together before we had kids. We've had him almost 10 years. We have 3 other pets. I have wanted to rehome the tortoise for years. My partner wants me to keep the tortoise (and all the other pets) since I am staying in the family home with the kids. But I no longer want to take care of the tortoise. He brings me no joy and I am stressed he is not getting proper care or the love he deserves. I want my partner to take him, but they say they don't have the space and their mom doesn't want the tortoise at their house. My partner technically lives at their moms, but really they are never there and sleep at their new partners every night. They are trying to put that I have to continue caring for the tortoise in the parenting plan. I am quite sure they can convince their mom to take the tortoise, or if they really wanted him they would just bring him where they live and deal with the repercussions there. I have given a hard line on taking the tortoise by the end of January or I rehome him. Would I be the asshole if I rehome the tortoise? This will hurt my ex as he won't see the tortoise anymore.

title: AITA for calling my aunt instead of my mom for a migraine attack?
body: Can someone please tell me if I was an asshole in this situation?So, today I had a really bad migraine attack. I was sobbing from the pain, I couldn't see very well and it was very scary. I feel so bad.

title: AITA For not wanting to Hang with my Brother?
body: Basiclly, our Parents passed away and the brother and I share the family home to which he lives there and works on his computer.My current Job is two and a half hours away from home and I commute there during the week and pay rent down there. I then drive up to the family home on Fridays for the weekend.The aim is to have our house on the rental market so I can part ways and live somewhere else with better work and utilise that rental income still.In order to do this, the house still requires a little more rennovation work to be done. This is why I come home on the weekends to try get things done. (mow lawn, Assemble shed, painting, fixing doors etc)The issue is, I mostly come home on a Friday to a house that is filthy. Always dishes and food left out, floors aren't vaccumed, bins aren't taken out (smells) His laundry is just sort of everywhere, doesn't really have a system in place to put it anywhere. Grass in the yard just keeps on growing and growing taller.Usually I end up cleaning this mess, but it feels like it doesn't end. By the time Ive driven 2+ hours on Friday night and done some dishes. I feel drained and it's hard to crack on with the actual jobs for the house.I've explained to him all year how I feel about this and that it's stressing me out and making my life harder. I've offered to list jobs for him to do on a whiteboard on the fridge but still never gets done.Our Mother used to clean up alot so I think it's a hard habit for him to shake but none the less the outcome is the same and every Friday and I still come home to a stinky house!feel more and more bitter with him (which i don't want to)  but I'm not sure how to actually help him take a bit of initiative or shared sense of pride in our home?I guess his idea is that he works his computer all day with his business and that I'm just being a clean freak making him do this and that. Realisticly he also wouldn't have the same incentive as me to clean or look after the house as he's there rent free.Anyway he asks why I'm not coming to his barbeque on Saturday and I said because i feel upset and disrespected by you. He the played the old "one day I might be dead before you and you'll wish you did"Tia, Happy to wrong if I'm the asshole but let me know what you think cheers.

title: AITA for saying it’s okay that my friend has to pee(?)
body: This is my first time writing here and it’s a throw away account, so I (19F) have a very close friend also (19F). But this happened a Friday, where we had been drinking a little bit at a gathering, We had been talking with mutual friend outside of a convenience store, were we asked if we could join his classes party, where he then said no sorry and then shortly after he left with his friends. And they walked through my towns very small mall.Me and my friend we then chat a lil more for a few minutes and then both agree that we really have to pee, I suggest we go to the malls public toilet. Which she is very against saying that the guy we just talked with will think that we’re following him (which is a little silly) so she suggested that we ask to use the staff bathroom in the convenience store. And we kinda went back and forth, and couldn’t really agree, so I suggested that she goes into the convenience store and I got to mall (its right beside each other).She then gets very annoyed with me and says “FINE, but this is the last time I got with what you are suggesting”We then head over to the mall, which is only like a 2 minute walk. We then find out the toilets are closed. So I said “it’s okay, we’ll just find a toilet, another place” and then she got very angry with me and started saying “no it’s not okay!! I told you it was a dumb idea and you still insisted and now I really have to pee!!” I then got an uncomfortable and nervous so I said “it’s okay” and she took that as me saying it’s okay that she really has to pee?So she said “are you saying that it’s okay that I’m about to piss my pants!?” And got even more angry with me. To which I was very confused and didn’t really know what to say, and she was just getting more and more angry. So I told her that I was really uncomfortable with how angry she was getting.She then gets even more angry and starts cussing me out for making her seem like some crazy angry person, and I kind of panicked and tried my best to calm the situation down and I said “can’t we please talk about this? Like communicate” (and I will admit it maybe wasn’t the best to say, but I was doing my best) and then she got even more angry and told me she didn’t want any of my therapist bullsh*t and then she left saying that she thinks I’m really weird and that other people think the same.And now she’s talking about me behind my back and saying people she probably will forgive me and be friends with me, since I don’t have any friends(?).I personally think the situation is very childish and I’m just tired of being scared of her short temper. So am I the asshole?

title: AITA for spending my time with my boyfriend
body: AITA for spending my free time with my boyfriendI (22F) live with my two childhood best friends ( 23F and 21F) and we’ve lived together for 3/4 years relatively no issues.I recently started seeing someone for the first time in 4 years. I do admittedly spend most of my free time with him and we’re apart for about 2 days once a week for the past month or so.My roomates have gotten to the point that if I’m at his house they’re texting and calling me about how I need to come home and when I do come home start screaming matches about about how I’m never there. After we had a  conversation about 2 weeks ago i attempted to make changes.The weekend before last I made plans for me and my roomates to out. He spent the night Friday and I woke him up to kick him out at 12:20 pm Saturday  (let me be precise since she brought up the exact time in an argument) and she was upset that it wasn’t soon enough. We spent all of Saturday together had a sleep over and spend most of Sunday together. I left for his when she said she was going to her room at 7 pm, but she was still upset i was going to his house.I ended up getting sick and spent Monday there to, then Tuesday was a bad storm that cancelled work then i home on Wednesday. He did come over on ThursdayThis past weekend we went out together Friday and this time he went with us because they invited him. The 21F (the one who’s most upset) went on a date and told us she’d meet up but never did. I did sit in her room for two hours in the morning so we could talk about the date before she left to visit family until Sunday. She did not ask about my night. When she left for her family I went to his house until Monday (a holiday) which of course upset her.I  came home Tuesday but was sick and staying in my room. She came in to tell me i shouldn’t have come home if i was sick so i went back to his, which upset her. She called and shouted at me for a solid 10 minutes about how bad of a friend i was and how it’s personal. She never asked how i felt or if i was okay.Her stance is still that i don’t care about her but in this entire two weeks she has not had a single conversation with me that was not about how I’m a terrible friend, chores that need to be done (which I’ve done), or the guy in her life after she’s sufficiently yelled at me. She has not asked a single question about how anything I’ve got going on is going yet I’ve asked her constantly about her family, work, and love life.So at this point I can’t tell if I’m the ah and I can’t see it or she is and i don’t know how to approach the situation anymore.

title: WIBTAKicking out my jobless ex
body: Long story. I have been on and off again for 12 years with the mother of my one biological child and been father to her other two children.The problem is, we’ve been co-parenting and living together for two years without being in a relationship. She’s recently started dating and tell me conflicting things. One that I’m so amazing but I’m also shitty because there’s parts of me that aren’t her ideal.During this time, I’ve been the breadwinner, paying all the bills, and still treated her with love and kindness. Until recently, I believed she was the love of my life.The kids spend most of their time with her mom because until Christmas, she was working.  Now she quit her job and is dating someone she constantly wants to bring over and I don’t have any way to relax or enjoy the common areas in my home. She’s not on the mortgage btw.I realized she has just been using me as a backup or ATM and is in my opinion, disrespecting my feelings by bringing her dates here. So I either want to tell her she needs to pay rent or move out in two months. The kids will be fine. Grandma said she’s ok with them living with her and of course I’ll have them on the weekends and not treat them any differently.So would I be the asshole to tell her to leave. Is my idea practical?  At this point, I feel taken advantage of and I long term our situation is a bad idea.

title: WIBTA for not going to my work party?
body: I (26F) work on the side at a wedding venue and at the end of the season they have 2 parties. A staff appreciation dinner then a Holiday party - where the staff and couples from that year come together and celebrate. The staff dinner is 2 days away and I was just asked if I wanted to bring my mom with to the party so the teams are even for games. I am literally the only single staff member, there are only a handful of staff and they are married. I was asked to bring my mom because the owners met her previously (She babysat their children) and they are aware I'm single. This is my first year working there and I have been single the entire time so not sure how the owners "forgot" I'm single until 2 days before? I also think it's awkward that I wasn't asked to bring someone so that I'm not alone...I was asked to bring someone so that teams are equal. I didn't think it was that big of a deal. Long story short my mom isn't able to go so I said I would see about finding a plus one. I have been chatting with this guy for about 2 weeks and we went on 1 date - he is very nice but I don't know if I know him well enough to have to come to my work event with me? Especially an event that I wasn't aware "required " a plus one. He knows about the whole situation and is willing to come with me but not sure if it will be weird?So far it's two options 1. Go solo or 2. Go with Hinge date I met onceBut the story continue, since it's a dinner I asked if they needed me to bring any gluten free item - I was thinking if they had BBQ sandwiches I'd bring bread etc.... Well they completely forgot about my allergies and they are having spaghetti and bread sticks and salad....so I can have salad... And yes there were very much aware of my allergies I was actually given a gluten free treat basket earlier this year after a surgery. - plus the dessert is also not gluten freeSo more options.A - Go alone - eat a side saladB - Go alone - bring my own spaghettiA - Bring Hinge date - eat side saladB - Bring Hinge date - bring my own spaghettiThe Hinge date can eat the regular food but I feel weird going to a party that's supposed to be an appreciation dinner and bringing my own food. Also the staff alternate working the weddings I have only met some of the other staff occasionally and some not at all, so I'm not close with the other staff. Which bring me to options #5 at this point I don't feel like going to either party - because I don't want to have to bring a random guy and bring my own food.So WIBTA if I just replied and said I'm not coming? Since it's a small party it will definitely be noticeable that I'm not there - and the Holiday party I'm supposed to go to say Hi to the couples I worked with, but now I just don't want to, it seems like a hassle. Despite this situation the owners are wonderful to work for and extremely sweet so I don't want to make this look negative on myself for not attending.

title: AITA For Leaving A Friends House Messy After Dogsitting
body: My husband(31) is a professional painter. Recently he offered to paint a few friends houses for deeply discounted rates. Two of these were a couple in which we are closer with the husband. After planning the job (normal price was $5,000 we charged $2,000), everyone found out that Erica, 30 was cheating on Chris, 36. For character background, Chris is a stellar guy, fun to be around, and friends with nearly everyone in our small town. Erica is attractive, charming but also controlling and known for getting people fired from her job. Because the supplies were ready to go we chose to continue and “not take sides” until the project was done. Once caught, Erica decided to make a last minute 11 day trip to an unknown location. She assumed Chris would stay home and watch the dogs but he refused because he felt like she was taking advantage of him by cheating, not answering his calls or messages, and skipping town. He did offer to feed and walk them every day but she wanted someone there overnight and he felt uncomfortable sleeping there. She asked us if we would spend 9 nights sleeping at their house and watching their dogs for free while we painted, we said sure.When we got there, we noticed that she had not pulled everything off of the walls like we had asked. Most painters will not begin work until your stuff is moved and they will not put your things back up either. She apologized so we decided to continue because they are “dealing with a lot”. We spent hours taking down decorations and 8 heavy wooden shelves with cast iron cookware and pottery on top so we could paint. Once the kitchen was done we replaced everything however, it may not have been entirely accurate as we underestimated the amount of things on the shelves. We spent the week painting, walking the dogs, watering the plants, and even cleaned up old dog poop in their backyard. We got paid for the job via Venmo. Once the 9 days were up we swiffered the downstairs, wiped the counters, let the roomba do its thing, and left for a ski trip with mutual friends. We left the bedding on the bed so it wouldn’t mold in the washer. The friends in the ski group were “whistleblowers” in the cheating scandal. Chris also joined the group last minute.Yesterday, my husband texted to ask if Erica was satisfied with the paint. She said the paint job was good but she was “appalled” at the way we left the house. I feel like I’ve been slapped. I don’t think we left the house different than when we arrived and there was no damage done to anything. We asked the person who stayed while we were skiing if he felt like we had left the house a mess and he said no but he thought he saw dishes in the sink. I’m nearly positive we did the dishes but maybe i’m mistaken. We apologized but asked her to elaborate and she has not responded. I’m fluctuating between gaslighting myself, fuming, and feeling taken advantage of.AITA?

title: AITA for spending my birthday money, and being too sick to talk on the phone?
body: My Dad gave me (25 Female) $100.00 for my birthday when I turned 25.  In the moment I asked my friend (26 Female) if she wanted to get tattoos with me.  (I know that's not enough for tattoos but it is enough for a down payment) she said she couldn't get one till she was back from her vacations over the next month or so.   So I spent the money on food.  I had injured my back over the holidays and could not go back to work.  All of my money went to food and things for my injury.  I was in the prosses of looking for a new job that I could do with my back in recovery.When she got back from the vacations, she said she was ready to get tattoos and I told her I spent to money.  She was very upset and said that she could not "financially support me anymore."  She was not financially supporting me.   We would sometimes go out and she would sometimes get me drinks, or a breakfast sandwich.  I always told her that she did not have to, she would reply with something like "You always paid for me during collage, don't worry about it!"So I didn't.  She was so insistent on buying me drinks when we went out that she would get mad when I did not drink. She would be incredibly rude and try to pressure me into drinking. I get drunk very fast, and don't like drinking that much.I then found out that she would switch out my finished drink with one that was only half gone.  I did not know she was doing this, till I caught her do it once while out.  I was very angry.  I talked to my sister about it, and sister said that she saw friend do it a few time when we went out and I was really angry, so I stopped drinking in front of my friend.  (my sister thought I knew)Then in June I was incredibly sick.  I went to the ER three times and had to be on a Clear Liquid Diet.  I had a fever, I was vomiting, had hives, and could not walk. I had to be helped everywhere.  She tried to call me. I don't remember anything about the call, but saying "I cant talk," hung up and went back to sleep.She has not talked to me since.  Even when I messaged her to tell her that I did not have cancer.  Or when I told her that I was moving and asked what she wanted me to do with some of her things I was holding for her.I genuinely don't understand why she is so upset.  Did I do something wrong?  AITAH?(Sorry for any spelling/grammar mistakes, I am severely dyslexic.)

title: WIBTA for not paying the delivery fee for shared groceries with my roommate?
body: INFO: My housemate of 6 months (college friend before) and I have a routine of taking turns buying groceries each week, and having an open fridge policy when it comes to food. Typically what we do is, for example, have me do groceries one week and we split the bill down the middle. The next week Roomie does groceries and we split that bill down the middle. Of course if one of us buys something extra he doesn't want to share that person will cover the cost of the whole item, but otherwise it's 50/50. Overall I like this system and don't mind continuing to do this. But what I do have a problem with is division of labor, I guess I'll call it.My roommate rarely shops in person and prefers to use Instacart for convenience. For the first couple of months we lived together I used to used it too, but after my year subscription ran out I stopped to save money on fees and shopper tip (which still adds up/is kind of pricey in my mind even with the subscription). I've used his account a couple of times when it was my week and I was too busy to shop in person, but 90% of the time I will drag my butt to the store to do it the old fashioned way.The issue I'm running into is that on my week I will put in the effort to shop in person, saving both of us money but costing me time and effort. But on Roomie's week he still orders groceries that someone else shops and delivers to our door, and bills me for half the fees & tip in addition to the groceries themselves. This wasn't a problem when we were both using Instacart, but now it feels a little unfair to me.Granted, he does pay his subscription alone, but the division of labor/costs still feels unfair considering I don't bill him for my time shopping in person. It's a little annoying that he gets the benefit of never needing to shop in person while still saving money from my extra effort to do so.I haven't mentioned any of this to him because I'm afraid I'll sound petty/cheap if I say I no longer want to contribute to his delivery fees. At the end of the day it's like $20 max I'd be saving every other week so it's not the end of the world to continue doing it. Really it's just the principle of the thing, but I'll keep quiet if y'all think it would be petty/assholey of me. WIBTA?

title: AITA For Not Helping "Friend" Learn her job?
body: 5 years ago, I found a nice job at a family owned company, and I became close with my co-worker (Val) and my boss (Sue). After about a year, I ended up leaving due to a move across the country.  However, I remained in contact and on good terms with both Val and Sue.About 2 1/2 years ago, I came back to visit and met up with them twice. On both occasions, I was told about the issues they had filling not only my position, but also Sue's position, since she had been promoted. They both told me I should come back and take over Sue's position. Due to illness in my family, I was open to the idea. Sue acted as a facilitator between myself and who would be my boss (who I also knew well from my time at the company). We negotiated several things, but the most important were salary and relocation assistance.When I received the contract to sign, it had no relocation assistance, $12k less than agreed upon, and a lower position than originally discussed. I pulled out, but I still moved back since my fiance had a found job in the area in preparation.Previously, when I worked with Val and Sue, I was an end user on an easy to use software. In my current position, I work on the IT side with a different, fully configurable system that you can customize to your needs. However, it's flexibility tends to make it a little complex and finicky, which leads many companies to hire entire teams to configure and maintain it's multiple modules.Since the negotiations fell through 2 1/2 years ago, things have been a little weird with Val and Sue. We barely talk, but the biggest issue had been that I invited both to various events including my wedding. For each event, Val would switch her RSVP to no at the last-minute. Sue on the other hand would RSVP yes, then just never show up. After my wedding, I just decided to cut my losses and move on.That was until their company decided to move to the same software that I use. Suddenly, Val started texting every week about how she wants to see me and is scared of the software. Now they have implemented it, and she has NO IDEA how to use it. In fact, she hasn't been able to do her job at all since they switched, Sue has had to do it all.Val asked me to sit down with her this weekend and go over how to use the software so that she can better do her job. I initially said yes, but now I'm thinking of canceling. My husband insists they are using me. Training on this software is not cheap for end users, like $4000 per person for 1 week of training on the basics of Val's specific role. I also am not really looking forward to giving up part of my weekend for someone who did not really feel I was important before.WIBTA if I cancelled on Val?

title: AITA for calling out an obvious lie?
body: I apologize if my post if too much for such a small issue. My family has a history of being people pleasers. They don’t like to rock the boat, will say fake nice things so others will enjoy being around them. For a long time, I was the same. I mean, everyone ants to be wanted, right? A few years ago, I was so unhappy because I let anyone walk all over me. I tried so hard to meet their needs that I let mine be non-existent. Since then I’ve done a lot of soul searching. Life is short. I no longer keep quiet when I feel like things are wrong. I speak up. On that note, onto the story. My SIL (I’ll call her Julie) has had a history of making up extravagant lies. When she first started seeing my brother, she emailed my mom about some VERY detailed abuse she’d had growing up. My mom was super worried and wanted to make sure she was ok. In the email, Julie has said that her therapist had told her to email a trusted friend about it. Julie included the therapists name. After a few emails back and forth, Julie’s story would change. She escalated the situation enough to where my mom felt she needed to reach out to the therapist. Turns out there was no therapist. Confused, my mom asked Julie what was going on. Through a lot of prodding, she discovered Julie made the ENTIRE thing up. She had a happy childhood. Loving family. My mom was hurt. After a while, she let it go. Since then, Julie was had a slew of illnesses. Her kidney was failing, she had to take chemo for some sort of disease she has, had to be on a constant IV drip for another thing. Just…extreme things. Knowing what had happened with my mom, I took everything she said with a grain of salt. I had no proof any of it was fake and was not about to call her out only to have her really be sick. And I’m an insensitive asshole. Now the part where I might be an asshole. Shes moved away now but I am friend with her on social media. She always makes posts about how good her kids are at sports, throwing 90mph pitches when one is 7 years old, etc. she then made a end-of-school post about how her oldest grew 9 inches in 9 months. Which is A LOT. She even made a comment on it saying she had her husband measure TWICE! Cut to three months later when she made another beginning-of-school post. This one saying his height was 7 inches shorter than the end of school. So I spoke up. I said “he shrunk 7inches?” To which she replied “yeah, my husband mismeasured. He only grew 6 inches last year.” I then said “those measurements still don’t add up.” She didn’t reply. I was proud I said something. I think she should have been called out. Even though I feel like it was a tiny thing. The next time I saw my mom she looked at me disappointed and said “that wasn’t very full of grace.” Honestly that hurt me a lot. So..was I an asshole?

title: AITA: I (36F) pushed my husband (42M) to change jobs because of a persistent (32F) colleague.
body: My husband began working with a woman about two years ago. She consistently called him for his help on a daily basis. I found it was a little unusual and I then saw (we share devices/accounts) that he and his colleague were messaging each other 10-15 times a day. Nothing sexually inappropriate but like two best friends. He was constantly coaching her in her job and her life, giving her advice, checking to see if the workload was overwhelming. I confronted him and he said he agreed it was inappropriate and that he would nip it in the bud and not to worry, he’d never blow up our marriage. So he started delayed responding or not at all. This actually made her message even more. To the point that she would claim at least 2-3 times a week that she didn’t know what time she started her shift and needed him to tell her. He would answer every time. (Their schedule is posted at the workstation.) He started silencing her messages because it was every weekend, every shift she worked without him — daily! He even silenced her on our vacations so we wouldn’t be interrupted because he didn’t want to fight and didn’t trust she wouldn’t reach out. One day he flat out told her (after nearly a year of this) that she messages him a little too often and his wife finds it odd. She claimed she had no idea and apologized. Ok, I gave her the benefit of the doubt. After this, she slowed down but still found a way to need his help every week. She started messaging him only when she knew he was at work. In an effort to minimize fighting, he was deleting messages and lying to me about her contacting him. I went on a business trip and the day I was away, she messaged him on his day off needing help. He called her via What’s App so it wouldn’t appear on our statement and stayed on the phone almost an hour helping her do something he and everyone he knows did independently. I checked his phone when I got home. He had deleted it from his What’s App but not his call log. I flew off the handle. He claims he only hides stuff from me to preserve the relationship. The lying has broken the foundation of our trust because I constantly caught him and now I don’t know how to move on. We have a family and have been together for nearly two decades. We never had a lack of trust before this and I honestly thought we had the perfect life. Now I feel like everything is changed. Them working together causes me constant stress. I feel like I can’t trust him and I know this woman will do anything to get into his life. I feel like the only solution is for him to switch branch (easy to do) to get her out of our daily scenario. He loves his job so much. He has agreed to move and says he feels bad to leave but once he gets used to the new place, all will get back to normal. I feel bad. I don’t want him to hate it there and resent me. If he stays, I fear I can’t trust him and my resentment will grow. I don’t know…AITA, him? Both of us?

title: AITA for not giving my FSIL a plus one to the wedding?
body: Changing actual names.My fiance, John, (26M) and I (25F) are getting married in September. We intended on having a small wedding with just close friends and family, however my family is very large. In total our guest count will be just under 60 people.During John’s family’s dinner we were discussing the guest list, when Martha (FMIL) brought up Jane (FSIL&MOH) and her plus one. I pulled John aside to discuss how I am uncomfortable with an open plus one for the following reasons:-Jane is not currently interested in anyone. If she did start dating someone we would have no problem inviting them, it’s just the idea of bringing someone we haven’t met just to bring someone-I am socially anxious and being around strangers in general is hard for me let alone showing PDA in front of them.-Jane will be busy all day and sitting with us at the reception. I don’t want a stranger sitting at the head table with us and our families and being in every picture, and I don’t see a point in having someone there just for them to be alone the whole time-We are trying to keep the wedding as small as possible and there won’t be a whole dance or anything she’d need a partner for-No one else is getting an open plus oneJohn agreed with me and we decided to talk to her one on one later. However, when FFIL (Henry)  brought up her plus one again I was visibly anxious, he saw something was up and kept pushing me to say something. I told him I’m not comfortable with an open plus one. He then argued with me about it in front of Jane. Jane left, obviously hurt. We talked with her later and she understood, but my in laws were still furious.Henry said I should give her a plus one because what if she meets someone she wants them to meet? Martha said I was being selfish and asked why I brought up the guest list in front of Jane if I didn’t want her to have a plus one. I tried explaining that I was not expecting that at all, and it was pried out of me. Henry said I was being too sensitive.I tried to clarify that I’m only uncomfortable with an open plus one, and if there’s someone she meets we would be happy to invite them. They were still angry when the conversation ended.Martha now wants to meet me for lunch, and idk if I can handle my own and defend my position again. I’m not sure it’s even worth the tension if it will just make me uncomfortable for one day, even if it should be just about John and me.So, AITA for not giving Jane an open plus one?

title: AITA for saying "there should be something that's compliment worthy"
body: Hello,My housemate(30M) and I(25F) went out together for grocery shopping yesterday. In the car ride back, he was telling me how a girl from his office was telling him, that his shirt looked nice and his friends around were teasing him. He continued to tell me, how this girl had a boyfriend and everybody knew, but they were still teasing him. I didnt know how to respond to that, so I said "oh yes, I like to compliment people too" and he said "but you never compliment me". I replied with "there should be something that is compliment worthy". He got offended and said I was rude. I told him, that I compliment when I find something, that stands out(something out of ordinary, like a unique color or accessory). He said, but it is still rude. I tried to explain it was only regarding his dressing sense, but we came back home, and he rushed to his room.Today, I met him in the living room and saw he was upset and asked him, "what happened",  And he said "nothing, im not talking because I'm not worthy to talk to you". I didnt understand, and asked "what, why do u think so" and remembered he was implying to yesterday's conversation. I just told him, i never said unworthy to talk, but just remarked about compliments. He said "you act well", and before I said anything, just asked me to not say anything further. I said okay, and came back to my room.I saw he also unfollowed me on Instagram.I can't see his perspective, on why he thinks he should get compliments if I dont find his dressing sense compliment worthy. I might've been too blunt, but I didnt know how to respond to, "you never give me compliments".Note: I did compliment him a few times on his cooking skills, his guitar skills and his voice(he sings), but never on his clothes.Please tell me, AITA, or is he overreacting.Note: He also said "you can say anything to me, I never get hurt, exactly 15 mins before I made that comment"

title: AITA for wanting to get a protective order against my MIL
body: My MIL has been verbally and emotionally abusive towards me since our wedding day, and the behavior has significantly worsened over the years. This pattern intensified when she was required to find her own living arrangement after our engagement.Every three months, my MIL quits her job for a new one, claiming sexual harassment or mistreatment. However, we've heard from previous employers about instances of stolen money, unexplained job abandonment, and poor performance. These inconsistencies raise concerns about her credibility. Recently, she requested to stay with us while visiting a doctor for a possible brain cancer diagnosis.A few days turned into agonizing weeks, during which my MIL hurled constant belittling remarks and threats at me whenever my husband was out. She even went as far as sending malicious messages to her friends and social workers, falsely accusing me of abusing her, my daughter, and even my husband. I eventually discovered that the brain cancer diagnosis was a complete fabrication, a cruel manipulation to garner sympathy and control. Moreover, I learned that she had been skillfully manipulating my husband through guilt trips and fabricated scenarios, further straining our marriage.After weeks of heated arguments about her inappropriate behavior, we had to ask my MIL to leave. Despite this, she has continued to harass us. She falsely told my employer's wife about an affair with my boss, even though we only work professionally together. She also contacted several family members, spreading lies about my alleged alcoholic abuse, which are completely untrue. We've documented these attempts and blocked her from contacting us directly, but she keeps finding ways to reach out. My husband feels immense guilt over her persistent demands for money and her manipulative tactics that make him feel inadequate. While I offer him my unwavering support, we're considering seeking professional guidance to deal with this ongoing harassment and protect ourselves emotionally.This entire ordeal has caused me immense emotional distress and strained my relationships. AITA for wanting to get a protective order against my MIL?

title: AITA for ignoring my brother's advice?
body: I am 17, m. My brother recently came home from the marines, He asked me what my hobbies were, and a said DnD, SCP cosmology, and something I was excited about, getting to level 400 in runescape.He asked if I had a girlfriend, I said no, but I wanted one. He asked if I really wanted one, I said yes, and he spent the next day "straightening me up".He got me new clothes, cologne, took me to the gym and made me almost pass out, and gave me a diet.He told me to stick to what he said and fix my monotone voice. I decided getting a girlfriend wasnt worth it if I couldn't be happy, so I went to a new dnd group as myself. I met a girl there, and now we're a thing.My brother saw me out in public and got onto me, visibly frustrated. I told him I had a girlfriend now, and not with his advice, and he said that didn't matter. AITA?

title: AITA for expecting partner to help me after a stroke?
body: This week I (28F) had a stroke. I called my partner (31M) to take me to the ER. It was 12am and we were there until early morning. I knew he had a ton of work he was behind on and told him repeatedly that he can go home. He insisted on staying.Over the next few days he was really great, visited daily, brought me a blanket, flowers, clothes, food, checked on my cat a couple times (at my request). I thanked him every time, told him the blanket made my visit better, that I loved the flowers and every nurse was commenting on them, etc. When he visited he’d stay about 30 mins before I told him to go home to do his work.I finally got out and called him to pick me up. I asked to stay at his place for a bit since Im not supposed to be driving and wanted observation. He was ok with it. We had a tiff that evening when I said I had a headache & he told me that’s not possible since I don’t have nerves in my brain & that my stroke was so small I’m probably imagining it. I explained it is possible and very common, and asked him to not minimize my experience. He started to raise his voice in defense and I calmly said that I will not deal with being yelled at right after a stroke. He apologized & said he was trying to make me feel better & then left.When he got home he was visibly annoyed. I told him I wasn’t mad and asked what’s wrong, he broke down and said he was stressed about his work. I told him it was ok to take a break to eat and take a nap, to tell his work that I had a stroke & it would be ok, that there was no need to stress so badly. I said I’d have my mom fly out and stay with me to give him space so he can work.He woke me up in the morning with all kinds of food (not sure if I thanked him since I was so out of it but I was clearly happy and praised his choices) then tried to stay out of his way and do some puzzles (to help my brain) while he worked. Later, I asked him to take me to pick up my meds. Again, he was annoyed and asked why I picked a CVS that was 6 mins away instead of a closer one, and if it would be a regular thing. I assured him it was a one time pickup and thanked him for taking me. Once home he was still visibly annoyed so again, I asked what’s wrong. To which he said that he feels like I’ve been unappreciative towards him, that he’s gone out of his way a lot, and that I didn’t comfort him appropriately last night.I told him I do appreciate him but also I just had a stroke & I don’t have the mental capacity to deal with him sulking around & having to manage his emotions. I need to be focused on my cognitive therapy to make sure I have the best recovery possible. I told him I’d be getting an Uber home and I hope he got his work done. He said he didn’t want me to be alone & I said I’d rather be alone than deal with drama.So now I’m home alone, & my mom is buying a last minute ticket to come stay with me. He’s called me several times acting like nothing happened but I’m peeved. AITA?

title: AITA for not wanting my best friend hang around their other best friend?
body: I've been friends with my best friend for about 7 years give or take, and she has been close with this friend for about one or two years less than that. For context, my best friend is asian, and I am half asian-half black, and their friend is a white Mexican. I've always been mildly uncomfortable around this friend, but I've always made the effort to be their friend and nice even when they've been otherwise rude to me. In the past this friend as always made very toeing the line of racist energy jokes, but nothing too crazy or insane. Just a passing quip of "It's because your asian" Or bringing up the fact that one of us in the group is asian in banter. Which had always been uncomfortable but we assumed was her trying to do shock value comedy. Recently however, this friend and I and my best friend got in a car together and she actually started getting really racist. Saying "I hate Chinese people," "shutup darkie," "shutup you're literally fillipino," "stop squinting your eyes" etcetera. At the moment I was too shocked to say anything, so I laughed it off uncomfortably and made a few quips back, poking at her for making racist jokes. My friend in the front seat remaining quiet through out it. The immediate day after I get in the car with the same group of people, this time including my black friend, and she whips around and goes and I quote "who let this Blackie in the car" and when I comment how dangerously close she's getting to saying the n word, she tells me to "shut the f up darkie" and again my asian best friend says not a word. A day or two after that my best friend makes a joke about how racist her friend is, and it really makes me feel like she isn't as bothered about these comments as I am. Most of the comments were made towards me, but some were towards herself as well. I'm thinking about telling her straight up I don't want to be around her friend anymore, but I don't know how she's going to react. In the past she's told me she isn't as close to this other friend and us closer to me, but lately she's done nothing but prioritize and hang out with this friend, and didn't even stick up for me in her own car? In the past people in our group had said way less offensive borderline racist things and she immediately clapped back at them and unforgiving cut them off, but with her other best friend suddenly it's okay?

title: AITA for not paying our electric bill and let it get cut?
body: Me and my husband are living with my parents ancestral house (mom side). My mom is a retired have monthly pention, my dad in real estate and is still earning. Living with us is my uncle (with job) and my aunt who is mentally ill and does not have any income at all. My older sister’s family (family of 6) is with us as well.I have a high paying job. Since my hubby and I are earning more than what we need, everyone in the household expect us to cover every thing at home. My uncle would often said that we should be taking care of them since we are living in their house rent free. I am obligue to give, but not my sister.I a paying our  utility bills and groceries. When my sis asked to live with us, she told us they will be sharing with the utilities and will be cooking separately (using my gas stove). But none of this happen. They never shared anything and their children often asked for food from us since their parents dont leave them money for food.  No one is contributing. They are reluctant to share since they knew i am earning several folds their salary.Every day my sis and my uncle have daily deliveries. This bothers me, they said they do not have money to share in the household expences and yet, their online purchases are coming nonstop. i even sometimes paid for these purchases as the package came “unexpectedly early” and they do not have the money to pay for it yet. they never pay me back. My sister and his partner purchase their own vehicle each with monthly ammortization, but never paid me the money they owe me.This has been happening since my mom found out how much money i am earning few years back.Last Oct, I told my mom that we will be spliting the bills starting Jun 2023, I’ll pay 70% of the utilities and will be limitting the groceries too since most of the food we bought were consumed without us knowing it (e.g. foods mysteriously disappeare). I think 70% was fair since the remaining 30% will be divided to 3 families. Came June bill, I asked my mom for their share, she told me to pay for it first and and they will pay me later. The same scenario continue and they never pay me.So when Sept bill came, i stand firm not to pay for it. Hence, when the Oct bill came, we received a disconnection notice. My mom asked if I paid our Sep bill and i told her no, cause I am still waiting for their share. The following day, my sister came and gave half of the Sept bill. So I paid for Sept but not for Oct. Fast forward to Dec and they saw that I haven’t paid our 3 mos. bill (Oct - Dec), i told them that I am only waiting for their share and I will pay the bill.We lost power one afternoon and I already knew what it means. I stayed in our room and never said anything. I messege my husband to ask his brother if we can stay in his place for a couple of days.We moved out and now I feel guilty cause I know they are staying in hot and dark house. IATA for letting our electricity get cut and wont pay even if i could?

title: AITA for not wanting to get married in a church?
body: My (25y) fiance (26y) and I are in the midst of our wedding preparation. Everything is going well, except one thing that has come up time and time again. His parents are very religious (catholic) and are pushing for us to get married in a church. I am however, not catholic and don't consider myself to be religious at all. His parents are threatening on not coming to the wedding if we don't do the ceremony in a church. Sadly, I feel that they may follow through with their words.I have suggested we can do a small church ceremony after the actual wedding day, just for the church to recognise our marriage, but this has not gone down well with this parents. I love my partner very much but I feel like this is something I am not willing to budge on. I have never wanted to get married in a church, it is not my religion, and I don't agree with doing something just to please the in-laws. AITA for refusing to get married in a church?

title: WIBTA if my mom walks me down the aisle instead of my biological father?
body: I (20F) am getting married this spring. My father (51M) will likely not be walking me down the aisle. We've had a strained relationship for a good portion of my life, despite him financially providing for me. My parents divorced when I was 15.Onto my dad. He works a difficult job as an executive at a tech company, and brings in at least half a million a year with bonuses. My mother works as an instructor at a local polytech, and we're well-off because of their hard work. He's been very emotionally withdrawn as long as I can remember, and has never told me he loves me or shown any affection. He's never been to a single school event, never driven me to school, never spent time with me, never showed any interest in me/achievements... and so on. Just a guy who lived in my house.My mother is, simply put, a superhero to me. She worked hard my entire life to provide me with a normal childhood and showed up to everything. She even broke her no-contact with my grandpa encourage him to attend my father-daughter events at school so I wouldn't feel out of place. She worked a 9-5, but still made me homecooked breakfast, lunches, and dinner. She tucked me in every night, called out of work to come to therapy with me, always noticed when something was wrong and magically made it better.A year the divorce, he started paying more attention to me. This coincided with him seeing a new woman (who is married with kids, and was a source of scandal in the family). This was shortly after I left an abusive relationship, where I was d. He stepped up on providing me with comfort and caring more than he ever did previously (I've had very poor mental health since I began grade school, and he never noticed, despite me having scars and being in hospitals often). He began taking a bigger parental role in my life, despite me living with my mom full time. However, his attempts were always half-hearted and I usually left feeling sour.This spring, I'm getting married to my highschool sweetheart, 20M. He's everything I've ever wanted, and knows about my relationship with my father. When I was worrying about whether I wanted him to be in the wedding party or not, he made the suggestion that my mother walk me down the aisle. I loved this idea, since she practically raised me on her own, and she was the one who also took my fiancé under her wing when we were younger.Yesterday, I had lunch with my father to invite him to the wedding, and he was surprised to hear I was getting married (even though fiancé and I have been engaged for a year, he was invited to the party but didn't attend as he was in Japan on a trip). I bit my tongue about it and let it slide, until he asked when he should arrive to walk me down the aisle. I broke the news to him that he wouldn't be the one doing it, and he got up silently and left. He has since not answered any calls or texts, even from my mom. I'm still planning on having her walk me down the aisle. WIBTA if he was only a guest?UPDATE: There is a character limit here, so the update is on AITAH.

title: AITA for telling my friend that his girlfriend has been harassing me
body: I (F28) has a friend (M28) I will call him Mack, we are both from England and met in primary school but in high school I had to move to Scotland because of this, I only get to see him once every 2 or 3 years.This week, I have been visiting all of my friends in England, including Mack. I visited his flat that he shares with his girlfriend Amy. The problems started when I was helping his girlfriend cook dinner. I tried to make some small talk, but she wasn't really interested. I assumed she was just an introvert and left it at that. Whilst we were eating dinner me and mack were are talking about how shadow and bone were cancelled, I asked his girlfriend if she had ever seen it. She said that it seemed like a dumb show. This shocked me a little, and I think my friend was shocked to I change the subject, but every time I tried to include Amy, she would always give one word answers or be rude. The same happened when Mack tried to include her, too.Eventually, I left and went back to my hotel. The next day, I woke up to a Facebook text from Amy saying that I was a bich and was trying to steal her man. I was very confused and asked her if I said something to imply that. She responded by saying that the way I was acting was very flirty to her boyfriend, and I was being dismissive of her. I reminded her of what she said during the dinner and how she was dismissive to me and Mack, but she just started insulting me.I blocked her, but later on in the day, one of her friends was messaging me saying the same thing. I was really confused about why she was going through the trouble of doing all of this. I ended up taking screenshots of everything and sending it to my friend. He apologised and said that he would talk to her.Later on, I got a message saying that I was a jerk and that they were now in a massive fight over it. I looked at the profile, and it was another one of her friends. I blocked her and then set my account to private. After thinking about it for a while, I brought it up to one of my other friends (Cara), and she said I should have just ignored them from the start instead of telling Mack about it.I feel bad because I know Mac really likes this girl, and I don't want to be the reason that they argue. But at the same time, I don't want to be harassed when I feel like I did nothing wrong. But also, maybe I did, and I just don't realize it.Update 1:So I spoke to Cara again to see what was happening with Mack and Amy, and she told me something surprising. I didn't mention this before, but Cara is also friends with Mack and some other people who I know. It turns out last month they were all hanging out a bar, and I happened to come up in conversation. Mack was apparently really drunk and said that I was his first crush back in primary school for over a year. This made his girlfriend upset because I was going to fit it soon. It turned into a big argument in front of everyone and him promising that we were just friends.I was really surpriand felt a bit bad for Amy so I called up Mack to see if it was true. He was really mad that someone told me so I think that it was true. He kept on asking, who told me and refused to answer any of my questions. I told him I wasn't going to tell him who told me what happened because I didn't want him to blame them. We got into an argument about it, so I just handed up on him.I don't know what to do now. Part of me wants to apologize to Amy, but at the same time, I feel like I don't have anything to apologise for. I really don't know what to do, so if any of you have any advice, please put a comment.

title: AITA for saying I would never do anything with my best friend?
body: So I 20f have been friends with James 20m for almost 4 years now. We have always gotten along very well, but neither of us have been romantically involved with each other, always refused to kiss each other while playing truth or dare etc, we have a strictly platonic relationship.He has had a few girlfriends over the years, I have gotten along fairly well with all of them and one is even still one of my closest friends despite them breaking up. A few of these have been uncomfortable with me and James but after hanging out a couple of times all has been well.He got a new girlfriend about 1 month ago, I have never met her before, neither have anyone else in our friend group. We had planned to go out yesterday and have the pregame at my apartment. They all came and we had a pretty good time, getting drunk, making jokes and trying to get to know Amy (his girlfriend). She seemed very nice and we talked for a few minutes. Then from nowhere she said that I should watch it and that she knows all about my type. I was kind off taken aback and asked what she was referring to. She told me she knew I wanted James but that she would not let that happen. I laughed and said that I would never touch him or think about him in that kind off way, not in a million years. I said it kind off jokingly but she took offense. She asked if I really thought I was so much prettier than her, that I think she had low standards because she is dating him etc. I said that I did not think anything bad about her, but James is just not my type and therefore I would not go after him. She scoffed and said “sure”.They left after this and James texted me this morning telling me that if I was going to be disrespectful to his girlfriend, he would have to cut me off and that he thought better off me. I am now stating to think I was an asshole for saying what I said.
