I don’t know really what I am looking to get out of this other than some input if I am right for wanting a second job.EDIT: I don’t have a second job I just suggested it wouldn’t be bad.Sorry Second EDIT: I would only work the second job temporarily until the new baby is born and then resignEDIT (#3): We live 30 minutes from our jobs (63/m) so I want something reliable for her to drive (over/under on her current vehicle) any advice?

title: AITA for not wanting to solve my brother's lawsuit?
body: I (30 F) have two twin brothers (38 M) who have always been problematic. And by that I mean stealing, lying and illegal shit... In the other hand, I have been the "good daughter" who has studied aboard and a role model bla bla... My brothers have always though that this is because I'm my dad's favorite. But to be honest, growing up they made so much trouble for the three of us that I never wanted to be an issue for my parents.My mom had breast cancer and they NEVER not even ONCE went with her to quemo or doctors appointments. Six months later, my dad got discoverd lunge cancer and again, they weren't involved in the process. Just worried about who has going to be in charge. Thanks God and the good medicine they were both ok and in remision.Back to the story...We have a family business we were all involved (parents, brothers and SIL) until the moment my brother started a fight 2 Xmas ago for a mistake he thought I MADE but the truth was my dad DID (he is the boss tho). The fight escalated quickly and the next day was xmas eve, they didn't attened dinner and my brother just showed up throwing a big bag of presents and left. This was so unrespectful for my dad (btw he was still on quemo). The next monday my dad spoke to him about what he did and the talk got heated. He and his wife left the business deeply angry.I'm administrative manager so at night I texted them asking them to please come by the next day to make everything legally right if they were resigning. We were willing to pay them what they deserve even though it wasn't needed according to law (MEX) because it was a job abandonment. They argue they didn't trust us so I suggested to see en court so everybody was safe and after threaten me a few times he agreed. Things didn't go well so they both put a lawsuit against the business that hasn't come to a solution (again MEX). We haven't talked in little more than 2 years, until my mom sent my nephew a present and started texting with my brother.He now demands certain amount of money to put all behind, but my mom is pushing me to talk to a new lawyer and solve things once and for all. Why am I the one who has to solve this if I didn't make it? Always cleaning up after them... I want to refuse but she is my mom and always want to help her. But still, why they don't do something to clean their own shit up?

title: AITA for not letting my housemate take the best room
body: Hiya! I F20 live with 2 girls and a guy currently and me and one of the girls F21 have just found student accommodation for next year with afew of my friends as the others are graduating this year. We have found a nice house with all rooms a similar size apart from one of them which is a little bigger and has some nicer features (big windows, built in storage shelves, etc). The other day she mentioned to me offhand how she should get to pick her room first since she found the house we're moving into and had to go to the veiwing by herself. I wasn't convinced and just said something like 'haha I don't think thats a thing to be honest'. I've since heard her LOUDLY ranting to one of our housemates about how she 'deserves' the room, even though all 4 of us living together next year found and went to a bunch of viewings by ourselves as viewings were in a busy season at our school so our schedules didn't overlap. Do we all did this, and me and one of the other girls found houses that all of us but her would be happy to live in, and she just came up with bad excuses for all of them for why she didn't want to live there, and should wait till the house she was gonna be viewing (pls also consider that the student housing market in our city is famously terrifying and if you can get a house you should confirm it ASAP). We met up as a house and another one of my housemates suggested we draw from a hat to make it fare since we'll all be paying equal bills, or pull the order that we get to pick from a hat etc etc. and she kicked up a fuss saying that she 'deserves this room' and that apparently we're all selfish and should be grateful that she found and viewed the house. I told her to either calm down or leave, and my male housemate and her have been very unhappy with me. AITA?

title: AITA for overspending and buying sale items for a white elephant Christmas gift exchange?
body: In December I was invited by my friend to her annual white elephant gift exchange party. It was lovely, I had a wonderful time. There were at least 30 people there as she a mix of childhood, college, work, and city friends like me that she's met since moving to nyc. I knew at least 2/3 of the guests and got along well with all of them. There was a $50 spending limit. I spent $51.23 but with our sales tax being almost 10% I went about $5 over the limit. I bought 3 unisex items, 2 of which were on super sale (30-50% off). Without the sale the total would have been around $80. I bought everything at target, it's not like any of the items were extravagant by any means although I got a lot of feedback that my gifts were creative and fun. Some people spent less than $50. For instance someone brought a lush bath set that I saw in store for $30. No issue with that at all just adding for context. I'd say most people spent right around $50.My gift was extremely popular. It was one of the first wrapped packages picked and before we made it through half the picks my gift had already been stolen the max amount of times and removed from rotation. I was super happy the final giftee was excited with the gift. Multiple people asked where I got the gifts and I told them on super sale at target. After the party I left for the holiday then a long vacation with my husband. I returned recently and heard through the grapevine a couple people were annoyed with my gift. Apparently they feel the $50 cap applies to the value of the gift not the sticker price and feel that i intentionally tried to upstage them. Hand to God I didn't, I thought if I spent $50 I was within the rules. For what its worth the 2 ladies annoyed with me are people I did not know prior to that night, and after apologizing to the hostess she reassured me i did nothing wrong and she loved what i brought. No one I know was upset with my gift either. But now I am questioning myself if I was an asshole for buying gifts that were worth more than $50? I'm not a showboat person by any means and feel bad that my gifts may have made others feel bad about their gifts.

title: AITA for going on holiday with only my dad and not my mum/sister because I can't afford it
body: I (18m) am saving up for a holiday to italy in July. The original plan was to take my sister (13) but since she's too young my parents didn't want me to go alone with her in case something happened to one of us. Fair enough. So I asked my dad to come with me instead, it's not a case of choosing my dad over my mum, me and my mum work in the same place and we wouldn't be able to get the same week off. I also can't afford to take 4 of us. My parents are really struggling financially atm so they can't really put anything toward it.It's also not really possible because there is only one week in the year that all 4 of us are off and it's a week in August. That week is totally booked everywhere. So even if I could afford to take my mum and sister too (my sister would cause us a fine for taking her out during school time on top of that) we can't even get the same week off anyway. So essentially I'm now being guilt tripped for not either, changing my destination to somewhere I don't really want to go/can't afford and going August, or not waiting until next August.I don't think it's fair that I'm being expected to only go away when we all can. I totally understand that it's disappointing for whoever doesn't get to go, but that isn't something that I can do anything about. Am I being unreasonable?

title: AITA for not wanting my friends bf at my birthday?
body: My friend came out to us and started dating a guy april last year, the guy started hitting on him while dating another guy and broke up with this guy for my friend, getting with him a week later which our friend group found very weird, he also does a lot of abusive things imo (spam texts and calls my friend, forbids him of doing things, acts like his dad yelling at him for dumb things like forgetting his keys and hold over his head the fact that hes the one paying for things instead of my friend, even though he offers to pay for everything) and i just find his pushy behavior overwhelming, but whatever since im not the one dating him. We stopped hanging out as often but whenever we do, he always brings him around, he used to ask if he could but now just does it which is very annoying, i also get annoyed that he just invites himself to our things but has never invited us to anything (including birthdays) so that adds to it but me and our other friends dont say anything because we dont want any drama, i know its kinda wrong for me not to say it makes me uncomfortable, but i know he would just get mad and last time i did say i didnt like a friends boyfriend who was also abusive she just ended the friendship, i dont have a large friend group so would just rather avoid the confrontation. Fast forward to now and my birthday is in a month, im planning it and very excited since i haven’t had a party since i was 12 (im turning 24), im only inviting a few friends that i actually keep contact with and also letting my sister invite a few friends so she can hang out. AITA if i dont want him to come, and if when its time to send invitations and he asks to come i say no?

title: AITA for not watering my aunt's plants?
body: My (48F)aunt lives down the street from me and she needed to go out of state for the weekend to a funeral. She will be gone for four days and wanted me to water her plants everyday. I (30F) didn't really want to, but I was I just agreed since I know how much those plants means to her. She gave me $25 as a thank you.The first day it was my fault. I had forgotten about it, but it rained the next day till 5pm. After the rain stopped, I went over to see if the soil was wet enough for me to not need to water it. I looked at the forecast and saw that it was going to rain at night till the next day. So I decided not to watered it. 3rd day comes along and it rained all day. The fourth day, my aunt called me angrily and asked, why haven't I been watering her plants? She saw me through the cameras and saw that I didn't even come the first day and the second day, I just walked around her garden doing nothing. I apologized and explained to her about the rain, and said there's no point on watering if it's raining all day and night. Isn't that too much water? She proceeded to keep yelling, and said I was lazy and making excuses. The rain isn't enough water and I better give her back her $25 when she comes back.My parents told me I was wrong and should have just watered it.

title: AITA for speaking my opinion?
body: I had spent nine months arranging a month-long trip to Italy for three friends from University. I was the travel agent tour guide Planner accountant and everything in between. Because I had visited Italy many times and even lived there, I was happy to play all of the roles mentioned above and was so excited for the experiences of travelling abroad.Literally the day of the trip, my car was stolen from my driveway- passport, euros, luggage, and the car itself. Obviously that threw everything out for me but the three girls went ahead on the trip.For the first week they struggled with everything as they had never been on an overseas trip. They leaned on me for the first week of the trip to help them guide and facilitate things they were struggling with after one week. I had to message them and tell them I wasn’t able to continue doing that because I was dealing with my own grief and logistics around getting everything back.They never contacted me again no explanation. There was a few comms back n forth about how much they sacrificed to be there and how hard they found it. Not once did they ask about me and my situation and the truth was the whole situation affected my mental health negatively.They returned from the trip and still no contact. To this day… I can’t figure out why I’m made to feel the a-hole on this situation.

title: AITA for not going to college
body: I (20m) am currently done with one semester of college but I barely made it through the semester and I wanted to take a semester off because I want to go to college on my own terms. The first semester I was forced into going to college so I had no say when I was going, I could only choose my major. After the semester ended I want to take one semester off because if I have no confidence that I will pass the next semester, so I just wanted some time to think about how or what I’m going to do what I want to do in college. I am currently unemployed and live with my parents but I was told under the conditions that if I go to college or work I can live that their house. So I went to college on their terms and  now I want to take the one semester off to work and then get back into college. My mom and dad went off on me saying that “you’re just wasting your time.” To a certain I understand we’re they are coming from but if I feel that I am going to fail than I don’t want to do it. So AITA for not going to college.

title: WIBTA for demoting my fiancées sisters from bridesmaids to guests greeters?
body: So myself 25f and my fiance 28m have been engaged for 3 years. For context i have always wanted 2 bridesmaids, my sister and my best friend. My fiancée asked me to ask his sisters to be bridesmaids f21 and f33 basically because there his sisters and he wants them involved in the wedding, which I understand. So last year I asked his sisters to be bridesmaids and they both said yes, I was hesitant about doing this in the first place but thought it'd he nice to have my future sister in laws as bridesmaids. Fast forward to now, me and my partner had a rocky patch between asking them to be bridesmaids and now, he vented to his sisters about me and its now created an argument because he was talking to his older sisters on facetime and my partner couldn't answer one of the wedding related questions (guest count and who's invited) because he's quite forgetful when it comes to the wedding, so I answered. This seemed to anger his older sister as she thought I was butting in,  little sister then also stated that when they are talking to there brother on facetime then they are talking to just him, not both of us,  this is when were sat next to each other for context. Alongside the fact that she wants us to invite her husbands family to the daytime, at this point we are already at capacity for the amount of guests that we have invited, but my fiancée stated that he would invite some of them to the day if people who are currently invited say no. We were hoping to reduce the guest list a little bit to save some money as jts roughly £110 per person for the day and if we could save some money that would be great as Weddings are super expensive. His sister still seemed to be annoyed about this fact as she states that there his family too now, which I get but my fiancée should be able to choose who he wants to be invited and not feel pressured into inviting people, I think. After all of this I'm feeling deflated and like my future sister in laws don't respect my fiancée and my decisions regarding our own wedding and feel like they don't support us, so WIBTA for asking them to be guest greeters instead of bridesmaids so they can spend time with my fiancée on the morning of the wedding rather than with me when I feel like they don't like me?

title: AITA for volunteering to be a buddy to a transfer student and potentially making her a part of the friend group temporarily
body: Fake names here. My first school term of 2024 starts pretty soon and the school camp is on the 2nd week of term. During the summer break, our year advisor sent us the camp groups and I was in a group with 4 friends in my friend circle, plus a new student named Vivien. It turns out there were 5 students transferring to my school.The year advisor then asked for volunteers to help the transfer students settle into the school. I was excited by this. I thought this would be an opportunity to socialise. Plus, since we had Vivien in my cabin group, I thought being a buddy to her meant a less awkward experience for Vivien as she's not going to be feel as if she's sleeping with complete strangers at camp.I told my friend group on our gc that the camp groups were released.  One of my friends asked who Vivien was and I told her that she was a new student. Our group has 10 people and the maximum number of people in a single cabin is 8. So we split up 5-5. Our cabin group got Vivien so we got 6 people in total and the other group was a group of 7 because two other friends from a different friend group joined.The issue was when I volunteered to be a buddy without telling my friend group. At first, I thought I didn't need to. I thought that since Vivien was going to be in my cabin anyway, it didn't matter if she hung out with us for a bit.However, one of my friends, Angela, got really mad at me for not telling her beforehand that Vivien is hanging out with the friendgroup for at least the first few weeks because I signed up to be a buddy. As everyone in this group has known each other since year 7, it's going to change the group dynamic as this person was not someone anyone knew online or irl. We had two transfer students last year but one of them I knew since 4th grade and the other one went to the same primary school as some of my friends so it was a lot less awkward.The friendgroup is taking sides. Some of my friends took Angela's side, saying that our group is very tight knit and that I should've known that some of our friendgroup don't like socialising with others outside of the circle. Some of my friends are on my side, saying that it's not that big of a deal. They said it was considerate of me to sign up and to give Vivien some familiarity before school camp begins.The fact I just jumped in to volunteer straight away without telling my friends beforehand is the reason why I might be viewed as an asshole. Camp goes on for a week and because I'm a buddy, Vivien might be with us for at least a few weeks after camp. Plus, I knew some of them would be uncomfortable with this decision but I jumped in anyway.AITA for wanting to socialise with a new student without telling my friendgroup beforehand?

title: AITAH for taking my sisters seat at lunch
body: My sisters, my mom and I were on a weekend vacation. I did a lot of research finding a good spot to eat outside coming out of a cold stretch. My sisters said they were perfectly happy reading by the pool all day. I didn’t force anyone to join me but they joined anyways. We had already spent hours at the pool. Everyone heard me talking about sitting outside and having a really good lunch for two days. The day before we ate indoors already and it was fine but the atmosphere was not ideal.So day 3 I finally pick a spot and when we get there my sister gets to the hostess first. The wait was going to be 45 minutes but my sisters wanted to wait since the food looked good. I guess when the hostess asked “inside or outside?” my younger sister said, “doesn’t matter.” My mom (who told me this later) said, “Jenny wants to sit outside.” I guess my sister shrugged it off.One of my sisters is in brace sitting down as we wait. She has broken her bones, multiple breaks, on uncountable occasions. She is a mountain biker/adventure seeker. This is par the course for her.So I am still unaware that we are waiting for an indoor or outdoor table. I go over to a shop next door since this will be my only opportunity to walk around, since my sister can’t walk around with her brace on. I am over there for 15 minutes and out table is already ready. And when I get there, we are sitting inside at a corner table. The only seat left is facing the corner walls. My sisters have sat at the only seats facing windows and the other nice seat is being used for my sisters legs. Granted she could have used a chair but I didn’t go there. She makes a comment about how she hates having her back to people (yeah don’t we all) I put my stuff down, comment how loud it is, and go to the bathroom. When I come out, I asked if I can sit next to them on the booth and I’ll sit in my seat with the food comes out. Well this results in my younger sister getting up and yelling at me, telling me how selfish I am.My older sister  asks, “how does your husband deal with you?” And another comment how high maintenance I am.  I say, “well he would have wanted to sit outside too.”  I defend myself saying I’m not high maintenance.” Then everyone is laughing at me saying how high maintenance I am. Aquote from my sister, “who is in your life that makes you feel like you are not high maintenance?”I was told later that it was selfish to even ask if the wait would have been longer to sit outside. My sister’s comfort was more important even though she was sitting while waiting. They never even asked how much longer also. Could have been five minutes. And our table was ready way before we even thought. But everyone jumped down my throat when I was disappointed. Which lead to my being actually upset for being yelled and laughed at and basically being told I am the problem.I spent a lot of time picking the restaurant but lost my appetite and just a had soup.

title: AITA My mom yelled at me for going to see A band from Russia.
body: Ok so for context I (17M) listen to a lot of metal music. I have recently started to enjoy Music by Slaughter To Prevail. They are coming to the place I live for a concert. I bought a ticket. When she asked who I was seeing I said they were a metal band from Russia and she freaked out saying “ARE YOU KIDDING ME? YOU SHOULDNT BE SUPPORTING RUSSIANS!!” And I said “It’s just music it’s not like the band members are going out and invading places!” She is really mad at me now. For me I just see it as music, and I love the lead singer. She made a point of saying that she “Didn’t want me to be around those types of people.” I just think it’s music and I love the metal community. I don’t know if it’s wrong, or if my mom is gaslighting me. I guess what I’m trying to ask is am I wrong for seeing a Russian band in concert? AITA?TLDR; I’m going to see a Russian metal band in concert and my mom freaked out because of the global affairs that are happening (Because they are Russian.)Sorry for any typos.

title: AITA for taking my younger brother's side?
body: I(M40) have 2 brothers (M39 Jack and M21 Oliver)Jack was always the golden child in our family because I was adopted and Oliver was an accident.I will never understand why they adopted me when they didn't want me or why they didn't abort Oliver since they clearly don't want him.I don't really care that my parents didn't love me anymore but Oliver is very much upset about it and resents Jack because Jack truly enjoys being the golden child and won't miss any chance to brag about it or to show us we are not as loved.Anyway, I have a 15 yo daughter and Jack has a 17 yo son. They go to the same school.Since I can't give my daughter a ride to and from school, Oliver does it for me.A few days ago Jack's son (who takes the bus to and from school) was feeling a bit sick and asked Oliver to give him a ride and Oliver agreed. Apparently in the car, Jack's son decided to give them a lecture about how they shouldn't blame his dad for being the favorite and if Oliver wants to be favored he should try harder and be a better son.That's when my daughter suggested they drop Jack off and let him walk to his home and Oliver happily agreed with her and kicked him out.Now Jack is furious because apparently walking in that cold weather made his sickness worse and he is blaming my daughter and Oliver. I took Oliver's side and told Jack that his son deserved it for being so insufferable. He thinks we are all assholes

title: WIBTA for giving my mom an ultimatum
body: I, 16M, am upset with my mom for some of her negligence and here is why.Recently, we got a rabbit. It was the classic "Hey watch my pet for a while" thing that usually leaves people with animals they didn't intend to have but love anyways. We were those people. Our rabbit is the  best, for this post I will call her Ivy. She is the sweetest little bun in the world.When we were first asked to watch her she lived in my room. She had plenty of space to run during her out time, plenty of cardboard and wood pieces to chew on, and because I am in my room all the time I became her little buddy and main caretaker.My mom has always wanted a rabbit and was super excited to have Ivy in our house, especially when we realized she was basically ours.One day my mom came up with the brilliant idea to move Ivy into our guest room. I was fine with it in theory, but in reality I knew it was going to be miserable. The guest room was basically my moms walk in closet. It is directly across from my parents room and is filled with makeup and clothes all belonging to my mom.My mom is also a huge procrastinator. Everytime she tells us she is going to do something, it never happens, or it happens the day off. She told me that we would move Ivy in before my big birthday party so I could clean up my room. We did it the day of.Now Ivy is in a small room still filled with clothes and makeup. Everytime I go in there she is missing something important, even though my mother constantly is in and out of that room and should have noticed. Ivy barely gets to socialize which is very crucial for rabbits, especially young ones like her.So, I'm planning on giving my mom an ultimatum. I cleared out a space in my room that is both healthy for Ivy and for me. I have feeding, play, and cleaning times marked down and posted on the wall. I have everything set up.I want to tell my mom that if she does not clean up the guest room by a certain date then Ivy will no longer be OUR bunny, she will be mine. I will solely take care of her and my mom cannot get her dream pet.I've discussed this with a few friends and my therapist. My therapist is on board, but some of my friends have made me doubt that this is the right thing to do and have said I'm being an asshole.So reddit, would I be the asshole for giving my mom an ultimatum?Edit: My parents have been neglectful most of my life. They give me bare minimum when it comes to care, that is why a discussion will not work. I have tried having one about my own care in the past and it is met with empty promises. I believe a more direct approach might be more eye opening.

title: AITA for accepting help from someone I briefly dated
body: So this is a long story which I am going to try and keep short. After being in an accident, I was unable to work, trying to complete an honors degree and living with my then abusive boyfriend.I had rekindled things with this ex (but solely as a friend). I always liked this ex as a person, just not as a partner. I thought they were great, we always had great conversations, and I thought he was a stand-up, honest guy.After a few months of talking, I told him about my situation with my ex, and he suggested that I come live with him, but that he understood that I did not want a relationship. He is well off with multiple jobs and a 4 bedroom house with just him and his dogs. I hesitated as I have always found it really hard accepting help from others, but my situation at home was getting out of hand and it was one of those situations where 'I either get out now or I'll be stuck in this cycle for life' so I made a super rash decision, packed up my life in 4 hours and moved in with him.Things were going well. He offered to help me with most of my living expenses, including therapy, groceries, gas, and the odd outing. I tried to decline, but he insisted, giving me his card and telling me how it makes him happy to help me and to just help people in general and he would never expect anything in return (at the time he was helping quite a few people here and there).It's been about 4 months now, and things have changed dramatically.I don't even know who he is anymore, he is accusing me of using him, he told me I can't do washing at the house anymore, he changed all the WiFi passwords and he told me he wants me out by the end of the month (aka 10 day) because he wants me out of his life. He has pretty much cut all his friends out of his life as he says they all use him, he has lost 2 of his 3 jobs and all he does is smoke weed 24/7.Beginning of December he was upset with me because I wasn't a good enough friend, I wasn't making effort in our friendship and since then it just feels like he is looking for anything to fight about. I feel like I haven't actually done anything wrong besides actually accepting his financial help and living with him... I have since just gotten a job again (haven't even received my first paycheck) and he told me I could settle in first (this was end December) and now he is telling me he wants me out. He has been contradicting a lot of the things he has previously said and it just makes me wonder if anything he has ever said is true ? Because about 2 weeks ago during a conversation he said that when he offers to help friends out its just a test to see how much they will take and that he actually plays 'strategy games with all his 'friends'. He has no friends anymore, which he says is because they all just took from him, which I solidly believed up until now.... AITA for accepting his help ?

title: AITA for posting a picture of my roommates back?
body: Hello, this quite literally just happened and I’m brain dead from a sinus infection. I’m in desperate need of outside opinion.I (24f) posted a picture of my roommates (25f) hoodie this morning to my Snapchat story. I don’t have a lot of friends on there aside from her. If I post something on there it usually gets like max 15 views or something. The hoodie in question had a phrase from an anime she used to like a lot, but not anymore. I took the picture of her back while she was wearing it (the part that displayed the phrase) and I captioned it “everyday I wake up”. I didn’t really think much of it other than that I thought it was funny and moved on. Well maybe 10-15 minutes later while I was brushing my teeth she storms into the bathroom and takes a picture of my face mid brush (toothpaste all over, drooling - I just got an oral b toothbrush and I’m sorta messy) and posts it to her story. Mouth still occupied, I’m like “yo what is happening” - garbled but understandable. She then starts screaming about how frustrating I am, and how I didn’t ask her to post it. She’s shaking mad, yelling at the top of her lungs. I finish brushing my teeth and come back into the living room with her. “I just don’t want to be judged in my own house, you always frustrate me so much!” She says. “I didn’t post a picture of your face, no one has even seen it yet” (aside from like, my mom maybe) I say “You didn’t even ask me! You know this is all I have! (Clothing wise)” She bites back, but we both did laundry together two days ago, and her pants are themed with the same anime so it seems like a choice to me. “I’m sorry, I didn’t mean to hurt your feelings. I’ll delete it right now” I say, and delete the picture. It has been up for maybe 20 minutes at this point. “It doesn’t even matter, you should t have done it in the first place! I don’t know why I’m even trying right now “ she says some other stuff along these lines, I can’t remember exactly. She stomps into her room and slams the door. She works from home and I have an on-site job- so I leave for work.First of all, I totally understand where she’s coming from about not wanting a picture of yourself posted. Even if it’s something not clear, it’s your visage. That’s why I immediately deleted it and apologized. The problem comes from her response. She responded with screaming and yelling, taking a full picture of my face in a compromising situation (which is much worse than an anonymous back picture imo) and demeaning me. If I were her, I feel I would’ve just asked her to delete the picture, not resort to theatrics. But I’m not her, and if I truly hurt her that badly I want to make it up to her. She’s my best friend right now. In the past with my other friends, it was normal to post funny pictures of one another on our stories. I’m confused. What gives? AITA?

title: AITA for wanting my boyfriend to go on a road trip with me?
body: AITHA for wanting my boyfriend to come with me on a road trip?For some background, my bf (19M) and I (19F) are from a country where every summer you go to a “summer city” on the weekends to be with friends and party, the big parties that we all go to happen on Saturday night.I work a really busy job right now, I am working even on the weekends, so I asked him a few days back if he could go with me on Saturday at around 12PM because I am fairly new to driving, and going on long road trips specially where you have to go fast scares me and I would just really feel much more secure and confident with him next to me, he said yes.This is where I may be the AH, I asked him yesterday again and he told me no, that why should he have to give up time with his friends on Friday, that all of his friend and him are going on Friday at around 5PM, and that he only said yes at first because he felt pressured. He also told me that his sister always does this road trip every summer and it’s not a big deal, to stop being dramatic. I told him the reasons that I mentioned before but he just repeated what he said, I have not spoken to him since and just told him “Okay” and that I didn’t want to talk about it anymore. Am I being a bitch and not understanding? I feel like a brat right now, but I also feel like that what I’m asking is not something crazy and that’s what boyfriends are for.Edit: I already asked this in another sub-reddit but I would like your opinion as well.

title: AITA for asking my boyfriend to make an Amazon list
body: I (22f) asked my boyfriend (24m) to make an Amazon wishlist and he blew up on me. For context my boyfriend won’t shop online. To the point that it causes huge issues when he tries to give gifts. I don’t ask for or expect much but an example is when I asked for a $14 mushroom Squishmallow and he got me a Minnie Mouse one he found locally. He always finds something so he doesn’t have to buy online and ultimately gets stuff that only slightly relates to what others have asked for even though he could easily afford ordering items.Today he had a bad day at work so I asked him to make a list for an Amazon and send me the link so I can surprise him with a gift. I always buy stuff online for him, especially links he has sent me before. He first fusses he doesn’t have an account, I remind he does and mention I could also send him my list in the future of items $5 and below so we can send eachother little gifts once in awhile. Then he just blows up on me saying that if he doesn’t want to do it he doesn’t have to because that was the way he was raised and I’m being manipulative. He also screamed that I’m not taking his time from him having to search on Amazon for stuff “he already has.”I said that it’s just an Amazon list and I was trying to be nice, no reason for him to loose his shit. Sure I was hoping maybe in the future he’d actually buy stuff I actually asked for off line but in that moment I just wanted to buy him something to make his day better.We are fighting and he says I’m the asshole for “trying to force him to do something he doesn’t have to.” AITA?Edit: I think I need to clarify how bad he is at getting stuff for anyone. I bought him car parts, boots, and clothing that HE specifically picked out for his birthday and Christmas recently. He has never gotten me something I specifically told him I wanted in five years of dating him. It is always something similar or something he says I will like better and i never do. Examples I asked for a blanket, he’ll get me dish towels for the wrong season I ask for sloth socks, he buys be leftovers Christmas socks for my April birthday I asked for a alcoholic item he can buy in person, he tells me he bought them two days before Christmas he tells me it’s sold out because he never actually got it so I got a mixer. No alcohol just the mixer.

title: AITA for not texting my girlfriend my “plans” as I was driving home from work?
body: I was on the way back from work today feeling kinda exhausted from a long day. Usually I shower at night but since I’m sort of tired I decided to shower tomorrow morning. I also usually record music (I make beats) but once again I’m kinda tired so I decided maybe just relax completely for this evening. When I got in my girlfriend said she was going to cook up some vegetables that were about to expire. I said I was not so sure that I want it because I was filled up from a large Chipotle lunch that I had earlier today also a lot of the vegetables were brussel sprouts which I’m not a huge fan of. She asked if I could at least try some and I said okay. She gets overwhelmed from cooking so she asked that I do her laundry for her in exchange for her cooking food for us. I agreed. When I came upstairs she was crying and saying it was not going well. Then she blamed me because I wasn’t appreciative of her cooking for us. I said that I really just wasn’t hungry but I agreed to try some anyway. Then she asked what I was going to do while she cooked and I said I didn’t know and that I would probably take a shower tomorrow and not work on my music tonight because I’m feeling a little burnt out. She said I should of let her know my “plans” ahead of time because if she knew about this she probably wouldn’t have cooked and just relaxed with me. I asked her “so while I was driving back from work and  I had the thought to relax this evening I should have texted her to let her know?” She said “No. You should have told me when you walked in the apartment then we could have gotten doordash or something. Keep in mind the past few times I brought up Doordash this has also stressed her because she gets anxiety about spending money (I’m usually the one who pays for Doordash anyway). I just don’t know what I could have done to prevent this and she always has me feeling like I did something wrong.

title: AITA if I tell my sister to stop using my laptop so often?
body: So my sister, (19 f) asked if she could buy and install lethal company on my gaming laptop and play it. Of course, I said yes, because quite frankly I don’t mind. But it’s gotten to the point where she uses it just about every second of every day. I’m worried about her running down the GPU and essentially burning it out from using it so much. It’s at the point I have to ask for my laptop back if I want to use it. so, AITA if I ask her to not use it so much?

title: AITA for walking away from my mother without saying anything?
body: I (f23) and my mother (f46) have a very unsteady relationship. When it’s good it’s very good and when it’s bad it’s very bad. When we are on good terms we spend almost all of our time together even if we don’t talk about anything or do anything in particular. My mother has come into the habit of speaking over or outright ignoring me recently. Nothing has happened to trigger this, she has always sort have done it but never this much.I will try asking her a question or telling her something and she will speak over me about something that popped in her head or tell me to wait until she’s done watching/reading/doing something and proceed to go minutes without saying anything and never ask me what I was going to say again. If not that, I will say something and not get any sort of signal or reply, wait a few moments and ask her if she heard me and she will say yes and never reply to me or acknowledge what I said.It gets very frustrating because I try to make a point of being attentive and listening to what people have to say and making sure they know I’m listening, because there is nothing that personally frustrates me more than being ignored. We were in her room earlier and I was searching through movies to watch and I started to tell her about my opinion on something related to one of the movies I saw, but she interrupted to laugh at something she saw on her phone and said “sorry one minute” and continued to watch for the next few minutes without acknowledging me. After I realized she wouldn’t reply I just left her room and went into my own.about a half hour later she came looking for me and Asked why I left. I didn’t reply and she asked if it was because she didn’t reply to me earlier. which frustrated me because that means she knew she ignored me. I said it was but it wasn’t as though I was stomping away after being ignored once, and it happens all of the time now. The reason I didn’t tell her that it frustrates me instead of leaving is because she gets angry at anything that sounds like criticism of her. And of course, she got angry and said she never ignores me and she said sorry when she was watching the video, and that I catch an attitude like a brat when I don’t get a reply the moment I want one. And she slammed the door and left. Was I being a brat here? AITA?TLDR; mother ignored me so I walked away from her and now she’s angry at me.

title: AITA for not being enthusiastic about a gift
body: AITA for this not enthusiastic about receiving a plant and stuffed bear from my partner? 2 weeks ago I attempted to break up with my partner. Over the last year we had a rough go of it. I realized most of our time was based on their time and I wasn’t being considered a lot of the time. Many times my wants and needs were put to the side for their sake. After trying couples therapy and individual therapy I started disconnecting still. I waiting for change and some changes were made but I was still feeling like what I wanted and needed did not matter. So after time I started choosing myself and I couldn’t shake the feeling of losing feelings towards my partner. I attempted to break up with them twice and we’ve discussed it more after that. We recently went to their therapist office and not mine where we originally started. It felt like they were trying very hard to convince me to give it another shot. I explained how it would be like all the other times and how it feels like if I do this then I’m once again putting my wants and needs aside for my partners sake. Any ways today I come home to a plant and bear on the table. My partner asks me if I notice anything different and I say yes and continue on with getting ready for my gym session after work. They didn’t take my response well..  they were definitely saddened that I was not enthusiastic about this gift. Not that I don’t appreciate it but how am I supposed to feel after the last few weeks we’ve had? So am I the a** h***? This feels like a last ditch effort. This would have been nice to receive during good times and not where we are now.

title: AITA for telling my mom she’s not my top priority rn?
body: so i (17f) got in an argument today w my mom (47f) she thinks we have a great bond while i dislike the way she acts towards me and try to back off. she was complaining abt the fact that she thinks that she’s “working for us” (me and my brother -13m-) while we don’t spend any time w her. we ofc help at home with the chores, so it wasn’t the fact that she’s always cleaning, doing the laundry… etc while we do nothing. so she told me this: “you say that you’re always studying but then you go out with your friends and you never do anything with me” (and a lot more complaints, my mom’s a self compassionate bitch). and tbh i just feel like i’m doing my job bcs:i study and get the best grades in my classi go out with my friends when i don’t have to studywhenever im feeling socially overwhelmed i have my own hobbies and play the videogames i like. so she replied: “so to you i’m like the last of your shitty priorities?” and i was like “no, ofc not, but you know well enough that my top priority is studying”. and i went on by saying “you’re always complaining about whatever i do. if it’s studying its bcs i study too much, if i hang out with my friends its bcs im out and not paying attention to you, if i stay home playing videogames i’m just an addicted piece of shit. she told me to stop exaggerating and to go fuck myself. imo, i feel im not her top priority either so she’s very hypocritical: she’s always working, if she isn’t at work she’s with her boyfriend or with her friends and she travels a lot. and whenever she’s at home she’s always in a shitty mood telling off both my brother and i. so aita for reacting like this??

title: AITA for overreacting to parenting criticism
body: I (33f) and my partner (39m) have a five month old baby. We've been together for almost a decade, married for three.Background on me: I was raised in a mildly abusive household, and I've dealt with depression for as long as I can remember. I was diagnosed with CPTSD, Bipolar II, and ADHD in my late twenties. I've been medicated for all these things for about four or five years, with no major issues.Background on him: normal dude.Despite the absolutely indescribable happiness that my daughter gives me, I have experienced an increase in depression and anxiety. I'm terrified of being a bad or neglectful mother, and I've confided in this to my partner. I don't feel like my daughter and I have developed a solid bond, and I've told him that I'm scared that people are judging my parenting skills and that she cries more when she's with me. When prompted to, he reassures me this isn't the case.The other day, on a good day, completely out of the blue (at least to me) my partner told me that I seemed overwhelmed by our daughter and asked if my BP or ADHD were contributing towards my lack of attention* of her, by making me delay my reaction to her crying. I tend to think too long about what might be making her cry rather than simply trying to stop the crying. He confirmed that she does cry more with me and said I don't do enough to try to keep her distracted. Sometimes I feed her her bottle with one hand and I am on my phone with the other and that makes him uncomfortable because I'm not giving her my full attention.He later said it was uncalled for and is acting like everything is normal again, but I just can't, and I can tell my distance from him is bothering him. I can't make myself be even just affectionately physical with him, and it's hard to be in the same room with him.But is it uncalled for? Am I overreacting? He really didn't say anything I hadn't felt or said before. AITA for giving him the cold shoulder and clinging to how I feel about that moment when he said those things, when it is all plausibly valid criticism?*edited for poor word choice
